Name: Bhindi, Bhindi tori
Uses: From the fruits a mucilaginous preparation is made which are considered benificial as plasma replacement or blood volume expander. The immature capsules  of the plant are used as demulcent,  diuretic and the seeds  of the plant are used as antispasmodic, cordial and stimulant.

Name: Ran Bhendi
Uses: The fruits of the plant have high content of vitamin C than Abelmoschus esculentus.

Name: Jangli Bhindi, Kantalo Bhendo (Guj.)
Uses: The bark of the plant is used as emmenagogue.

Name: Muskdana, Kasturi dana
Uses: The seed of the plant is musk scented and is known as- Ambrette seeds or Grams-d?Ambrett and is used as stimulant, tonic and carminative.

Name: Talish patra, Gobra salla (Nepal)
Uses: Leaves are carminative in nature and is, used for relieving cough and phthisis.

Name: Ulatkambal
Uses: For emmenagogue and  uterine tonic roots are used.  The leaves of the plant is used for diabetes, rheumatic pains, sinusitis and  uterine disorders. Cholesterol level in blood is reduced by using the fatty oil which is rich in linoleic acid obtained from the seeds of the plant.

Name: Ratti, Ghungchi
Uses: Glycyrrhizin the main constituent of liquorice is obtained from the roots and leaves and the decoction of it is given for coughs and colds. The roots of the plant is having diuretic, tonic, and emetic properties. The seeds of the plant is prescribed in infections of nervous system. The seed paste is applied locally in sciatica, stiffness of shoulder joints and paralysis. Protein which is extracted from the seeds shows anti-tumour activity on Yeshida s

Name: Barakanghi
Uses: The plant is employed as febrifuge, antiemetic, and anti-inflammatory and also used in urinary troubles and lumbago. The bark of the plant is having astringent and diuretic properties. Leaves extract is diuretic and demulcent. The roots of the plant used as a nervine tonic and antipyretic; also used in piles. It is also used with chaulmugra oil for leucoderma. The seeds  of the plant known as-Balbij are rich in mucilage and is having laxative and demu

Name: Kanghi, Kakahi
Uses: The plant is employed as febrifuge, antiemetic, and anti-inflammatory and also used in urinary troubles and lumbago. The bark of the plant is having astringent and diuretic properties. Leaves extract is diuretic and demulcent. The roots of the plant used as a nervine tonic and antipyretic; also used in piles. It is also used with chaulmugra oil for leucoderma. The seeds  of the plant known as-Balbij are rich in mucilage and is having laxative and demu

Name: Kakrai
Uses: The leaves of the plant containing the  mucilage is used in piles and pectoral.

Name: Indian Mallow (Eng.)
Uses: The decoction of seeds is used in dysentery and fistula, and also for sore eyes.

Name: Khair
Uses:
Cutch from wood powerful astringent used in urinary and
vaginal discharge, antidiarrhoeal,
haemostatic; used for treating
excessive mucous discharges,
haemorrhages, relaxed conditions
of gums, throat and mouth, stomatitis, irritable bowel; also used as an antileprotic drug.

Name: Vilayati kikar
Uses:
Bark used in stomatitis,
ulcers, swollen gums, dental
caries, bronchitis, skin diseases.

Name: Kikar, Babul (Punjab)
Uses: Bud and bark used in ringworm, other skin disease.

Name: Safed kikar, Arimeda
Uses:
Leaves antisyphilitic and antibacterial. Gum demulcent. Bark bitter, demulcent and
cooling used in biliousness and
bronchitis.

Name: Phulai (Punjab)
Uses: Tender twigs, cleared of thorns, are chewed to make brushes (Datoon) for cleaning teeth.

Name: Kirkar, Babula
Uses:
Stembark astringent,
spasmolytic, hypoglycaemic.
Gum demulcent (soothing agent
for inflammatory conditions of the respiratory, digestive and urinary tracts). Pods used in urogenital disorders. Seed oil antifungal.

Name: Aila, Biswal
Uses:
Bark antibilious, antiasthmatic.
Leaf stomachic, styptic (for bleeding gum), antiseptic (for
scalding of urine). A decoction of young leaves is taken for body pain, headache and fever.

Name: Kochi, Ritha
Uses:
Leaves an infusion is given in malarial fever. Pods and seeds decoction is used to remove
dandruff. An ointment is used for skin diseases. Bark extract is used in leprosy.

Name: Goradio-babul (Guj.)
Uses: Stembark antiinflammatory, spasmolytic. Root used for dysentery and urinary discharges.

Name: Aila
Uses:
Flower is used in emmenagogue.
Bark anti-inflammatory, antisepticused in skin diseases.

Name: Chinniaka (Tel.)
Uses:
Leaves are used to treat digestive troubles and its infusion is used as vulnerary.
 Leaf juice is used in ophthalmia.

Name: Kuppi, Khokli
Uses:
Decoction is used as laxative.The herb is used against severe cough associated with
 bleeding from the lungs (haemoptysis) and insipient phthisis. Leaf juice is employed
 for cutaneous troubles. Juice of fresh leaves are emetic and is useful in croup.

Name: Valia-kuppameni (Finnish)
Uses:
Decoction is used as laxative. The herb is used against severe cough associated with bleeding from 
the lungs (haemoptysis) and insipient phthisis. Leaf juice is  employed for treating  cutaneous troubles.
 Juice of fresh leaves is a reliable emetic, found useful in cases of croup.

Name: Alasyakampa (Tel.)
Uses: Roots used in rheumatism.

Name: Hargoza
Uses:
Leaves are used for fomentation in neuralgia and rheumatism. It is used as expectorant. 
Roots are used in treating asthma, paralysis, leuchorrhoea, debility.

Name: Gandana, Roojamari (Kan.)
Uses:
A decoction of it is given in colic. Contains the alkaloid achilline ; also yields an essential oil, used as a haemostatic. Herb considered
astringent, tonic, diaphoretic, vulnerary and styptic. Decoction of leaves carminative and stimulant.

Name: Latjira
Uses: Decoction of herb is diuretic and used in renal dropsies.

Name: Apamarga (Assam)
Uses:
Leaf is used in treating cholera, blisters in mouth. Whole plant is used in treating scrofula and 
whooping cough. Root is used to treat hemicrania and scorpion sting.

Name: Gobari (West Nepal)
Uses: Yields an alkaloid pseudaconitine

Name: Bikhima
Uses: The root extracts are used as a tonic in case of vomiting and bowel problems.

Name: Bisha, Ban-bal-nag (Kashmir)
Uses: Roots yield many medicinally important alkaloids.

Name: Bis (Gharwal)
Uses: Roots employed for treating nervous and digestive diseases , rheumatism and fevers.

Name: Atis
Uses: Roots are used for treating hysteria, throat infections, dyspepsia, vomiting, abdominal pain and diabetes.

Name: Kalo bikhoma (Sikkim)
Collector: Reporter on Economic Products to the Government of India
Uses: Root extracts used in commercial drugs.

Name: Mahoor
Uses: Used to treat neuralgia and rheumatism.

Name: Bikh or Bish (Nepal & Sikkim)
Collector: Reporter on Economic Products to the Government of India
Uses: Roots yield alkaloids which have antipyretic and analgesic properties.

Name: Tilia Kachang (Sutlej Basin)
Uses: Roots yield an alkaloid which is used as a tonic.

Name: Bach, Gora-bach
Uses: Rhizomes used in epilepsy and other mental ailments, chronic diarrhoea and dysentery, and glandular and abdominal tumours.

Name: Paowlay (Nepal)
Uses: Root and bark is applied to sores and ulcers.

Name: Vishaphala (Kan.)
Uses: Rhizome extract is used for nervous disorders, ovarian neuralgia and uterine tenderness.

Name: Morpankhi, Morshikha (Local names)
Uses: Stem and leaves used as styptic, antibacterial, antipyretic, also used in Gynaec complication, headache and dysent.

Name: Tudambo (Oriya)
Uses: In case of ordinary disorders leaves are utilized. The oil which made form the seed is ustilized for sprains.

Name: Gorak, Amli
Uses: The pulp of the fruits is diaphoretic,  and gives comfort in case of bronchial asthma and allergic dermatitis.

Name: Barigumchi, Kunchandana (Sans.)
Uses: The seeds as well as wood decoction is employed for pulmonary infections and in chronic ophthalmia it applied. The seeds of the plant show inhibitory activity against trypsin and a-chymotripsin, but if the seeds are subjected to heat it will loose its activity.

Name: Perumkorattaikodi (Tam.)
Scientific Name: Adenia wightiana (Wall. ex Wight & Arn.) Engl.
Uses: Roots and fruits are poisonous.

Name: Jangli-jira
Uses: The plant has antiseptic property, used in cuts, insects bite and in wounds.

Name: Hansraj, Mubaraka
Uses: The fern is used as a pectoral demulcent, expectorant and tonic. It is boiled in wine which is given in cases of hard tumours of the spleen, liver and other viscera.

Name: Mayurshikha (Sans.)
Uses: Used in hemicrania and diabetes.

Name: Kalijhant
Uses: Used in blood diseases and epileptic fits. In Bihar, the fern is used in cases of rabies. Rhizomes used for strangury and in fever due to elephantiasis. Fronds are burnt in oil and applied to itch.

Name: Mayir sikki (Tam.)
Uses: Used as an anodyne in bronchitis; also used against tumours, biliousness, inflammatory diseases of the chest, and ophthalmia.

Name: Summer Pheasant's Eye (Eng.)
Uses: Used as a Diuretic and cardiac stimulant. Flowers have laxative properties.

Name: Bel
Uses: Unripe or half ripe fruits are used as astringent, digestive, and stomachic; also used for diarrhoea and dysentery. Pulp aromatic and cooling, used in the form of sherbet. Marmelosin is the active constituent; it is used  as a laxative and diuretic, if used in strong doses act as cardiac depressant.

Name: Bur (Guj.)
Uses: Herb is diuretic and demulcent.

Name: Gorakhganja, Chaya (Beng.)
Uses: It is used in cough,sore throat, diabetes and lithiasis.Decoction is diuretic.

Name: Pangar
Uses: Fruits given to horses in colic. Oil from the seeds used in rheumatism.

Name: Maalati
Uses:
It is used as an ingredient of an Ayurvedic compound called Vishgarbha
 thaila which has anodyne and sedative properties and usedin paraplegia, sciatica and neuralgia.

Name: Bans-keora, Kantala
Uses: Plant also used as a fishpoison. Core of the plant used for ascites, dropsy, venereal sores, and dysentery.  Leaves used as laxative and emmenagogue, also given for scurvy; also syphilis, scrofula and cancer. Roots diuretic and diaphoretic.

Name: Chick-kuri (Local name)
Uses: Root is diuretic and anti-syphilitic. Sap is laxative, diuretic, emmenagogue and antiscorbutic.

Name: Kantala (Sans.)
Uses: Used in contusions of draught cattle.

Name: Sisal (Eng.)
Uses: Sap is also used for extraction of hecogenin. Juice of leaves ecbolic.

Name: Uchunti (Beng.)
Uses: Decoction or infusion used in diarrhoea, dysentery, colic with flatulence and other gastrointestinal ailments. Extract of flowers is useful in Asiatic form of Schwartz Leukaemia and prolonged the life-span of mice.Leaves styptic and vulnerary;

Name: Gandha priyangu, Yerraaduga (Tel.)
Collector: K.R. Keshava Murthy and S.B. Manohar
Uses: Roots and bark wxtract used in dysentery and skin problems and leaves in abdominal pain. Fruits and seeds given in uterine problems.

Name: Couch grass, Dog grass (Eng.)
Uses: Rhizomes diuretic and demulcent. Root juice used for cirrhous liver, tumours, and cancerous growths.

Name: Tree of Heaven (Eng.)
Uses: Bark is antispasmodic and parasiticidal, used as a powerful depressing influence on the nervous system similar to that of tobacco. Used in diarrhoea and dysentery; contain tannin 11%. Root bark may be recommended for cardiac troubles, epilepsy  and asthma.

Name: Arlu, Maruk
Uses: Bark is anthelmintic, antispasmodic, expectorant and febrifuge, used for asthma and bronchitis, dysentery. It is said to be a good substitute for kurchi bark (Holarrhenci antidysenterica Wall.), contains several quassinoids. Root barks yield alkaloids.

Name: Guggul Dhup
Uses: Bark is carminative, tonic and febrifuge. Juice is used for asthma, bronchitis an dysentery. Decoction is applied in typhoid and constipation. Tree produces a resin (mattipal) which is used in bronchitis and dysentery.

Name: Nilkanthi (Sans.)
Uses:
Leaves are used as stimulant, diuretic, astringent, febrifuge and useful in gout,
rheumatism, palsy, amenorrhoea,malaria. Leaves are substitute of quinine to control fever.

Name: Akola, Dhera
Uses:
Root bark used for cutaneous troubles;astringent, anthelmintic, purgative, emetic and diaphoretic. Also used forbiliousness and colic and as a substitute for ipecac (Cephaelis ipecacuanha A.Rich.). The bark exhibits antitubercular activity. It contains the alkaloid alangine which shows a selective action on the parasympathetic mechanism, the action being most marked on gastro-intestinal tract. Root extract shows hypotensive
action. Leaves are hypoglyc

Name: Lallei (Mar.)
Collector: Cecil J. Saldanha, K.R. Keshava Murthy, S.R. Ramesh
Uses: Flowers and leaves are applied in local inflammations, such as boils, erysipelas. It's cooling and useful in inflammatory infections.

Name: Siris
Uses:
The seeds used for ophthalmic
diseases; the oil extracted from them is considered useful in leprosy. The bark used in injuries to the eye.

Name: Kala siris
Uses: The bark applied externally, is used efficacious in the leprosy and in inveterate ulcers. The leaves boiled in ghi are used as a remedy for coughs.

Name: Candle Nut Tree (Eng.)
Uses: Oil obtained from seeds are purgative.

Name: Bharbharra, Jawasa
Uses: The plant contains laxative, diuretic, antibilious, and antiseptic properties. The twigs  of the plant  and also the flowers used for fumigation in piles. For cough decoction of twigs is used.  For swellings and abscesses decoction of roots are used. Twigs contain alkaloids which showed sympathomimetic activity. A sweet, sugary excretion, Alhagi manna, obtained from the plant is called Taranjabin and used as an expectorant, anti-emetic, and laxative.

Name: Bharbharra, Jawasa
Uses: The leaves of the plant is used in asthma and fever. The flower are employed for blood coagulant.

Name: Harkakra (Beng.)
Uses:
Leaves are used as cathartic. Bark and its decoction is administered as hydrogogue in 
ascites.

Name: Piyaz
Uses: Bulbs stimulant, diuretic and expectorant, used against flatulence and dysentery.

Name: Salabmisri
Uses: Tubers and fecula of the root are used in medicine.

Name: Utis
Uses: Bark is used to treat foot diseases.It is diuretic and reduce swelling of the leg.

Name: Utis
Uses: Bark is used on cut and wounds.

Name: Boro mankachu (Assam)
Uses: Leaf used as tringent, styptic, antitumour. Rootstock used as laxative, diuretic (in anasarca); used in inflammations and diseases of abdomen and spleen.

Name: Ghee-kunvar
Uses: Leaves are used in treatment of chronic ulcers. Fresh juice is useful in fevers and pulp is used on uterus; root is used in colic.

Name: Aloysia triphylla (Eng.)
Uses: It has carminative, stomachic, and stimulant properties.

Name: Kulanjan, Barakulanjan
Uses:
Rhizome used in rheumatism and bronchial catarrh; also considered stimulant and
carminative.

Name: Gong (Local name)
Uses: Rhizomes used in gout and colic.

Name: Chatium, Chattiyan
Uses:
Bark is bitter tonic, febrifuge, anthelmintic, galactagogue and used in the form of 
tincture for chronic diarrhea, asthma and cardiac troubles. It is used as haemostatic.
 Leaves are used in treatment of beri-beri, dropsy and congested liver. Latex is applied
 to sores, ulcers, tumours and rheumatic swellings. Ash of the plant is employed as 
caustic to open abscesses.

Name: Pazha Munnipala (Tam.)
Uses: Fruits are used in treatment of insanity and epilepsy.

Name: Gudari sag, Giojihra (Sans.)
Uses: It is used as galactogogue and to cure night-blindness.

Name: Marsh Mallow (Eng.)
Uses: The leaves of the plant is considered as  emollient and demulcent. The  mucilage of the roots is used in making absorbent pills and pastilles. .

Name: Holly-Hock (Eng.)
Uses: A red dye is obtained from the flowers which is used as an indicator in acidimetry and alkalimetry. Also it is considered as demulcent, diuretic, emollient,  and used in chest complaints.

Name: Silaras
Uses: Resin  known as Rasamala, obtained from this tree, is carminative, expectorant, stomachic, antiscorbutic, and antipyretic. Used inleucoderma, vesicular calculi, scabies, lumbago, menorrhagia, early stages of hydrocele, and renal and pulmonary troubles.

Name: Longleaf Alyce Clover (Eng.)
Scientific Name: Alysicarpus longifolius (Rottler ex Spreng.) Wight & Arn.
Uses: As a substitute for liquorice roots are used.

Name: Chauli, Sauri
Uses: The plant is used for bone fracture and pain in joints. The root of the plant is employed in antifertility. The roots of the plant is having expeectorant.

Name: Sada natya, Van natya
Collector: Economic collection Department of botanical survey to the
Uses: The plant is rich source of potassium nitrate.

Name: Lal sag, Chaulai sag
Uses: The tender shoots are rich source of  Vitamin A and Vitamin C.

Name: Tanduliya (Sans.)
Uses: The plant is utilized in snake-bite and scorpion-sting.

Name: Ram dana
Uses: It is used as pot herb.

Name: Kataili chaulai
Uses:
It is febrifuge and is used for eruptive fevers. It is used as lactagogue. Leaves 
are emollient. Infusion of shoots are used in eczema.

Name: Jangli Mehndi
Uses: The plant is used as a blistering agent.

Name: Dadmari
Uses: Leaves are bitter, stomachic, appetizer, laxative and aphrodisiac. The juices causes ulcers and blebs. leaves are used in raising blisters in rheumatic pains, fevers.

Name: Toothpick plant (Eng.)
Uses: Fruits are used as  mild stomachic and carminative in flatulent colic.

Name: Morang elaichi
Uses: Seeds yield a medicinal oil and it acts as a stomachic, used to allay irritation of the stomach produced either by cholera or some other infections.

Name: Bari elachi, Baara aliach (Beng.)
Uses: Seeds oil used as stomachic, allay irritation of the stomach produced either by cholera or some other infections.

Name: Suranakanda, Jamikanda
Uses: Plant used in cholera, constip, earache, inflam throat, respir compl, pimples. Corm used in  piles; also in vetenary medicine as gastric.

Name: Kauraj
Uses: Sliced and dried tuberous roots marketed as "Chamar-musli" useful as astringent and refrigerant.

Name: Jangli-angur
Uses: Root-juice  is used for depurative, aperient and diuretic, eye troubles and also for ulcers.

Name: Panibel
Uses: Juice of tender leaves used in dental and as a detergent for indolent ulcers. Decoction of roots given in dysentery.

Name: Atukulabadda (Tel.)
Uses: For haemorrhoids roots and bark are used. Roots are applied on swellings.

Name: Kaju
Uses:
Karnel eaten for its high protein content. Cashew apple antiscorbutic. Resinous
juice contained in the seeds used in cases of mental derangement, memory disturbances, palpitation of heart, rheumatic pericarditis,
sexual debility.

Name: Jonkmari
Uses:
Herb is used for treating dropsy, leprosy, hydrophobia, mania and other cerebral
 infections. It is effective against Ranikhet virus.

Name: Kakamari (Sans.)
Uses: The berry is good expectorant which removes gases from the intestines, good for rheumatism and aplied in inflamation.

Name: Kazudhachakka (Mal.)
Uses: Juice from ripe fruits is diuretic and antiscorbutic; unripe fruits purgative and abortifacient.

Name: Raktaskandana (Sans.)
Uses: Fresh leaves applied to wounds and cuts in the form of plaster.

Name: Birkubat
Uses:
Juice is used as febrifuge.
 Plant is astringent, anodyne, tonic and alexipharmic and used in treatment of dysentery,cholera, diabetes, consumption, influenza, bronchitis, itches and piles. Decoction is used for treating sluggishness of liver and in jaundice. Leave and roots are used as febrifuge, cholagogue and anthelmintic.

Name: Kirayat
Uses: Plant is astringent, anodyne, tonic and alexipharmic and used in treatment of dysentery,cholera, diabetes, consumption, influenza, bronchitis, itches and piles. Decoction is used for treating sluggishness of liver and in jaundice. Leave and roots are used as febrifuge, cholagogue and anthelmintic.

Name: Kafir (Eng.)
Uses: Grains used in demulcent, diuretic.

Name: Narcissus anemone (Eng.)
Uses: Plant used in treating skin problems.

Name: Ageli (Jaunsar)
Uses: Root extract is used for concussions and seed oil is used in treating rheumatism

Name: Garden Angelica (Eng.)
Uses: Mericarps are aromatic, stimulant and carminative, used in chest and kidney disease. mildly carminative.

Name: Potupala (Sinhalese)
Uses: Juice is given in bilious dyspepsia and seeds are used as a purgative

Name: Ajapada (Sans.)
Uses:
Fresh juice of the leaves are  mixed with sugarcandy and is given to children to cure cough.
 It is mixed with sugar and gingelly oil and it forms a cooling liniment for the head. Leaves and stems are used as infusion in cough and cold.

Name: Gobura
Uses: Herb is used as astringent and carminative. Essential oil is used in treating uterine infections.

Name: Chodhara (Mar.)
Uses:
Infusion of leaves are used in dyspepsia and fever accompanying teething in children.
 Decoction of plant or essential oil is used in treating rheumatism.

Name: Mamphal (Mar.)
Uses: Leaves and flowers used in treating kidney problems and  bark is purgative.

Name: Nona (Beng.)
Uses: It has antihelminthic and astringent properties.

Name: Sharifa
Uses: Roots are purgative and seeds abortifacient

Name: Kavali (Mar.)
Uses: Roots are emetic, diaphoretic and expectorant and useful in treating amoebic dysentery

Name: Dhawa, Dhaura
Scientific Name: Anogeissus latifolia (Roxb.ex. DC.) Wall. ex. Guill. & Perr.
Uses: Tree produces a gum, a good substitute for Gum Arabic, used in pharmaceutical preparations.

Name: Dog-fennel (Eng.)
Uses: Used as an adulterant of Anthemis nobilis.

Name: Roman Chamomile (Eng.)
Uses: Dried flower-heads are carminative, stimulant and nervine tonic. An infusion called Chamomile tea is given for indigestion.

Name: Sweet Vernal Grass (Eng.)
Uses: Yields an essential oil used in perfumery; aromatic odour is due to coumarin.

Name: French Parsley (Eng.)
Uses: Used as abortifacient; also applied to dressing sores.

Name: Karwat (Mar.)
Uses:
Acts as a cardiac and circulatory stimulant. Intestinal and uterine contraction stimulator.
Seeds used in dysentery.

Name: Amati (Mar.)
Uses: Leaves are diaphoretic.

Name: Kuravankanda (Local name)
Uses:
Mature roots used in treatment of  dysentery and cholera.
An ointment is  prepared from the plant  which is beneficial for  chronic sores and ulcers.

Name: Harin-harra
Uses: Seeds have laxative and anthelmintic properties and bark has astringent properties, which is employed in treating liver and spleen diseases, abdominal complaints and tumours and also used in treating rheumatism.

Name: Shalari, Ajmud
Uses: It is used in liver and stomach complaints.

Name: Common Columbine (Eng.)
Uses: It has diuretic, diaphoretic, antiscorbutic, and tranquilizing properties. Roots are used in removing kidney stones

Name: Mung-phali
Uses: The groundnut oil or Arachis oil has both medicinal and alimentary use and is a good substitute for olive salad or almond oil, the latter of which it is said to adulterate. The hay of the plant is very nutritious, is used for increasing the milk of cows.

Name: Bharti, Bhartoi
Uses: Leaf is used to cure snake and scorpion bite.

Name: Jangli Kuth, Burdock (Eng.)
Uses: Roots are diuretic and diaphoretic, useful in gout and skin infections. Tincture of seeds used for psoriasis, acne, and prurigo.

Name: Dhan-priya
Uses: Roots are used in treating rheumatism, fever and diarrhea.

Name: Supari, Chaali
Uses: Whole plant used in cholera, colic, dysent, small pox, vener dis; leaf in leucor. Roots are used in liver disease.

Name: wild areca palm (Eng.)
Uses: Fruits substituted for areca nuts.

Name: Sugar palm (Eng.)
Uses: Used as fish poison.

Name: Bharbhand
Uses: When the plant is injured, a yellow exudes  which comes out is used in  ophthalmia and scabies. A  bitter, nauseous, non-edible oil is obtained from the seeds is used in cutaneous troubles and is considered as cathartic.

Name: Mhalungi (Mar.)
Uses: Leaf extract used in diabetes treatment.

Name: Errakuta (Tel.)
Uses: Leaf paste is applied to the neck region for curing cough and quinsy.

Name: Samudrasokha, Ghavapatta
Uses: Used in treatment of gleet, gonorrhoea, strangury and ulcers. Leaf extraxt is used in cases  of skin troubles. Roots are diuretic and aphrodisiac and used in treatment of  rheumatism and nervous diseases

Name: Pambucholam (Malayalam)
Uses: Corms used as medicine.

Name: Samo-ki-khumb, Kiralu( Punjab)
Uses: Roots given to the sheep for colic; also used for killing worms in cattle.

Name: Bagh Jandhra, Lin Cheisu (Manipuri)
Uses: Roots used to kill worms which infest cattle.

Name: sixweeks threeawn (Eng.)
Uses: Flowers used in itching and ringworm.

Name: Kitamari
Uses:
It is purgative and anthelmintic. Bruised leaves are mixed with castor oil and applied to control eczema.  
Decoction of roots are found efficacious in expulsion of round worms.

Name: Ishvari mul (Sans.)
Uses:
Roots and rhizomes are used as a gastric stimulant and bitter tonic. 
The chief active principle of the drug being aristolochic acid is used for stimulating phagocytosis
 in infectious diseases in formulation with antibiotics.
Juice of leaves are  used for cough, and seeds for inflammations and biliousness.

Name: Nallayiswari (Tel.)
Collector: Cecil J. Saldanha and S.R. Ramesh
Uses: It is carminative, tonic and emmenagogue.

Name: Kashmiri kahzaban (Kashmir)
Uses: It has stimulant, tonic, diuretic and expectorant properties.

Name: Laljiri (Garhwal), Aam (Ladh.)
Uses: Used for tooth and ear-ache and applied to eruptions. It has anticancer properties.

Name: Leopard's bane (Eng.)
Uses: Dried flower are heads used as a tonic, irritant and vulnerary; contains arnicin and an essential oil. Arnica root consists of dried rhizomes land roots, used for the same purposes as dried flower heads; their tincture is used for sprains and bruises.

Name: Hara Champaka (Sans.)
Uses: Leaves have antifertility principle.

Name: Koluvaravalli (Mal.)
Uses: Bark Decoction used as an emmenagogue, and after parturition

Name: Kokilaksha (Sans.)
Uses: Used in preparing contraceptive medicines.

Name: Vilayathi afsanthin
Uses: Main source of the drug named Afsanteen, which consists of twigs, leaves, and flower-heads, and used in chronic fever, swellings, and inflammation of liver; also employed as a tonic and stimulant. Herb yields an essential oil called Absinthe or Wormwood Oil which has a tonic effect on digestive organs; also used externally in rheumatism. Seeds yield a fatty oil. Herb is the best source of azulene.

Name: Dragon Mugwort (Eng.)
Uses: Leaves has aperient, stomachic, stimulant, and febrifugic properties.

Name: Nagdona (Hindi)
Uses:
Leaf infusion is used in asthma, nervous and spasmodic infections. Roots are employed as
tonic and antiseptic.

Name: Kirmala
Uses:
Alkaloid santonin is extracted from unopened flower heads. Santonin is used as an anthelmintic, particularly effective against round
worms. Herb used as a stomachic and laxative. Decoction used as a febrifuge. Contains an essential oil.

Name: Nagdona
Uses: Leaves and flowering tops are used in asthma. Much allied to A. vulgaris Linn and known by the same name Nagdona. Yields an essential oil.

Name: Pardesi davano (Guj.)
Uses: Plant is used as tonic, febrifuge, and vermifuge.

Name: Roxburgh's Wormwood (Eng.)
Uses: Leaves and flowers yield an essential oil having thujone-like flavour.

Name: Burmack (Ladakh)
Uses: Herb is given to horses in infections of the head. Leaves used for abdominal pains. Yields an essential oil containing cineol and camphor.

Name: Seeta-bani, Jhau
Uses: Plant produces an infusion used as a purgative. Flowering tops yield an essential oil

Name: Kaadu davana (Kan.)
Uses: Sieversinin present in the herb possesses antimicrobial activity. Plant is a good source of chamazulene.

Name: Machola
Uses: Reduces pain in case of scorpion sting.

Name: Kathal
Uses: Leaves antihelminthic and used in various skin infections, sores, burns and toothache. Latex used in relieving stomach ache.

Name: Barhal
Uses: Used as a masticatory medicine.

Name: Bara nal
Uses:
Rhizome used as sudorific,
emollient, diuretic, antilactant,
antidropsical; uterine stimulant
(stimulates menstrual discharge), hypotensive.

Name: Kakatundi, Kakanasika
Uses:
Roots are emetic and cathartic and used in treatment of piles and gonorrhea. Juice of 
leaves are anthelmintic, anti dysenteric and sudorific and used against cancer.

Name: Satavar
Uses: Tubers used as cooling, demulcent and diaphoretic

Name: Allipalli (Punj.)
Scientific Name: Asparagus filicinus Buch.-Ham ex D. Don
Uses: Used as astringent and tonic; also diuretic.

Name: Sadaveri (Local name)
Uses: Used in skin troubles.

Name: Marchuba, Paragus, Vilayati Karua, Nakdown, Margiyeh, Halyun
Uses:
Stem contains asparagine
which is diuretic and used in cardiac dropsy and chronic gout.

Name: Satawar, Satmuli (Beng.)
Uses: Herb used as tonic, diuretic, and galactagogue. Root juice is mixed with honey and given for dyspepsia; roots oils used for nervous and rheumatic complaints.

Name: Black Spleenwort (Eng.)
Uses:
Bitter, diuretic, laxative and used in diseases of spleen and jaundice, and also to produce sterility in women. Rhizomes
anthelmintic.

Name: Garmezu (Chitral)
Uses: Yields a gum used as a substitute for tragacanth. Naturally exuding gum is of inferior quality, but gum obtained by making incisions on the plant compares well with tragacanth.

Name: Ogai (Punjab)
Uses: Seeds are ussed as demulcent and emollient.

Name: Lavana-valli (Sans.)
Uses: Juice of the plant is administered to children suffering from swellings and rheumatism.

Name: Korake, Surake
Collector: Economic collection Department of botanical survey to the
Uses: Leaves and seeds have diuretic and emollient properties and employed in pulmonary troubles.

Name: Indian Atropa (Eng.)
Uses: Root and leaf extract has  narcotic, sedative, and diuretic properties.

Name: Angur Shefa
Uses: Dried root and leaf extract is used as a sedative, antispasmodic, and anodyne. Used as a mydriatic  to dilate pupils in ophthalmology. Leaves have stimulant and narcotic properties.

Name: Bnkulthi, Birghore (Local names)
Uses: The plant is used to improve baldness and for gastric problems. It is used for burns, gonor, night fever, pain in leg, dropsy and dysentry. The leaves of the plant is used for cholera,  child birth, and in post natal cases.

Name: Common wild oat (Eng.)
Uses: Used in the treatment of Diabetes and Dietetic treatment.

Name: Common Oat (Eng.)
Uses: Used as for rich in fat and protein, nutrients.

Name: Tree Sorrel (Eng.)
Uses: The plant is astrigent, stmachic and  refrigant. Syrup of the fruit is prescribed in inflamation.

Name: Bina
Collector: Cecil J. Saldanha, S.R. Ramesh and N.S. Ravindra
Uses: Green fruits are made into poultice for boils.

Name: Nim
Uses: Bark is employed in skin troubles. Leaves have antiseptic properties and applied to boils, ulcers and eczema.  Flowers are tonic and stomachic and Berries are purgative and emollient.

Name: Jangli bhendi, Bankapasi
Uses: Roots and fruits are employed for gonorrhoea and syphilis.Floralparts applied for cutaneous diseases.

Name: Kantagur-kamai
Uses: Juice of the leaves are used to relieve cough in phthisis and in asthma.

Name: Nira-brahmi
Uses: Commonly said to have properties that  improve intellect,  and cures insanity and other nervous diseases.

Name: Hingan, Hingot
Uses: Unripe fruits are used as cathartic. Ripe fruits are used for whooping cough and skin troubles. Bark is anthelmintic. Seeds are expectorant, used in whooping cough and for colic. Seeds  extract is hypotensive.

Name: Danti
Uses:
Seeds are purgative. Oil from the seeds are a powerful hydrogogue cathartic. 
It is used externally to treat rheumatism. Roots are purgative.

Name: Kalak (Local name)
Uses:
Leaf emmenagogue, antileprotic, febrifuge, bechic; used in haemoptysis. Stem and leaf blood purifier (used in leucoderma and inflammatory
conditions). Root poisonous. Burnt root is applied to ringworm, bleeding gums, painful joints. Bark used for eruptions.

Name: Liksura (Sans.)
Uses: Leaves and roots are used to treat cough and inflammation.

Name: Chethasahacharam (Sans.)
Uses: Leaves and roots are used to treat cough and inflammations.

Name: Nil jhinti
Uses: Leaves and roots are used to treat cough and inflammation.

Name: Ekakantaka (Sans.)
Uses: Leaves and roots are used to treat cough and inflammations.

Name: Naga gorinta (Telugu)
Uses: Decoction is used as substitute for human milk

Name: Jhinti, Katsareya
Uses:
Juice of the leaves are given with honey to treat catarrhal infection of children.
 A paste of the roots is applied to treat boils and glandular swellings. Leaves are chewed to relieve tooth-ache. Roots are febrifuge.

Name: Neelakurantak (Sans.)
Uses: Leaves and roots are used to treat cough and inflammations.

Name: Hijjal
Uses: Powdered seeds are used as  emetic and expectorant. Leaves and roots produces bitter tonics.

Name: Samudraphala (Sans.)
Uses: Plant produces a medicine used in diarrhoea and dysentery.

Name: Poi, Safedbachla
Uses: Leaf juice is used in relieving constipation especially in pregnant women and children.

Name: Amli, Amlosa
Uses: Young shoots and leaves eaten.

Name: Khairwal
Uses:
Bark astringent, antidiarrhoeal.
Extract of stems are used internally and externally for fractured bones. Plant is used in goitre and antithyroid.

Name: Kachnal, Ashta
Uses:
Bark used in glandular inflammations, skin diseases, ulcers, cholagogue. Leaves anthelmintic; with onion
for diarrhoea. Seed antibacterial.

Name: Semla
Uses: Gum used as an external application for sores . Protein isolated from seeds and used in diabetic.

Name: Maljan
Uses: Seeds eaten raw or fried; when ripe they taste like cashewnuts.

Name: Kachnar
Uses: Buds used in piles (also used against tumours), haematuria, menorrhagia. Dried buds are used in diarrhoea, dysentery, worm infestation, piles and tumours. Root used in dyspepsia, flatulence and use to prevent obesity. Bark used externally in scrofula and skin diseases. Seeds possess human blood agglutinating activity. Leaf use as antifungal.

Name: King Begonia (Eng.)
Uses: Juice poisonous to leeches.Leaves contain rutin.

Name: Petha
Uses: Decoction of fruit used as laxative and styptic, applied for respiratory troubles and interna] haemorrhages. An Ayurvedic medicine (Kushmanda lehyam) is made from it and used  for consumption, piles, dyspepsia and diabetes.

Name: Chitra, Daruhald
Uses: A bitter tonic made from the  dried stems is used for intermittent fevers. An alkaloid- berberine is contain in the root-bark.

Name: Kilmora (Kumaun)
Uses: Fruits used as laxative for children. The plant contains an alkaloid- Berberine. One of the  principal sources of Rasaut is the root which is used as a household remedy and is also used as aperient, carminative, blood purifier and febrifuge.

Name: Kasmal (Simla)
Collector: H. Hara, H. Kurosawa, T. Tuyama
Uses: Fruits used as laxative for children. The plant contains an alkaloid- Berberine.

Name: Kasmal (Simla)
Uses: A root extract known as- Rasaut is an important drug in indigenous medicine.The plant is used both locally and internally in case of haemorrhoids.  In bleeding piles, rasaut along with with butter is given in doses of 10 to 30 grains; rasaut is also considered as bitter tonic and as a febrifuge. In acute conjunctivitis rasaut is mixed with butter and alum and is applied excernally on the eyelids. Rasaut is mixed with camphor and butter and applied as

Name: Kameti (Kumaun)
Uses: The various parts of the plant are used as febrifuge.

Name: Gangharaw (Guj.)
Uses: Used for fractures. A poultice of leaves applied to sores.

Name: Chukandar
Uses: Juice of the root is sniffed up the nose for headache and toothache ; juice o f the white beet is good for liver. Applied to the temples it stops inflammation o f eyes. Mixed with oil and alum 11 !s good fo r burns. A decoction o f the root is given in doses o f half to one tumblerful at bedtime or early morning an hour before breakfast, in cases o f habitual constipation and haemorrhoids with much benefit. The red beet is valuable in uterin diseases.

Name: Bhojpatra
Uses: It is used in treating snake bites.

Name: Bhojpatra
Uses: Infusion of the bark is used as antiseptic and is carminative.

Name: Threelobe Beggar Tick (Eng.)
Uses: Plant is used as an diuretic, astringent, antiscorbutic, diaphoretic,  emmenagogue,  sedative  and narcotic also used in dropsy, gout, haematuria, chronic dysentery, and eczema. Seeds are used as an emmenagogue, expectorant and diuretic also used for stones in kidneys and gall-bladder.

Name: Lajalu
Uses: Decoction of leaves are used in treatment of diabetes, phthisis and asthma. Leaves poses an insuline-like property used as stimulant and tonic, used in treatment of  inflammatory tumours, chest complaints, convulsions, cramps. Ash along with lime juice is used to cure stomach ache. Roots and leaves styptic.

Name: Paniala
Uses: Bark is used to treat throat troubles.

Name: Latkan
Uses: For gonorrhoea root-bark and seeds comprises a good remedy. In case of uncomplicated intermittent, remittent and continued fevers  root-bark is used. Also in absence as well as presence of intermittent cases of fever decoction of seeds is given.  For jaundice and snake-bite leaves are used.

Name: Haththazori
Uses: Rhizomes used in urinary disorders and as ananthelmintic.

Name: Chaupatia
Collector: Reporter on Economic Products to the Government of India
Uses:
Leaves are tonic, aphrodisiac and purgative. It is used in treating disorders of liver,
 spleen for ascites, leucoderma, throat inflammation,asthma and nasal haemorrhage. Root is diuretic and used in treating urinary discharges, irregular menstruation. Seeds are expectorant, diuretic.

Name: Kolimukkan chedi (Tamil)
Uses: Seeds are used as tonic.

Name: Akee (Eng.)
Uses:
Fruits used in vomiting sickness. Arils from underdeveloped or unripe fruits also toxic. Fruit-husk contains sapogenin.
Pulped bark used as a liniment.

Name: Kakaronda
Uses: Leaf extract reduces blood pressure, dilation of blood vessels and inhibition of sympathetic nervous system. It  is also used in over excitement and insomnia.

Name: Grand Blumea (Eng.)
Uses: Herb produces an essential oil containing camphor

Name: Nimurdi (Mar.)
Uses: Herb produces an essential oil with camphor-like smell.

Name: Kakranda
Uses: Herb produces an essential oil containing Blumea Camphor. Juice of the leaves useful as an anthelmintic, particularly against threadworms. Herb  used as a febrifuge, diuretic and antiscorbutic.

Name: Tera paibi macha (Manipuri)
Uses: Plant produces a medicine applied in body pain.

Name: Kankura (Beng.)
Uses:
Root is antibacterial and diuretic. It is used in treatment of threatened abortion, Colic of 
pregnancy, metroptois, metritis, haemorrhoids, leucorrhoea, pollakuria. Fresh root is pounded
and applied externally as poultice. Decoction of root is used as a wash for septic wounds.

Name: Sant
Uses: The white variety of root is used in treating oedema,anaemia, heart disease, cough and intestinal colic. The red variety of root is used in treating oedema, haemorrhage,anaemia, biliousness.

Name: Semal, Semul (Beng.)
Uses: The bark of the plant is used as demulcent, styptic  and tonic. The fruits of the plant is having  expectorant, diuretic  and stimulant properties and is used in calculus infections and ulceration of bladder and kidneys.  A gum known as-Mocharus is obtained form the tree which used as demulcent, styptic and tonic.

Name: Tar
Uses:
Fresh sap used as diuretic, cooling, antiphlegmatic, laxative, antiinflammatory.
Slightly fermented juice is given in diabetes. Ash of dry
spadix antacid, antibilious (used
in heartburn).

Name: Guthari, Madanaghanta (Sans.)
Uses: Herb is rich in calcium and phosphorus. Extract of leaves given for haemorrhoids and gall-stones. Seeds demulcent, used in diarrhoea and dysentery.

Name: Salai
Uses: Bark employed in diarrhoea and skin troubles, pulmonary infections and cutaneous troubles.

Name: Moonwort (Eng.)
Uses: Used for cuts, wounds, ruptures and dysentery. Juice of roots and fronds used for breast cancer.

Name: Rattle snake fern (Eng.)
Uses: Used in dysentery.

Name: Asal rai, Laha
Uses: Leaves of the plant  are rich source of calcium,  iron, phosphorus and vitamin-B. Leaves are pickled in brine or eaten.

Name: Banarasi rai
Collector: O. Polunin, W.R. Sykes and L.J.H. Williams
Uses: Useful as an emetic in case of narcotic poisoning the seeds are given with warm water. Volatile oil derived the seeds is utilized  as a counter irritant and rubefacient and for pneumonia and  pleurisy.

Name: Chitki (Beng.)
Uses: Leaves are applied as poultice to hasten suppuration.

Name: Chitki (Beng.)
Uses: Leaves are applied as poultice to hasten suppuration.

Name: Tikhar
Uses:
Leaves are used as poultice to hasten suppuration. Leaf juice is applied after parturition 
to prevent haemorrhage. Dried leaves are used to treat tonsillitis.Astringent bark guard against haemorrhage.

Name: Khaja, Gondui
Uses: Bark is astringent and anthelmintic.

Name: Soft brome (Eng.)
Uses: Grains toxic, causing giddiness in both man and animals, and are fatal to poultry.

Name: Chinese Sumac (Eng.)
Uses: Fruits are used for diarrhoea and dysentery, also found useful against malignant malaria. Poultice of leaves applied in skin troubles. Roots used in bowel complaints. Seeds contain brucein A,B,C,D,E and G; bruceoside A and B; kosamine; yatanoside; alkaloids brucamarine and yatanine; and other compounds. Bruceoside-A and -B are potent antileukaemic glucosides; brucein-D showed significant activity against Walker 256 carcinosarcoma in rats; and yatancin

Name: Gorgu-naru, Mala (Beng.)
Uses: Herb useful as  bitter tonic and febrifuge.

Name: Zakhm-haiyat
Uses:
Toasted leaves are applied to wounds, bruises, boils, bites of venomous insects, swelling . Toasted leaves
 are used for discolouration of the affected part and the healing of injured portion's is accelerated. In the
 form of poultice and powder it is applied to sloughing ulcers.

Name: Piyar, Chironji
Uses: Kernel an ointment made out of the kernels is used to cure itch of the skin and to remove blemishes from the face. Oil from kernels used to glandular swellings of the neck.

Name: Neemda
Uses: Roots are used in the preparation of a fermented liquor.

Name: Siah-zirah, Kala-zirah
Uses: Fruits (Ajowan, omum) are used as a stimulant, antispasmodic, tonic, and carminative, administered in flatulence, atonic dyspepsia and diarrhea and also often recommended in cholera. Ajowan is useful for relaxed sore throat and bronchitis and is a common ingredient of cough mixtures. A paste of crushed fruits is applied to the abdomen externally for relief from colic. It shows antibiotic activity and is used in lotions and ointments applied for checki

Name: Dhak, Palas (Beng.)
Uses: As astringent used for piles, tumours and menstrual disorders bark is used. Tree yields a gum called Butea gum or Bengal kino which is astringent and used in diarrhoea. Flowers yield a brilliant but very fugitive yellow when the seeds are pounded with lemon juice, they act as a powerful rubefacient and have been successfully used as a cure for a form of herpes called Dhobie?s itch.

Name: Maulo, Bando
Uses: For dropsy and bowel complaints decoction of bark is given.

Name: Palas lata
Uses: A gum which exhudes from the tree is used in tonics, and poultices. The shoot decoction of shoots is considered emollient and sedative and  used in piles. The seeds is having  sedative and anthelmintic properties.

Name: Chikri, Papri
Uses:
Leaves are purgative amd diaphoretic. It is used in treating rheumatism and syphilis.
 Tincture of the bark is employed as febrifuge.

Name: Kambraj (Beng.)
Uses: The grinded root-stock used on swellings; aslo in cholera and diarrhoea it is is used in combination with other drugs.

Name: Kodhab
Uses: The leaves and roots contains anthelmintic and deobstruent properties, for uterine obstructions the decoction is used. The leaves possess an alkaloid, it is used also as poultice on sores.

Name: Balaya (Sans.)
Uses: The leaves and roots possess antiphlogistic and purgative properties, it is used in rheumatism.

Name: Kantikaranjua, Kat-karanj
Uses:
Seed Roasted and used
as an antidiabetic preparation.
Leaf, bark and seed febrifuge.
Leaf and bark emmenagogue,
anthelmintic. Root diuretic,
anticalculous.

Name: Dividivi (Tel.)
Uses: Pods used to stop bleeding in piles.

Name: Karanju, Katkaranj
Uses: Fruits tonic and antipyretic. Seeds yield a fatiy oil, used as a cosmetic and for discharges from the ear. Seeds employed for colic.

Name: Vakeri-mul
Uses: Root astringent and antipyretic, used in phthisis and scrofulous infections.

Name: Guletura
Uses:
Leaves laxative, antipyretic.
used in erysipelas. Flowers anthelmintic. Also used for cough and catarrh. Root used
in intermittent fevers. Bark use as in emmenagogue, abortifacient.

Name: Bakam, Patang
Uses: Wood decoction used in skin diseases, dysentery and diarrhoea.

Name: Arhar, Tur
Uses: Rich source of proteins, used as dal. Contains two globulins proteins cajamn and concajanin.

Name: Arichural (Malayalam)
Uses: Used in chronic fevers, piles, abdominal tumours, strangury, antibilious, spasmolytic.

Name: Kattuchooral (Malayalam)
Uses:
Leaves used in biliousness, worms, dyspepsia
and ear-disease.

Name: Zergul (Punjab)
Uses: Plants are used as diaphoretic, diuretic and stimulant. Capitula is used as an adulterant of saffaron, contain calendulin.

Name: Khoja (Assam)
Uses: Decoction of bark is used to treat cutaneous ailments.

Name: Dieng-soh-kait-lang (Khasi Hills)
Uses: Decoction prescribed for colic and febrifuge. Roots are used to treat diarrhea.

Name: Daya, Priyangu
Uses:
Roots yield an aromatic oil which is used in stomach disorders. Leaves are warmed 
and applied to rheumatic joints.

Name: Bastra
Uses:
Decoction of the bark is used for treating skin troubles, hepatic obstructions and fever
. Leaves are boiled in milk and used as wash for apthae of mouth.

Name: Phog
Uses: Root decoction is used for relieving sore gums and as a gargle.

Name: Bottle Brush (Eng.)
Uses: Leaves produces an essential oil.

Name: Bobbi (Mar.)
Uses: The drug obtained from the plant comprises of  bitter oil  and resin, and act as anodyne  and antiphlogistic. From the seed an oil is obtained which is useful in  cutaneous infections and leprosy.

Name: Sultanachampa
Uses: A  fixed oil is obtained from the seeds of the plant which is  externally applied in skin infections and rheumatism. In case of orchites the grounded bark is applied. The juice of the plant is  used as a purgative. A decoction of the plant is used for indolent ulcers. A resin is obtained from the tree which considered as purgativeand emetic.

Name: Ak
Uses: It is used in treatment of piles, aches,skin, dropsy and anthelmintic.

Name: Akada, Akavana
Uses: Root-bark is used for treatment of leprosy.

Name: Mumiri (Punjab)
Uses: Roots yield helleborin and veratrin.

Name: Kokaray
Uses: Leaves astringent, laxative and anthelmintic, used in colic and applied to ulcers. In Cambodia (Kampuchea), twigs and leaves considered tonic and depurative.

Name: Kissi (Nepal)
Uses: The root of the plant is used for skin diseases.

Name: Cha, Chai
Uses: The leaves contains caffein and is used as stimulant all over the globe. As an astringent, diuretic,  nervine  and stimulant tea  is being used. In conjunctivitis the infusion of tea is used.

Name: Karumugai (Tam.)
Uses: An essential oil is extracted from the flower known as Ylang-Ylang oil.

Name: Bara Sem, Sufed Kadsumbal
Uses: To cure enlargement of liver, the root is grounded into paste with cows urine and administered internally for consecutive days.

Name: Sabbajaya, Sarvajjaya
Uses: Roots diaphoretic and diuretic.

Name: Bhang, Ganja
Uses: Dried flowering tops of female plants are used as sedative, analgesic.

Name: Sankhaphuli
Uses: Fresh juice prescribed in insanity, epilepsy and nervous debility.

Name: Kyoukpan (Burma)
Scientific Name: Canscora diffusa (Vahl) R.Br. ex. Roem. & Schult.
Uses: Fresh juice prescribed in insanity, epilepsy and nervous debility. Used as a substitute of Canscora decussata.

Name: Arsul (Mar.)
Uses: Bark employed as a febrifuge and applied externally to fractures.

Name: Kurrel, Karer
Uses: Fruit are very useful in biliousness and cardiac troubles. The bark of the plant is diaphoretic  and alexiteric which is used in cough and asthma.

Name: Kauntel (Mar.)
Uses: Infusion of bark and leaves are given for eruptions  and swellings.

Name: Chaymka
Uses: The flowers of the plant used as laxative. For rheumatism leaves are used.

Name: Kaliakara (Ben.)
Uses: Accredited with febrifugal and to.nic properties; also found useful for skin troubles.

Name: Kabra
Uses: Flower buds are useful in scurvy. The bark of the plant is having diuretic, expectorant, and tonic properties, useful in infections of liver, paralysis, rheumatism and tubercular glands.

Name: Ardanda
Uses: The root-bark is used in cholera which are having sedative and stomachic properties.

Name: Shepherd's purse (Eng.)
Uses: It is used for troubles of eyes and for dysentery. The plant is also employed for diuretic, febrifuge and haemostatic.

Name: Lalmirch, Gachmarich
Uses: Fruit extract is used in treatment of lumbago, neuralgia and rheumatism

Name: Bird Chilli (Eng.)
Uses: Yields capsicin.

Name: Kierpa (Beng.)
Uses: Leaves are used for the preparation of a tea like beverage.seeds yield an edible oil.no medicinal vaule found.

Name: Pussur
Uses: Bark is astringent and useful in treating dysentery, diarrhoea and other abdominal problems.

Name: Kanphuti
Uses: Leaves rubefacient, used as poultice in rheumatism. Roots diuretic, diaphoretic, emetic emmenagogue and laxative; used for rheumatism, lumbago, and nervous diseases; however, herb was not found effective in chronic rheumatism.

Name: Gulibadaward (Kashmir)
Uses: Flowers are considered a febrifuge

Name: Kumbi
Uses: Medicine prepared from the bark is used in blood dysentery, wounds, eye disease.

Name: Papeeta, Papaya
Uses: Fruit pulp is sometimes used as an ingredient in face cream and hair shampoo. Milky juice of unripe fruits applied as a cosmetic to remove freckles and other blemishes from the skin.

Name: Karaunda, Karonti
Uses: Root is  stomachic and anthelmintic. Decoction of leaves is  given in treatment of  remittent fevers.

Name: Karaunda, Karonti
Uses: Roots are purgative.

Name: Pala
Uses: Leaf decoction is used is used for cough and stomach problems.

Name: Wotiangil (Kashmir)
Uses: Root, leaves, and seeds are considered laxative, anthelmintic, and diuretic.

Name: Nodding Carpesium (Eng.)
Uses: Root, leaves, and seeds are considered laxative, anthelmintic, and diuretic.

Name: Saffron Thistle (Eng.)
Uses: Herb is sudorific, febrifuge and anthelmintic.

Name: Kusum, Karrah
Uses: Flower-heads source of a red and yellow dye, called safflower, used for colouring butter, liqueurs, and candles; also employed in cosmetic industry in the production of rouge, the best brands being Bengalese and Iranian Safflower. Fruits produce a'drying oil suitable for use in paints and varnishes, and linoleum and other similar products; also used for edible purposes. Oil applied to sores and rheumatic swellings. Fried achenes used in chutneys. Capi

Name: Shia-jira, Zira
Uses: Mericarps are also used as  carminative.

Name: Mari
Uses: Used as a laxative.

Name: Safed-Karai
Uses: Medicine produced from the root is used in liver complication. The stem and the bark is used in stomach ache.

Name: Chilla
Uses: The plant is anthelmintic, used in blister and wounds. The fruit is used in enlarged scrotum.bark is used against ring worm. The root is used in stomach ache and as tonic.

Name: Bhuikhakhasa
Uses: Plant used in compounds for treating biliousness, distention of stomach, vomiting and hiccups. Also used as a febrifuge, in splenic enlarge-ments, jaundice, amoebic dysentery. Contra-indicated in inflammatory colon diseases.

Name: Naelaponna (Tel.)
Uses: Roots are used in spasms of stomach.

Name: Sarmal (Mar.)
Uses: Seeds used as a purgative.

Name: Chaksu, Chakut
Uses:
Seed bitter, blood-purifier,
astringent, stimulant, diuretic. Used topically for leucoderma, ringworm, venereal ulcers and other skin diseases. Roots purgative.

Amarbeli

Uses: Oil used as mosquito repellent.

Name: Lamajjaka (Sans.)
Uses: Used in cough, chronic rheumatism, cholera, dyspepsia, and gout.

Name: Gandh bel
Uses: It's oil is used externally for stiff joints and lumbago, skin diseases, and in the treatment of baldness.

Name: Ganjni
Uses: Oil used as insecticides, spraying liquids, disinfectants.

Name: Rousaghas
Uses: Used as an aromatic astringent; essential oil applied in  heumatism and neuralgia.

Name: Hathichak, Hathi-choke
Uses: Flower heads contain inulin, useful in the diet of dibetics, Leaves bitter, considered diuretic and used in dropsy and rheumatism.

Name: Dhub, Hariali
Uses: Rhizomes used in genito-urinary troubles.

Name: Dhalabrauisabta (Assam)
Uses: Used for controlling vomiting in infants.

Name: Kuro (Nepali)
Uses: Used in preparing aphrodiasic medicines and used in relieving muscle pains.

Name: Madhuka (Sans.)
Uses: Oil from the seeds used for leprosy, scabies, and other cutaneous diseases. A lotion prepared from the leaves is used for the same purposes.

Name: Guinea Rush (Eng.)
Uses: Tubers tonic and stimulant.

Name: Bara chuncha (Beng.)
Uses: Culms used and considered stimulant, tonic, astringent, and stomachic.

Name: Motha, Mutha (Beng.)
Uses:
Dried tuberous roots are aromatic used in diuretic
diaphoretic, and astringent properties; used in stomach and bowel complaints.

Name: Jatamasi (Mar.)
Uses: Tubers stimulant and cardiac tonic.

Name: Nirbisi
Uses: Root oil used for stimulating liver and to relieve pruritus.

Name: Anan (Burma)
Uses: Bark is used in malaria, contains an alkaloid and a bitter substance.

Name: Scotch broom (Eng.)

Name: Makra, Makri
Uses:
Grass used in intestinal, biliary
and urinary diseases.

Name: Salampanja, Salam
Uses: Tubers used as tonic, in bone fracture and wounds.

Name: Takoli, Bithua
Uses: In dyspepsia the decoction of bark is used. For rheumatism seed oil are utilized.

Name: Shisham
Uses: The bark of the plant is used for backache and also for veterinary ulcers and wounds. The stem of the plant is employed for eczema and  pimples.

Name: Keti (Assam)
Uses: Roots are anthelmintic and also used as a masticatory.

Name: Shisham, Sissu
Uses: The leaf of the plant is having antiemetic properties. The leaf is used in dysentery, eruptions, gonorrhoea and scurf and for skin diseases.The ste is employed in leprosy.

Name: Chillanki (Tel.)
Uses: To relieve the effect of alcohol powdered roots are taken with water.

Name: Tateberi (Nepal)
Uses: Bark and root used as fish-poison.

Name: Bhatia
Uses: Juice of leaves used for gargles and application to aphthae.

Name: Kutilal (Punjab)
Uses: Root is purgative. Bark and leaves are used to treat skin troubles.

Name: Satpura setburwa
Uses:
Root is used against skin diseases, gonorrhoea. EtOH extract is used as cardiac 
depressant. Root and fruits are used in gastric troubles, body ache, muscular pain, headache, fever, cold, cough, 
blood purifier.

Name: Akalbir
Uses: Herb is diuretic, expectorantand purgative; used for gastric and scrofulous complaints and as a febrifuge.

Name: Safed Dhatura
Uses: Yields scopolamine, a cerebral depressant used in treatment of agitated or maniacal mental conditions.

Name: Sadahdhatura
Uses: Leaves have narcotic and antispasmodic properties.

Name: Dhatura
Uses: Leaves have narcotic, antispasmodic, mydriatic and anodyne properties.

Name: Gajar
Uses: Carrot is astrigent to the bowels, anti dysentric, carminative, cardiotonic; cures leprosy, piles' pains, burning sensation. The seeds are considered to be nervine tonic.

Name: Mahali kizhangu (Tam.)
Uses: Root is depurative.

Name: Latman
Uses: Roots are used  as sternutatory. Leaves are applied to sores.

Name: Sankasura (Mar.)
Uses:
Bark antiperiodic, febrifuge. Plant antirheumatic,
spasmogenic. Flowers active against roundworm.

Name: Laskar (Punjab)
Uses: Leaf juice is  used to destroy ticks and also acts as a cardiac and respiratory depressant.

Name: Jadwar, Nirbisi
Scientific Name: Delphinium denudatum Wall. ex Hook.f. & Thomson
Uses: Root has stimulant and tonic  properties used in relieving toothache.

Name: Juha, Kalulu
Uses: Used as a Cardiac and respiratory depressant.

Name: Pigeon Orchid (Eng.)
Uses: The crushed leaves used for poulticing boils and pimples.For nervous infections the plant is used.

Name: Nagli (Mar.)
Uses: The juice of the plant is prescribed in stomach-ache, also it is having  laxative properties since iit excites bile.

Name: Bans kaban, Bans khurd
Uses:
Leaf used in cough. Roots in
fever. Bark on injuries and tonic.

Name: Morange, Utigun
Uses: Juice of the roots are used in chronic fever.

Name: Andagan (Tam.)
Uses: Leaves are lithontriptic and used to check abortion.

Name: Banda
Uses: Bark is astringent and used to treat menstrual troubles, mania and asthma.

Name: Ruphang-doukha, Aru (Assam)
Uses: For insecticide and fish-poison roots are used. Contain rotenone.

Name: Karanj, Dithori
Uses: In case of scabies, herpes, leucoderma, and other cutaneous diseases it is applied medicinally; Internally it is used in dyspepsia with sluggish liver. Leaves juice adviced in flatulence, dyspepsia, diarrhoea, and cough; also used in leprosy and gonorrhoea.Roots juice used for cleansing foul ulcers and fistulous sores and for cleaning teeth and strengthening gums. For fish-poison roots and leaves are used. Fresh bark are taken for piles. Decoction of

Name: Gonj
Uses: The plant is used as fish-poison, but has no insecticidal value.

Name: Panlata (Beng.)
Uses: The plant is used as a stimulant and antispasmodic  and is also utilized to counter-irritant.

Name: Khubkallana
Uses: Flowers and leaves astringent and antiscorbutic. Seeds given in dysentery and calculus complaints.

Name: Sambar
Uses: Roots are used as ascarminative, tonic and diuretic and also in bilious complaints.

Name: Sarivan, Salpan
Uses: Roots are used as febrifuge, expectorant, and diuretic.

Name: Chepputatta (Tel.)
Uses: Decoction is used in coughs. The plant is used for convulsions.

Name: Chapor, Dheknanadak (Local names)
Uses: The decoction of bark is used in haemorrhage, diarrhoea, poisoning and eye diseases. Flowers used for biliousness

Name: Kudaliya
Uses: Leaves are used for dysentery, diarrhoea, and convulsions and as a galactagogue.

Name: Adkhapanal (Mal.)
Uses: Leaves extract used for piles.

Name: Aitaala (Kannada)
Uses: Decoction prepered from  the root is used for dysentery and vertigo.

Name: Dwarf ylang-ylang (Eng.)
Uses: Root decoction  has febrifuge property.

Name: Dab, Durva
Uses: Culms diuretic, used in dysentery and menorrhagia.

Name: Kanturiyan (Indian Bazaars)
Uses: As an antiperiodic in intermittent fevers the plant is being used.

Name: Clove pink (Eng.)
Uses: An essential oil is derived from the flowers which is being used as an excellent fixative. The flowers of the plant is used as cardiotonic, diaphoretic, and lexeteric.

Name: Basak
Uses: Roots and leafy tops are used in malarial fevers. Therapeutic activity due to quinazoline derivatives.

Name: Kheri, Vartuli
Uses:
Root used in renal infections,
urinary calculi, also in rheumatism. Tender shoots used in externally for ophthalmia.

Name: Bouna (Simla)
Uses: It is used a tonic.

Name: Navananjichapala (Mar.)
Uses: Plants are used as a  febrifuge. It is employed as a local application to putrescent wounds.

Name: Burning Bush (Eng.)
Uses: Root-bark decoction is used in nervous diseases, amenorrhoea,and hysteria, scabies and other skin infections.

Name: Pathar phori
Uses: Leaves yield an essential oil.

Name: Latmhuria
Uses: Flowers and seeds are used to treat urinary discharges.

Name: Grecian Foxglobe (Eng.)
Uses: Leaves yield digioxin.

Name: Common Foxglove (Eng.)
Uses: Leaf extract yields the drug digitalis which is used in treatment of cardiac problems.

Name: Chalta
Uses: Fruit has tonic and laxative properties.

Name: Ashphal (Beng.)
Uses: Bark contains tanninand seeds a fatty oil and saponin. Aril used as a tonic and refrigerant.

Name: Baradaha-barat (Andamans)
Uses: Used for as a vermifuge.

Name: Chupri alu, Khamalu
Uses:
Tuber used in leprosy and
piles.

Name: Ratalu, Suaralu
Uses: Tubers dried and pounded applied to ulcers; also used in piles and dysentery.

Name: Kins (Kash.), Kriss (Punjab)
Uses:
Tubers used as fishpoison
and to kill lice.

Name: Suthni, Su nialu (Beng.)
Uses: Grated tubers used on swellings.

Name: Yellagadda, Adairdumpa (Tel.)
Uses: Root is used to reduce swelling, in scorpion sting and snake-bite.

Name: Bhusa, Gazaria
Uses: Tubers considered as tonic; also used for swellings.

Name: Nila-vriksha (Sans.)
Uses: Decoction of the root bark is used in treating rheumatism and swellings.

Name: Ebans, Abnus

Name: Coromandel Ebony Persimmon (Eng.)
Uses: Leaves are astringent.

Name: Halwa tendu

Uses: Fully ripe fruits are astringent.

Name: Gaab

Name: Tendu, Timburni
Uses: Leaves are diuretic, laxative ,carminative and styptic. Dried flowers are used in treating urinary and skin troubles. Decoction of the bark in used in treating diarrhea and dyspepsia.

Name: Bistendu, Tendu
Uses: Fruits are crushed and applied externally to boils

Name: Thinduka (Sans.)
Uses:
Dried and powdered fruits are applied to burns. Decoction of the root is used in
 treating biliousness.

Name: Tapsi (Beng.)
Uses: Gum exuding from freshly cut tree is used for treating tooth ache.

Name: Vatoli (Mar.)
Uses: Leaves contain mucilageand saponin. Leaf powder is along with milk is prescribed for forbiliousness, gonorrhoea and syphilis.

Name: Kakka (Mal.)
Uses: The plant is a source of an oleoresin which is  used in rheumatism.

Name: Teli-gurjun (Beng.)
Uses: The plant is a good source of an oleoresin, which is applicable on ringworm, ulcers,  and other cutaneous diseases.

Name: Sanatta, Sinatha
Uses: Leaves febrifuge; also used on burns, swellings, and wounds.

Name: Mersingi (Mar.)
Uses: Used as an abortifacient medicine and leaf extract is used in body aches and snake bites.

Name: Gorshingiah (Beng.)
Uses: Seeds have antiseptic properties and used in spasmodic infections

Name: Minnikizhangu (Local name)
Uses: For diuretic especially in kidney and heart troubles the green pod shells are used.

Name: Kulthi
Uses: Plants are utilized as astringent, diuretic and tonic.

Name: Spring Whitlowgrass (Eng.)
Uses: The oil obtained from the plant is administered for whitlow.

Name: Tukhme-ferunjmishk
Uses: Herb is astringent, tonic and vulnerary. Seeds are demulcent.

Name: Jalkeshar (Local name)
Uses: Plants have strong rubefacient property

Name: Mukhajali
Uses: Crushed leaves are used as a blistering agent. Used in the preparation of Swarna Bhasam.

Name: Abijalo, Bat-nongrim (Local names)
Uses: The juice  of the plant is consider as laxative and antifebrile

Name: Garur (Beng.)
Uses:
Used in the treatment of chest diseases, cough, hectic fever,
dyspepsia, loss of appetite, chronic jaundice and cutaneous infections. Peeled rhizome with sugar is prescribed for urinary disorders and in spermatorrhoea.

Name: Bhimsaini-kapur, Barus kapur
Uses: The camphor is obtained from the cavities or fissures in the wood of the plant which is known as- Borneo Camphor or Barus Camphor . It almost resembles the true camphor of Cinnamomum camphora Nees & Eberm. It is utilized as camphor in the same manner in medicine.

Name: Sarakhs
Uses: Rhizomes used as taenifuge.

Name: Lai-chankhrang (Manipuri)
Uses: Rhizome anthelmintic.

Name: Jiaputa, Juti
Uses: Fruit is used to treat cold and fever.

Name: Civet fruit (Eng.)
Uses: The fruits of the plant is employed as tonic.

Name: Gendheli-poma (Assam)
Uses: Bark employed in treating stomach ache.

Name: Vellaiyagil (Tam.)
Uses: Wood Decoction usedin rheumatism and wood oil used in ear and eye troubles.

Name: Squirting Cucumber (Eng.)
Uses: Dried immature fruits are imported to India and sold as Kateri-lndrayan. It is source of the drug Elaterium, a powerful hydragogue cathartic, contains elaterin, the active principle.

Name: Udajati
Uses:
It is used in dysuria. Roots are used to treat jaundice,menorrhagia and rheumatism.
 Decoction of leaves are used as stricture.

Name: Samak, sanwak
Uses: Whole plant used for diseases of the spleen and checking haemorrhage.

Name: Sanwa, Shamula
Uses:
Plant used as cooling and
digestible, also in biliousness and constipation.

Name: Dul (Beng.)
Uses: Stem pith used as a diuretic.

Name: Gokru, Utakanta
Uses: Plants are used as a tonic and diuretic. Powdered roots are applied to destory maggots and lice.

Name: Dhenok (lepcha)
Uses: Root-stock is used for buboes.

Name: Tella juvi (Tel.)
Uses: Root decoction is used in curing veneral diseases.

Name: Shiulik
Uses:
Flowers are considered as febrifuge.
 Oil from seeds is used to treat catarrhal and bronchial infections.

Name: Guara (Beng.)
Uses: Flowers are astringent.

Name: Giwain, Kankal
Uses: Whole plant is used to treat pulmonary disorder.

Name: African oil palm (Eng.)
Uses: Palm oil used as source of vitamin 'A' riched.

Name: Jalpai (Beng.)
Uses: Infusion of leaves and bark are used as  mouth-wash for inflammed gums.

Name: Jalpai (Beng.)
Uses: Leaves are applied in rheumatism also  used as an antidote to poisoning. Fruits are useful in dysentery and diarrhoea.

Name: Rutthracham (Tam.)

Name: Gobhi, Samudulan
Collector: P.V. Sreekumar and N. Rama Rao

Name: Mandua, Mandal
Uses: Ragi is considered an ideal food for diabetics because of slow release of sugars to the body.  Leaves and stems is used to ease vaginal bleeding.

Name: Mandla
Uses: Used for biliary disorders. Whole plant is used as stomachic, diuretic, febrifuge, and in sprains.

Name: Crested Late-Summer Mint (Eng.)
Uses: It is antipyretic and diuretic.

Name: Vayavidanga, Bhabhiranga

Name: Babrang, Baibrang

Name: Amla, Amlika

Name: Hirankhuri

Name: Harkuch

Name: Chota chirayata
Uses: It has stomachic and laxative properties. It is a blood purifier and used in dropsy and malaria.

Name: African dream herb (Eng.)

Name: Asmania (Punjab)
Uses: Used in treating asthma and respiratory problems.

Name: Central-Asian Jointfir (Eng.)
Uses: Yields a low percentage of ephedrine.

Name: Jivanti
Uses: The plant is employed as demulcent, stimulant, and tonic.

Name: Fireweed (Eng.)
Uses: Roots used as an astringent. Leaves extract shows antiphlogistic action.

Name: Hairy Willow Weed (Eng.)
Uses: Sap is used to remove warts.

Name: Trotak, Nari (Punjab)
Uses: Used as a refrigerant, also given in gonorrhoea.

Name: Field Horsetail (Eng.)
Uses: Used as a diuretic. Considered useful in dropsy, gravel, and renal infections.

Name: Gulsham
Uses: Roots are boiled with milk and taken to treat leucorrhoea.

Name: Zhu Ye Ni Mao Lan (China)
Uses: Used in medicinal baths for ague.

Name: Sonsali, Maredi (Bombay)

Name: Jarayupriya (Sans.)

Plants yields an oil, Oleum Erigerontis or Oil of Fleabane, used in diarrhoea, dysentery and internal haemorrhages.

Name: Logat
Uses: Fruits are considered to be a sedative. Flowers are used as expectorant.

Name: Naiunnam (Tam.)
Uses: Poultice of the roots applied to wounds.

Name: Red-Stem Filaree (Eng.)
Uses: This herb is used as a uterine hemostatic, and in dropsy and dysentery.

Name: Musk-Clover (Eng.)
Uses: Used as an antipyretic, and a tincture of it given for dysentery.

Name: Taramira, Seoha

Name: Kundalapala (Mal.)

Root is employed as a local anodyne and chewed for relief from tooth-ache.
Flowers are  used in inflammations of cornea.

Name: Puttapalatige (Tel.)
Uses: Bark used in treatment of cholera

Name: Ban-Dhania, Jongali-memedo (Assam)

Name: Hamadan (Kashmir)

Name: Mura (Sans.)

Name: Dauldhak, Madar

Name: Dadap, Mandara

Name: Coca (Eng.)
Uses: It is apowerful stimulant of the nervous system, affecting anologus to opium. Leaves contain cocain.The plant contains methyl salicylate.

Name: Devadaru (Kan.)
Uses: Infusion of the wood and bark is stomatic, diaphoretic.It is also used in dropsy. The leaves are refrigerant.

Name: Lemon-scented Eucalypt (Eng.)
Uses: Leaves produces an essential oil which is a source of citronellal.

Name: Yukeliptas, Eucalyptus (Beng.)

Name: Katou-Kaida-Maravara (Malayalam)

Name: Kukudkand (Mar.)

Name: Amarkand, Goruma

Name: Kungku

Name: Chota-keruee (Beng.)
Uses: It is used as galactogogue.

Name: Sehund, Thohar, Pattonkisend

Latex is rubefacient,purgative, expectorant and used to remove warts and 
cutaneous eruptions.

Name: Katathohar

Name: Chounpalu (Chinese)
Uses: Root is used to treat fistular sores.

Name: Chinnamman paccharisi (Tam.)
Uses: Leaves and seeds are vermifuge.

Name: Thor, Shakarpitan

Name: Choti-dudhi

Leaves and seeds are astringent, anthelmintic, laxative and treat bowel complaints of

Name: Konpal sehund

Latex is rubefacient.It is used to remove warts externally. It is also applied in neuralgia

Name: Tredhara sehund

It is purgative and digestive. Decoction is used in gout. Juice is used to treat
 nervine troubles and dropsy. It is applied to warts and cutaneous infections.

Name: Chagulputputi
Uses: Capsules are used to remove warts.

Name: Banmuli, Khargoni (Local names)
Scientific Name: Euphorbia fusiformis Buch.-Ham. ex D. Don
Uses: Juice is acrid and vesicant.

Name: Kanthaarak (Santali)

Bark is used in treating blisters and boils. The plant is used in treating phthis and in curing

Name: Hirruseeah, Mahabi

It is hydragogue cathartic. Roots are anthelmintic. Seeds are used in cholera.Juice
 is used to treat rheumatism and neuralgia and also to remove warts.

Name: Dudhia

An ingredient of medicine for cough and asthma.It is used in colic, dysentery and

Name: Hakshardana
Uses: Infusion is used as astringent in diarrhea, dysentery and leucorrhoea.

Name: Katathohar
Uses: Juice is purgative and diuretic. Root-bark is used in dropsy.

Name: Hirtiz (Kashmir)

Name: Eyebright (Eng.)
Uses: Herb used in treatment of conjuctivitis and jaundice.

Name: Chitiphal, Safed bhangra

Name: Makhana

Name: Tongkat ali (Malay)

Name: Kanalei (Mal.)

Name: Shyamakranta, Sankhahuli

Name: Baracharayata

Name: Kana poondu (Tam.)

Name: Bara-charayata

Name: Basingh

Name: Gengwa (Beng.)

Name: Kaspat

Name: Thithpaloo (Burma)

Name: Faridbuti (Punjab)

Name: Faridbuti (Punjab)
Uses: The plant is regarded as refrigerant and is also used for rheumatism.

Name: Hing

Name: Galbanum

Name: Hingupatri, Hingu

Name: Hing, Inguva (Tel.)

Name: Jari

Name: Paraspipal

Name: Bar, Bargad
Uses:
Latex exuded is used for application in case of rheumatism and lumbago. Bark has tonic and astringent properties, which are used
in diarrhoea, dysentery, and diabetes treatment.

Name: Pukar (Beng.)
Uses: Leaf decoction is used to treat ulcers.

Name: Anjir
Uses: Fruit extract has laxative, emollient and diuretic properties.

Name: Somavalkhom (Sans.)
Uses: Fruits are employed in treating heart diseases and leaves and bark  in liver and skin problems.

Name: Kalmnor
Uses: Bark yields tannin extract.

Name: Kalapong (Khasi Hills)
Uses: Root decoction taken after parturition.

Name: Trayamana (Sans.)
Uses: Juice of root is used in treating colic, asthma and cough and that of leaves used in dysentry.

Name: Daduri, Dagurin
Uses: Extract is used as a tonic, lactagogue and emetic.

Name: Kamrup
Uses: Bark used in treating liver problems and dried roots are used in case of toothache.

Name: Anjiri, Bedu
Uses: Fruit extract has demulcent and laxative properties, used in treating lung and bladder diseases.

Name: Gular, Umar
Uses: Leaf extract used in bilious infections and that of roots used in diarrhoea and diabetes.

Name: Pipal, Pipli
Uses: Bark extract used in treating skin problems and ulcers.

Name: Chhota Jangli Anjur
Uses: The bark of the plant is having emetic and laxative properties.  The figs of the plant promote the secretion of milk  and preserve the foetus in the womb. In powder or decoction (1 in 10) it is given in hepatic obstruction. Dose of the* powder is 40 to 60 grains, and of the decoction half to one ourfoe. Fruits and seeds 'in a dose of 15 to 30 grains of bark, 3 to 4 times a day, acts as antiperiodic. A poultice of the bark is  applied to buboes to disp

Name: Gagjaira, Ganja
Uses: Fruit juice used for deworming, and for asthma relief.

Name: Jharphali, Khain
Uses: Root juice used in bladder ailments.

Name: Plaksha (Sans.)
Uses: Bark decoction used in treating ulcers, diarrhoea, and leprosy.

Name: Udumber (Sans.)
Uses: Root and bark has stomachic and aperient properties.

Name: Pakad, Pakur (Beng.)
Uses: Bark decoction used as a gargle.

Name: West Indian Fimbry (Eng.)
Uses: Used in dysentery.

Name: Gargugal, Kakai (Local names)
Uses: The leaves of the plant are used as astringent, diuretic, and vulnerary.

Name: Paniala
Uses: Young shoots and leaves are considered astringent and stomachic, it is being used in diarrhoea and as diaphoretic. The infusion of bark used in gargle. For biliousness and other liver complaints fruit is given.

Name: Bomugra (Oriya)
Collector: T.A. Rao, S. Chakraborty and R.K. Premanath
Uses: Leaves astringent, diuretic, and vulnerary.

Name: Salpan
Uses: Roots used in epilepsy and hysteria; also used to induce sleep and relieve pain.

Name: Bara-salpan, Bhalia
Uses: For ulcers and swellings the roots are externally applied.

Name: Bara-salpan, Bhalia
Uses: For ulcers and swellings the roots are externally applied.

Name: Kussunt
Uses: Roots  are utilized for  epilepsy, hysteria and to induce sleep and relieve pain. Leaves are useful as a vermifuge.

Name: Birmova (Mar.)
Uses: Used in leucorrhoea.

Name: Saunf, Sonp
Uses: It is very poisonous. Full grown but unripe fruits are dried and useful as a sedative ,anodyne and antispasmodic.

Name: Shabnami (Urdu)
Uses: The plant is considered of having aromatic, demulcent, and mucilaginous properties.

Name: Dieng-lavmaheg (Khasi hills)
Uses: It is used in treating bone fracture.

Name: Kum (Kashmir)
Uses: Leaves are cathartic. Bark is febrifuge.

Name: Shirkhist
Uses: It is used as mild laxative for children.

Name: Shothkar (Local name)
Uses: Dried corms used in  tuberculosis, asthma and bronchitis.

Name: Crown Imperial (Eng.)
Uses: Bulbs fresh ones poisonous, imperialine, reported to be a cardiac poison.

Name: Bladder wrack (Eng.)
Uses: The kelp or varec is obtained when the plant is dried and burnt which is an important source of iodine. It is also used in goitre and rheumatism.

Name: Pitpara, Shahterah
Uses: Astringent, laxative, and diuretic, used for dyspepsia and scrofulous skin infections.

Name: Pitpara, Shahterah
Uses: The plant is considered as diuretic  and laxative,  for blood diseases it is being used.

Name: Common Hempnettle (Eng.)
Uses:
It is expectorant, infusion is used in treating pulmonary troubles. It is employed as
 resolvent and antispasmodic.

Name: Cleavers, Goose grass (Eng.)
Uses: Infusion of the herb is used as an aperient, diuretic, refrigerant, and antiscorbutic.

Name: Lahare kuro (Nep.)
Collector: O. Polunin, W.R. Sykes and L.H.J. Williams
Uses: It is used as antiscorbutic and diuretic and in skin diserase.

Name: Cheese Rennet (Eng.)
Uses:
Considered purgative and diuretic, used in gravel and other urinary diseases. Juice or decoction employed in epilepsy and hysteria; also applied in
cutaneous troubles.

Name: Dharambe (Mar.)
Uses: In bowel complaints and rheumatism the decoction of rind is employed. The resin which is obtained from the tree is having purgative properties.

Name: Cowa
Uses: Fruits edible, but acidic; made into a jam or preserve; sun-dried slices given in dysentery.

Name: Kokam
Uses: Fruits which is known as Kokam  is having anthelmintic and cardiotonic properties. An edible fat called- Kokam Butter is obtained from the seeds of the plant is used as astringent, demulcent,  mollient, and soothing in cutaneous infections.

Name: Mangustan, Mangusta
Uses: The fruit of the plant is used in cutaneous infections, diarrhoea and dysentery.

Name: Tamal
Uses: The plant is considered as important hydragogue, cathartic and it is employed in dropsical infections, obstinate constipation, and cerebral congestion when rapid lowering of the blood pressure is required.

Name: Tikul (Beng.)
Uses: Pericarp which is acidic may be used in place of lime.

Name: Dampel, Tamal
Uses: The dried fruits are used in the preparation of juice which is beneficial in biliousness.

Name: Bitmara (Assam)
Uses: Fruits are considered as cathartic and anthelmintic

Name: Dikamali
Uses: plant is used in nervous disorders of children, diarrhoea at the time of dentition and rubbed on gums to allay irritation; It is also used for flatulent dyspepsia, destroys maggots in wounds of amimals.

Name: Gandharaj
Uses: Root is used in dyspepsia and nervous disorders. Fruits are stimulant, emetic and diuretic, used in jaundice, pulmonary and renal troubles.

Name: Dikamali
Uses: Yields Dikamali-like gum, used in cutaneous diseases.

Name: Thanella, Ghurgia
Uses: Fruits eaten after cooking; also used in infections of mammary glands.

Name: Kharpat, Ghogar
Uses: Fruits have cooling and digestive properies.

Name: Kalomba (Lepcha)
Uses: It is used as carminative and in treating rheumatism, neuralgia and as an antiseptic.

Name: Ban naringa
Uses: Bark is used as purgative in hepatic complaints and also in gum troubles.

Name: Shining cranesbill (Eng.)
Uses: It has Diuretic and astringent properties.

Name: Ragatageri (Nepali)
Uses: It has diuretic and astringent properties.

Name: Awnless Geranium (Eng.)
Collector: John R. Bozeman and J.F. Logue
Uses: It has anodyne, vulnerary and astringent properties.

Name: Bhand
Uses: Plants are used as astringent and to cure renal diseases

Name: Bhanda
Uses: Used in renal diseases and medicinal oils.

Name: Small Geranium (Eng.)
Uses: It has Astringent, anodyne, vulnerary properties.

Name: Herb-Robert Geranium (Eng.)
Uses:
It is used in diarrhoea, haemorrhagees, gargles, jaundice,
and gravel.

Name: Round-leaved crane's bill (Eng.)
Uses: It has diuretic and astringent properties..

Name: Laljhari (U.P. & Punjab)
Uses: Plants are used to cure tooth-ache problems, eye related troubles and as astringent.

Name: Hawkweed Gerbera Daisy (Eng.)
Uses: Plants used in rheumatic fever.

Name: Gogjemul (Kash.)
Uses: Plants are astringent, also used in diarrhoea and dysentery.

Name: Allo Sisnu (Nepali)
Uses: Decoction of leaves are used as febrifuge and leaves are applied to swollen joint.

Name: Koditani (Tam.)
Uses: It is used treat itch and cutaneous eruption.

Name: Balu-ka-sag
Uses: Plants are used as an aperient and anthelmintic also used for cases of taenia.

Name: Common Honeylocust (Eng.)
Uses: The leaves aqueous extract exhibits depressor effect; and causes an increase in the amount of work performed by voluntary muscles and delay in fatigue. Leaves contains ascorbic acid.

Name: Gandibudi
Uses: Used in case of abdominal disorders.

Name: Jima
Uses: It has stomachic, aperient and antiseptic properties

Name: Bhoma (Mar.)
Uses: Bark is used to treat stomach ailments.

Name: Itepulla (Tel.)
Uses: Bark is stomachic.

Name: Karihari, Languli
Uses: Tubers regarded tonic, stomachic, and anthelmintic;  also used to promote labour pain and as an abortifacient; externally used for neuralgic pains and skin troubles. Intensely poisonous in large doses.

Name: Seri
Uses: Plants are used as an emmenagogue.

Name: Pardeshibhangro (Guj.)
Uses: Roota used in bone fracture.plant is also used in cough, dysentry, cholera.

Name: Bhat, Bhatwar
Uses: Useful as oil-yielding plant

Name: Mulhatti, Jethi-madh
