Uses: Rhizomes and roots tonic are used as expectorant, demulcent, and laxative,  and also for allaying coughs and catarrhal infections, and irritable conditions of the membranes of urinary organs. In medicine extract is used.

Name: Ban-nimbu
Uses: Leaf juice is used in treating fever, liver and skin problems, and as a vermifuge

Name: Gambhar, Gumhar
Uses:
Leaves are demulcent. Root is an ingredient of Dasamula, an ayurvedic preparation.
 Fruits enter into cooling decoctions and used in fever and bilious infections.

Name: Badhara, Nag-phul
Uses: Root is demulcent and astringent. It is used in treating rheumatism and catarrh of bladder.

Name: Bal raksha (Punjab)
Uses: Plant is used in post natal care for mother and child, It is also used in wounds and skin disease.

Name: Nacchinar (Tam.)
Uses: Leaves are applied to treat swellings and contusions.

Name: Nagetta (Kan.)
Scientific Name: Gordonia obtusa Wall. ex Wight & Arn.
Uses: The leaves of the plant act as stimulant which is close to tea.

Name: Kapas, Rui
Scientific Name: Gossypium arboreum L. emend. Hutch. Et al.
Uses: In fever root is employed, And in case of catarrh, consumption and gleet seeds are used.

Name: Levant Cotton (Eng.)
Uses: Leaves are used in scorpion-sting and snake-bite .

Name: Khanta (Oriya)
Uses: Bark and root contain saponin and used for washing hair. Pulped plant used as an application for skin complaints.

Name: Kakarundah, Kukurbicha
Uses: The fruits of the plant is edible and is taken for diarrhoea and dysentery. The rooot paste is  applied to fasten suppuration.

Name: Pharsia
Uses: The root of the plant is used in cough and irritable condition of the intestines and bladder. The decoction of the root is given inemollient enema.

Name: Phalsa, Dhamin
Uses: The fruit of the plant is having astringent, cooling, and stomachic properties. The bark of the plant is used in rheumatism by the Santals.

Name: Achchu (Tam.)
Uses: The stem of the plant is used for cough. Wood used for walkingsticks

Name: Dhamni, Pharsa
Uses: The bark of the plant is having emetic properties; the thick mucilage strained is prepared by rubbing down the tuber with water and the strain  is used  as 5 tola 1 doses with 2 table spoon  of the flour of Pamicum maliaceum as a cure for dysentery and opium-poisoning. The bark  is used  externally to get relief from irritation from cow-itch.

Name: Padekhado (Guj.)
Uses: The roots of the plant is used in diarrhoea.

Name: Lignum Vitae (Eng.)
Uses: plants are used as laxative.Consumed as lozenges it is used for  pharyngitis, tonsillitis.

Name: Nipaltunth (Beng.)
Uses: The fruit of the plant is employed as a pectoral. Corpulence reduces by using leaf extract. The bark of the plant is employed  as tonic and demulcent.

Name: Panniru chettu (Tel.)
Uses: Bark used for chronic dysentery; also employed in applications for wounds and abscesses.

Name: Gur-mar, Merasingi
Uses: Leaf powder is diuretic.

Name: Kaubutkila (Bihar)
Uses: Decoction made of leaves is given as antidote to fruit poisoning and also used against tetanus after miscarriage. Juice of the leaves is applied in ophthalmia.

Name: Nelamuchchala (Kan.)
Uses:
Root is febrifuge. 
The paste prepared from root is is mixed with lime juice and applied to treat blisters and sores on the tongue.

Name: Lemtem (Assam)
Collector: Reporter on Economic products to the Government of India
Uses: Seeds are used for skin ailments and contains insecticidal properties. The bark of the plant is used as febrifuge.

Name: Ankara, Devsunda (Local names)
Uses:
Whole plant used in nose
bleed and snake bite wounds; Roots in fever.

Name: Patang
Uses:
Long wood is astringent and tonic, decoction used in diarrhoea, dysentery, atonic
dyspepsia, and leucorrhoea. Flowers are a source of high quality honey.

Name: Haldu
Uses: Bark has antiseptic property, heals scars on skin and yellowing of body. Plants also used in cholera and in cold and cough.

Name: Taghaz
Uses: Camel fodder. This forms the most important food for the camel in Kharan and the common tree in the sandy desert. It bears a kind of grain in the autum which the people use for their food during famine.

Name: Saxaul (Eng.)
Uses: A source of crude sodium carbonate (Sajji-khar)

Name: Rimth Saltbush (Eng.)
Uses: It is employed as an adulterant and substitute of Haloxylon recurvum.

Name: Nila Jakara (Mar.)
Uses: It is used as febrifuge.

Name: Kastula
Uses: It is used as febrifuge.

Name: Nei-kottei (Tam.)
Uses: Bark used as fish-poison. Oil from seeds used in rheumatism.

Name: Common Ginger Lily (Eng.)
Uses: Rhizome used as anti-inflammatory, antirheumatic, febrifuge, tranquilizer.

Name: Bhedeli (Assam)
Uses: Root is used in sprains.

Name: Chirval
Uses: Leaves and roots are expectorant, given in asthma, bronchitis, and consumption.

Name: Ronder (Local name)
Uses: Decoction given in dysentery. Herb also used in poultices for headache and stomach-ache.

Name: Surajmukhi
Uses: Seeds are used as diuretic and expectorant.

Name: Hatichuk
Uses: Used as a sweetening agent for diabetics.

Name: Maroraphali, Marodaphali
Uses: In cases of intestinal complaints, such as colic, diarrhoea, chronic dysentery and flatulence and to improve appetite the fruits are used. The root juice is consider beneficial for empyema and stomach infections, also used in diabees.

Name: Jatimisak (Punjab)
Uses: Used in treating gonorrhoea and to increase lactation

Name: Salt heliotrope (Eng.)
Uses: Pounded roots applied to sores and other w

Name: Bithua (Punjab)
Uses: Pounded leaves applied in ulcers and warts.

Name: Hatta-juri, Hatta-sura
Uses:
It has emollient, vulnerary and diuretic properties used as a local application for ulcers, sores, and other skin infections.
Leaf decoction used in treatment of urticaria and fevers, and root extract in coughs and fevers.

Name: Nag-phuli
Uses: Used in treatment of syphilitic ulcers

Name: Chitiphul
Uses:
Juice has laxative and diuretic properties and also applied to eye sore, boils, wounds, and
ulcers.

Name: Tawny Day-Lily (Eng.)
Uses: Flowers are said to deaden all kinds of pain and are given to women at the time of delivery.

Name: Anantamul, Kapuri
Uses:
Dried roots constitute the drug hemidesmus or anantmul which is demulcent, 
diaphoretic,diuretic and used in treatment of rheumatism, gravel, urinary troubles and skin diseases

Name: Chhataya
Uses: Living tap roots is applied as an expectorant, laxative, antispasmodic.It is also useful in infantile convulsions, croup and flatulent colic

Name: Mukuram (Mal.)
Uses: The decoction of seeds is prescribed in diarrhoea and dysentery.

Name: Smooth Rupturewort (Eng.)
Uses: The plant is having  astringent and diuretic properties. The infusion is being used in catarrhal infections of the bladder.

Name: Hairy Rupturedwort (Eng.)
Uses: The plant is having diuretic properties. The decoction of the herb is given in sore throat and the decoction of the roots is used for horses suffering from bots and colds.

Name: Warras, Pullung
Uses: Wood extraxt is used for treatment of cutaneous diseases.

Name: Kher, Kumeria
Scientific Name: Heteropogon contortus (L.) P.Beauv. ex Roem. & Schult.
Uses: Used for silage and hay. Roots stimulant, diuretic.

Name: Ambari, Patsan
Uses: The plant is regarded of having stomachic and aphrodisiac properties

Name: Adavi gogu, Konda gogu (Tel.)
Uses: The cooked leaves is having anthelmintic properties and is consumed to improve digestion. The infusion of roots  is employed as refrigerant.

Name: Shalapara, Sthal kamal
Uses: The leaves of the plant is beneficial for cough, menorrhagia, dysuria, and wounds caused by burns and scalds. For pectoral and pulmonary complaints the flowers are used.

Name: Tiny Flower Hibiscus (Eng.)
Uses: The plant is used as febrifuge .

Name: Jasut, Jasum
Uses: Leaves of the plant are used as anodyne, aperient and emollient. The decoction  of the plant is prescribed in bronchial catarrh.

Name: Lal-ambari, Patwa
Uses: The fruits  of the plant is considered of having antiscorbutic properties.  The leaves, seeds, and ripe calyces are used as  antiscorbutic and diuretic.

Name: Mullu gogu (Tel.)
Uses: The twigs of the plant is used to prepare a lotion which is  applied in penile irritation  and urethritis. The mucilaginous flowers employed as emollient and pectoral.

Name: Swet jaba (Beng.)
Uses: The twigs of the plant is used to prepare a lotion which is  applied in penile irritation  and urethritis. The mucilaginous flowers employed as emollient and pectoral.

Name: Bola, Chelwa
Uses: The bark containing the mucilage is used in dysentery. The leaves of the plant is used as laxative and resolvent and the infusion employed in vulnerary. . An  embrocations is prepared from the roots which is applied for rheumatism and lumbago. The infusion of seeds is considered as emetic.

Name: Trailing Holyhock (Eng.)
Uses: The leaves of the plant is having stomachic properties. The infusion of flowers employed as diuretic and it is also used in skin troubles.

Name: Yellow Hackwood (Eng.)
Uses: Produces inulin.

Name: Lax sweet grass (Eng.)
Uses: Dried foliage burnt as incense.

Name: Tsermang (Ladakhi)
Uses: Fruit is used to treat lung disorders.

Name: Madhavilata, Madhmalti
Uses: Vine is used in chronic rheumatism and asthma. Leaves used in cutaneous diseases. Leaf juice insecticidal, used for scabies.

Name: Kurchi, Karchi
Uses:
Bark is astringent,anthelmintic,stomachic,antipyretic, tonic and anti dysenteric. 
It is used in treatment of amoebic dysentery and diarrhoea.

Name: Kurchi, Karchi
Uses:
Bark is astringent,anthelmintic,stomachic,antipyretic, tonic and anti dysenteric. 
It is used in treatment of amoebic dysentery and diarrhoea.

Name: Kiri-mawara (Tam.)
Uses:
The wood and bark is used as remedy in fevers and dysentery. The bark is sold under the name of 
kalinda and is valued as antiperiodic.

Name: Chera (Mal.)
Uses: The fruit and bark are employed medicinally.

Name: Kherai (Manipur)
Uses:
Fruit and bark are employed
medicinally, but with caution, as  to give rise to dangerous symptoms. The tree exudes
a black, resinous, acrid, and poisonous juice from the trunk
and rind of the fruit. The secretion is of a powerfully
caustic nature and blisters the skin.

Name: Chilbil, Papari
Uses: Used in treating burns and boils, and bone fractures.

Name: Arkapushpi
Uses: Roots are used to treat diabetes, gonorrhea, cough, stomach-ache, tonic and lactative.

Name: Chhirvel
Uses: Roots are used to treat diabetes, gonorrhea, cough, stomach-ache, tonic and lactative.

Name: Jagged Chickweed (Eng.)
Uses: The plant is having  somewhat demulcent and refreshing properties.

Name: Kuchu gundubi (Beng.)
Uses: Plant used in skin troubles.

Name: Pashanabhedaka (Sans.)
Collector: Cecil J. Saldanha and B. Gurudev Singh
Uses:
Roots are laxative, diuretic and used in treating piles, stone in bladder, vesical calculi,
 strangury, urinary discharges.

Name: Urappuppicin (Tam.)
Uses: It is used as styptic. The bark of the plant is consider as astringent, it is used as styptic. The bark is also used as masticatory in gum troubles.

Name: Ram jeeta
Uses: Plant is used sed in piles and epilepsy.

Name: Jau, Jav
Uses:
Grain used in the dietary of invalids and convalescents.
Barley water used as a diuretic and demulcent drink. Powdered grain much employed in the form of a gruel in cases of painful and atonic dyspepsia.

Name: Chooglum, Mutwinda (Andamans)
Uses: The bark decoction is employed as a gargle.

Name: Amol (Assam)
Uses: The seeds of the plant is substituted for arecanut.

Name: Alimoli, Hellijhar (Local names)
Uses:
Leaves are used in treatment of measles, dysentery, gonorrhoea, and eye and skin troubles.
It is  effective in the treatment of stomach ulcers .

Name: Sicka
Uses: Intoxication due to excessive drinking is relief by using the seeds. The extract of fruit contains potassium nitrate and potassium malate is strongly diuretic.

Name: Chulijinka (Oriya)
Uses: Bruised roots are applied to inflammatory swellings; powdered roots anthelmintic and febrifuge. Root-bark employed as an antidote to poisons.

Name: Arruvanci (Tam.)
Uses: Bark used for ulcers and in biliousness, leprosy, and epilepsy.

Name: Simaburuga (Tel.)
Uses:
Decoction of the bark possess emeto-cathartic properties.
 Latex, bark and seeds are employed in treating leprosy.

Name: Ratanpurus
Uses: The plant is used as demulcent, diuretic, and tonic. In urinary infections and bowel complaints of children root is used.  Tender stalks and leaves decoction or electuary are used  as demulcent.

Name: Dalmurgi
Uses: The true Chaulmoogra Oil (Oleum Chaulmoograe) is obtained from the Kernels, and is externally applied  for leprosy. Fruits  are poisonous for fish,  fish killed by the fruits are not edible. The bark of the plant is used as febrifuge.

Name: Chaulmoogra (Hindi)
Uses: Hydnocarpus Oil is obtained from seeds,  which is very effective in early cases of lepromatous leprosys. In both Mycobacterium leprae and M. tuberculosis the oil very potent. Seeds used For ophthalmia, chronic skin infections  and for dressing wounds and ulcers the seeds are very useful. In bruises, chest infections, sciatica, sprains and rheumatism the oil used is locally applied.

Name: Phirphire ghans (Nepali)
Uses:
Leaves and roots (Chang Shah) have been in use in China as an antimalarial drug; said to be more potent than quinine and
the activity is attributed to the presence of an alkaloid.

Name: Thamapansapi lei (Manipuri)
Uses:
Leaves and roots (Chang Shah) have been in use in China as an antimalarial drug; said to be more potent than quinine and
the activity is attributed to the presence of an alkaloid.

Name: Frogbit (Eng.)
Uses: The leaves of the plant is having mucilaginous, astringent properties.

Name: Mahagotukola
Uses: Plants are used as a substitute for Centclla asiatica Linn and known by the same regional names. A tonic and diuretic and a localstimulant, used in cutaneous diseases Leaves used for indigestion, nervousness and dysentery.

Name: Kulkhuri
Uses: Plants are used as diuretic and tonic and also applied in leprosy. A glycoside asiaticoside has been found to be active in the treatment of leprosy which has been isolated from the plant.

Name: Langali (Sans.)
Uses: Leaves have antisdeptic properties.

Name: Talmakhana, Kulaka
Uses: Roots, leaves and seeds are diuretic and used in treatment of jaundice, dropsy, rheumatism, anasarca and urino-genital disease.

Name: Matham arak (Bihar)
Uses: Leaves are diuretic. Seeds and leaves are used in poultices.

Name: Janglidal
Scientific Name: Hygroryza aristata (Retz.) Nees ex Wight & Arn.
Uses: Grains (Bengal Wild Rice) are sweet and oleaginous, digestible. Used also in biliousness.

Name: Bhaulan, Kukurkat
Uses: Root is used in abortion, gout, inflammation. Bark and root used in fever.

Name: Khurasaniajvayan (Hindi)
Uses: It has narcotic, and mydriatic properties which is used in treatment of nervous infections, asthma and whooping cough

Name: Pikari-char (Local name)
Uses: The plant extract is used for skin diseases.

Name: Bassant, Dendhu
Uses: The plant is employed as astringent, diuretic and expectorant and is  used in diarrhoea, pulmonary and urinary troubles. Infusion of fresh flowers in olive oil obtained an oil which is applied externally for sores, swellings,   ulcers and wounds and also in case of rheumatism and lumbago. Plant contains hypericin which is toxic to livestock.

Name: Tumbhul (Bihar)
Scientific Name: Hypericum uralum Buch.- Ham. ex D.Don
Uses: The seeds of the plant is having  aromatic and  stimulant properties.

Name: Bhuin khajur, Dinda kinda (Bihar)
Uses: Root used as a tonic and aphrodisiac.

Name: False Ironwort (Eng.)
Uses: It is tonic. Decoction of roots are used in amenorrhoea and the leaves act as vulnerary.

Name: Wilayati Tulsi
Uses:
It is carminative, sudorific and lactagogue. Infusion is used in catarrhal conditions, 
uterus infections and parasitical cutaneous diseases. Leaf juice is given in colic.Roots chewed with betel nuts as stomachic and its decoction is used as an appetizer.

Name: Hyssop (Eng.)
Uses:
It is pectoral, carminative. Infusion or tea is used in treating nervous disorders
 and pulmonary,digestive,urinary and uterine troubles. Crushed herb is used as resolvent and vulnerary.

Name: Rocket candytuft (Eng.)
Uses: The herb is used in gout and rheumatism and it is having antiscorbutic properties. In asthma and bronchitis seeds are being used.

Name: Kalidudhi, Siamalata
Uses:
Roots are demulcent, tonic, diaphoretic, and diuretic.
It is used in combination with bitters and arcmatics for treatment of  fevers,
 dyspepsia, and skin troubles. Powdered root is used in diabetes and store in bladder.

Name: Mate (Eng.)
Uses: The leaves comprises essential oil, caffeine, tannin and resin.

Name: Gul-mendhi
Uses: Flower juce mucilaginous and cooling, applied for intercostal neuralgia and lumbago, they improve circulation.

Name: Vashtla (Tam.)
Uses: Plant useful in healing burns also applied internally for gonorrhoea.

Name: Karya bijal (Lakhimpur)
Uses: Juice prepered from roots useful in hematuria.

Name: Ratakohomba (Sans.)
Uses: Decoction of Leaves, flowers, and tender shoots is used in cancerous infections, absecces and leprosy

Name: Andhi-neel
Uses: Leaves is stomachic and used in diarrhoea and yaws.

Name: Pharsi ghas, Hakanu
Uses: Flowers used for cough.

Name: Gujarat Indigo (Eng.)
Uses: Roots and leaves bitter tonic. Seeds anthelmintic.

Name: Pukhintaku (Local name)
Uses: Leaves used as a bitter tonic and febrifuge also used as an emollient in external.

Name: Vekhariyo (Guj.)
Uses: Seeds use as nutritive and tonic.

Name: Torki
Uses: Used in febrile eruptions, also considered a vermifuge.

Name: Pandarphali
Uses:
Juice of the plant antiscorbutic, diuretic, alterative. The plant, boiled with oil, is applied to burns. A decoction is given in
epilepsy and insanity.

Name: Jhillan (Sans.)
Uses: Plant antisyphilitic. All parts of the plant are useful in enlarge-ment of liver and spleen.

Name: Vilaiti Nil
Uses: Febrifuge, vulnerary, stomachic,  and diuretic. Used in syphilis and epilepsy. Decoction of roots and seeds used in urinary diseases and ulcers.

Name: Nil, Nilika
Uses:
Extract used in epilepsy and
other nervous disorders; in the form of ointment used for sores, old ulcers, and piles. Decoction of leaves given in blennorrhagia. Roots used in urinary complaints and hepatitis.

Name: Jangli-methi
Uses: The seed of the plant is considered of having restorative, astringent, and aphrodisiac properties and is  used in rheumatism and leucorrhoea.

Name: Vekhario (Guj.)
Uses: Seeds used as a nutritive tonic.

Name: Stinkwort (Eng.)
Uses: It is diuretic and used in calculus diseases.

Name: Poshkar (Kashmir)
Uses:
Roots  are used as a tonic and stomachic. 
Roots contain inulin (10%) and an essential oil containing alantolactone which is strongly anthelmintic.
It is also an expectorant and diuretic.

Name: Dudhiakalmi
Uses: Root and bark has purgative properties.

Name: Kalmisag, Karmi
Uses: Used for treating nervous and general debility

Name: Mitha alu
Uses: Yields an essential oil.

Name: Neeli Bel
Uses: Roots and leaves are cyanogenetic.

Name: Ipomoea coptica (Tam.)
Uses: Relieves dizziness and intoxication and chest complaints in children

Name: Dipdavel (Guj)
Uses: Seeds are antidote to hydrophobia.

Name: Nakhari
Uses: Plant used in rheumatism, epilepsy and leprosy, and ulcers

Name: Lal pungli (Mar.)
Uses: Roots have sternutatory action

Name: Michai
Uses: Seeds have cathartic properties.

Name: Kaladana, Mirchai
Uses: Seeds have purgative properties.

Name: Vachagandha
Uses: Useful in aphthous infections

Name: Bilaikand
Uses: It has tonic, aphrodisiac, demulcent, lactagogue, and cholagogue properties.

Name: Dopatilata
Uses: Leaves are used in rheumatism and dropsy and seeds in stomach ache.

Name: Panchpatri, Angulilata (Beng.)
Uses: Pounded leaves applied to boils, sores, pimples, and carbuncles.

Name: Jalap
Uses: It has purgative action.

Name: Morning Glory (Eng.)
Uses: It has purgative and antisyphilitic properties.

Name: Kamalata
Uses:
Leaves pounded and applied to hemorrhoids, carbuncles. Roots used as a
sternutatory.

Name: Bankalmi
Uses: It has diuretic and deobstruent propereties and is used as antidote to arsenic poisoning

Name: Spanish Arbour-vine (Eng.)
Uses: Used as a purgative.

Name: Kinarwel (Mar.)
Uses: Leaves pounded and applied to cuts and wounds.

Name: Leopard lily (Eng.)
Uses: Rhizomes used in tonsillitis, pulmonary and liver complaints. Also used for laryngeal tumours and breast cancer. Pulp from the stem used as a stomachic.

Name: Kota-gandhal, Nevari
Uses: Decoction of bark is used for treatment of  general debility and anaemia.

Name: Rangan, Rookmini
Uses:
Roots are stomachic and sedative and used in loss of appetite, hiccup, diarrhoea and dysentery.
They possess astringent and antiseptic properties . It is applied to sores and chronic ulcers. Flowers are given in dysentery, leucorrhoea, dysmenorrhoea, hemoptysis, and catarrhal bronchitis.Decoction is used for eye troubles and act as a vulnerary.

Name: Katkura (Mar.)
Scientific Name: Ixora nigricans R.Br. ex Wight & Arn.
Uses: Leaves are antidysenteric.

Name: Banmallica, Mwari
Uses: Leaf extract used as emetic in case of poisoning and root extract used in treatment of ringworm.

Name: Bela, Chameli
Uses: Leaves are used in the treatment of bronchitis and stomachic infections.

Name: Malati (Beng.)
Uses: Bark yields a bitter glucoside

Name: Chameli, Jati
Uses: Plant has emmenagogue, anthelmintic, and diuretic properties. Leaf juice is used for treatment of corns and mouth ulcers.

Name: Chameli, Kunda
Uses: Dried leaves used in the treatment of ulcers.

Name: Chameli, Jati
Uses: Plant has emmenagogue, anthelmintic, and diuretic properties. Leaf juice is used for treatment of corns and mouth ulcers.

Name: Karumullai (Tam.)
Uses: Leaves are used in tooth-ache relief and flowers used in treatment of piles.

Name: Vanamalliga (Sans.)
Uses: Leaves and flowers used in the treatment of eczema.

Name: Banmallika, Chamba
Uses: Leaf and root extract used in the preparation of eye lotions.

Name: Hare lahara (Nepal)
Uses: Root extract used in ringworm treatment.

Name: Kalamb-ki-jar
Uses: The drug known as-Calumba, Columba, or Columbo the source or obtained from the roots. It is a bitter tonic and stomachic. It is useful  in combination with other tonics, cathartics and aromatics, in atonic dyspepsia, gastric irritability, diarrhoea and dysentery, and vomiting attending on pregnancy. On sores powdered Calumba is applied.

Name: Bagbherenda, Jangli-arandi
Uses:
Curcas oil obtained from seeds, it is used as a powerful purgative, sciatica, dropsy, paralysis and as ointment for skin troubles and rheumatism. Curcas oil is also employed as an abortifacent and  Juice of the plant useful in scabies,
eczema, and ringworm. The leaves of the plants have rubefacient and lactagogue properties.

Name: Janglie-randi, Undarbibi
Uses: The seeds contians a fixed oil having purgative properties and applied in rheumatism and paralytic problems. The root grounded with water, is prescribed to children suffering from abdominal enlargement. also it induces purging and reduces glandular swellings.

Name: Bherenda, Verenda
Uses: For leprosy the roots of the plant is used. The decoction of leaves is having purgative and stomachic properties.  For ulcers latex is employed. The leaves are prescribed as febrifuge in intermittent fevers.For  swollen mammae is it also used. The bark decoction is utilized as emmenagogue.  The seeds are having purgative  and emetic properties. The bark constitute an alkaloid jatrophine which is similar to quinine.

Name: Bhadradanti (Sans.)
Uses: Decoction of roots given for indigestion and colic. Seeds contain a fixed oil used as an illuminant. Leaves purgative, also sed in scabies. Roasted seeds used forreating fevers and venereal diseases, but  they are dangerously cathartic, used in criminal poisoning.

Name: Kirkundi (Mar.)
Uses: The juice is employed for ophthalmia.

Name: Akhrot, Akrut (Trade)
Uses: Leaves are used as astringent, tonic and anthelmintic.

Name: Pati
Uses: Tubers tonic and stimulant.

Name: Matting Rush (Eng.)
Uses: Pith decoction is antilithic, pectoral, and discutient, diuretic and depurative.

Name: Aaraar, Haubera
Uses: The fruits and essential oil of the plant are considered as carminative, diuretic and stimulant which is used in dropsy, disorders of urino-genital tract and cutaneous diseases.

Name: Dhup
Uses:
Fruits are carminative, diuretic and used in treating dropsy, disorders of urino-genital
 tract and cutaneous diseases.?

Name: Chukboo (Sikkim)
Uses: Smoke from the green wood is said to be emetic.

Name: Dhoop Lakkad
Uses:
The bruised root is applied to eruptions and decoction is used in colic. It is applied in puerperal
fever.

Name: Arusha
Uses:
Root and leaves are used to treat cough, chronic bronchitis, asthma and phthisis. Leaves are used 
to treat rheumatism,fresh wounds, urticaria, jaundice, dyspepsia, neuralgia. Ayurvedic medicine is
used for treating bronchitis, thombocytopenia, pyorrhea, bleeding disorder, bleeding piles, cough,
dysuria, skin diseases, cardiac debility,fever.

Name: Tellarantu (Tel.)
Uses: Applied in boils and swellings and also used in diarrhoea.

Name: Udisanbhalu, Nilinargandi
Uses:
It is used as febrifuge, emetic, emmenagogue, diaphoretic.
 Infusion of leaves are used in cephalagia, hemiplegia and facial paralysis. Juice of leaves stops internal haemorrhage. Fresh leaves are used in oedema of beriberi and rheumatism.

Name: Karambal (Mar.)
Uses: Has Laxative, diaphoretic, diuretic, expectorant, anthelmintic, and febrifugic properties. Also used in asthma, cough rheumatism,lumbago, and flatulence.

Name: Bhui-champa
Uses: Decoction is applied to wounds with coagulated blood and with any purulent, and also taken for purifying blood and removing pus from the body.

Name: Haiza, Rungru
Uses: Juice of leaves is  purgative and tonic. Leaves are burnt and applied to abscesses.

Name: Hamsagar
Uses: Leaves are styptic, astringent and antiseptic.Leaf juice is used for diarrhoea, dysentery, lithiasis and phthisis.

Name: Kukumadunda (Tel.)
Uses: Roots are used in treatment of asthma and piles.

Name: Goria (Beng.)
Uses: The bark is mixed with dried ginger or long pepper and rosewater and is helpful in curing diabetes.

Name: Bhintgalodi (Guj.)
Uses: Used in treating diabetes.

Name: Common Sausage Tree (Eng.)
Uses:
Fruits are used for dressing syphilitic sores and act as purgative. Bark is used in 
treating rheumatism, dysentery and venereal diseases.

Name: Madayan samprani (Tam.)
Uses:
Oil, gum and resin used in catarrhal conditions of the
genitourinary and respiratory
tracts; also for treating sores.

Name: Panjuli, Makhi
Uses: The leaves of the plant is consider of having diuretic properties. The juice of the leaves with camphor and cubebs are given for bleeding gums. It is also utilized for diarrhoea in infants. For astringent, attenuant and diuretic the bark of the plant is used.

Name: Bola (Beng.)
Uses: Decoction of leaves useful in skin eruptions and scabies. Leaf juice applied as eye-wash.

Name: Mota-pasuti (Assam)
Uses: The plant is employed as astringent, used in dysentery, and also in mouth sores it is being applied.

Name: Kaura-ro (Punjab)
Uses: The plant is used as a cardiac stimulant.

Name: Ti Fu (Chinese)
Uses: Fruits and leaves are used as a cardio-tonic and diuretic.

Name: Kokum (Ceylon)
Uses: Bark powdered  is used in headache.

Name: Ratanya (Malay)
Uses:
Used in treating diarrhoea, haemorrhages, mucous discharges in menstrual disorders
and urine incontinence.

Name: Pula, Choupultea
Uses: Santal people pound the leaves and apply it on body in pain.

Name: Nirbisi
Uses: Leaves used in diarrhoea. Roots and rhizomes aromatic.

Name: White water sedge (Eng.)
Scientific Name: Kyllinga nemoralis (Forst.) Dandy ex Hutcins. & Dalziel
Uses: Aromatic rhizomes used as a diuretic, refrigerant, demulcent and tonic; also given in fevers and diabetes to relieve thirst.

Name: Bhatvas, Shimi
Uses: Seeds use as febrifuge, stomachic, antispasmodic, antifungal.

Name: Salad
Uses: It is tonic and possess digestive and depurative properties.

Name: Undirachakan (Mar.)
Uses:
It is used treatment of chronic obstructions of liver and bowels.
It is used as diuretic in calculous infections.

Name: Undirachakan (Mar.)
Uses: It is diuretic, tonic, and slightly aperient.

Name: Kahu, Salad
Collector: Economic collection Department of botanical survey to the
Uses: It yields lactucarium which is used as hypnotic in treatment of bronchitis and asthma.

Name: Kahu
Uses: It yields lactucarium which is used as hypnotic in treatment of bronchitis and asthma.

Name: Maravara tsjembu (Tam.)
Uses: It's very poisonous, and used in remedy for itch.

Name: Kaddu, Lauki
Uses:
Fruit pulp is used in cooling, diuretic, and antibilious. Seeds  are used in dropsy and as anthelmintic.
 Oil is used for headache.

Name: Pharash, Telingachina
Uses:
Bark is stimulant and febrifuge. Bark, leaves, and flowers are purgative and hydragogue. Roots  are
 astringent,  fruits are used as a local application for apththae of mouth.

Name: Jarul
Uses:
Leaves are purgative, diuretic, and deobstruent. Decoction of dried fruits as well as of leaves are  used in 
 treatment of diabetes.

Name: Gharei, Kashmalu
Uses: Seeds used in relieving flatulence and constipation.

Name: Sea belt (Eng.)
Uses: A syrup of saccharine obtained from the plant combined with decoction of quince seeds is given for goitre (Bronchocele) it is also given in scrofulous and syphilitic infections. A simple infusion made by steeping the seaweed in cold water overnight a simple infusion is obtained which is taken in the morning on an empty stomach to cure bronchocele.

Name: White Deadnettle (Eng.)
Uses: The decoction of the plant is used in haemorrhages of uterus and nose. The plant is used as astringent. The roots are employed in  resolvent and vulnerary. The flowers are used as  mild astringent, hemostatic, hypnotic, depurative, and tonic. Leaves are rich in carotene and is edible.

Name: Henbit (Eng.)
Uses: The plant is having stimulant, laxative, diaphoretic, antirheumatic, and cephelic properties. It is considered of cause poisoning of the cattle.

Name: Brahma-dandi (Bombay)
Uses: It has antiseptic properties.

Name: Jhingan, Kaimil
Uses: Bark used in gout; decoction for aphthae of the mouth and for toothache. Gum given in asthma; as a cordial to women during lactation.

Name: Kanta kachu (Beng.)
Uses: Plant used in colic, rheumatism, and intestinal diseases.

Name: Janglimatar
Uses:
Ripe seeds produce narcotic effect. Flowers resolvent.
Herb considered to be one of the possible causes for lathyrism.

Name: Sweet Pea (Eng.)
Uses: Seeds good source of vitamin A.

Name: Meadow vetchling (Eng.)
Uses: Seeds used as a resolvent.

Name: Khesari, Latri
Uses: Seeds toxic. Prolonged consumption results in paralysis of legs, both in animals and human beings, known as lathyrism.

Name: Red grass pea (Eng.)
Uses: Seeds poisonous.

Name: Titlia
Uses: Roots are an important constituent of galactagogue drugs.

Name: Divided-leaved Sow Thistle (eng.)
Uses: Decoction is used in constipation. Plant is  considered galactagogue.

Name: Sagar pathari (Mar.)
Uses: It is tonic, soporific, diuretic, and aperient.

Name: Madam Fate (Eng.)
Uses: An unidentified alkaloid is obtained from this plant is used in respiratory diseases.

Name: Sarpnocharo, Aasmanifalgoto (Guj.)
Uses: An essential oils is obtained from the leaves and flowers.

Name: Dharu
Uses: Medicated pillows or cushions, herb sachets and fumigating powders is made from the flowers. It gives relief for the relaxation of rheumatic and neuralgic pain fomentation with flowers is used. An essential oil obtained from the flowers is employed for biliousness, chest infections, colic, and headache.

Name: True Lavender (Eng.)
Uses: The plant is used as carminative and mild stimulant, and it is also employed in flavouring  of pharmaceutical preparations.

Name: Mehndi
Uses: Henna leaves act  as a prophylactic against skin troubles.

Name: Kakajangha
Uses:
Whole plant used in dysent,
mucus in urine, neuralgia, night-fever, pleur, pneum, rheum.

Name: Banchalita (Beng.)
Uses:
Root tubers used against
guineaworms.

Name: Kukur-jihwa
Uses:
Young leaves  juice use in digestive. Ointment prepared from roasted leaves relieves vertigo. Root antidiarrhoeal,
antidysenteric, antispasmodic,
cooling, sudorific. A decoction
allays thirst.

Name: Dholsamudra
Uses:
Mucilaginous root tubers anodyne, used on wounds and sores, and for guineaworm
and ringworm.

Name: Masur, Masser
Uses:
Seeds oup is used in gastric
troubles and constipation. Paste or poultice is applied to foul and
indolent ulcers.

Name: Hejurchei
Uses: The flowers ashes are applied to scalds and burns. The leaves are employed for rheumatism. It is beneficial in skin infection.

Name: Common Motherwort (Eng.)
Uses: The dried leaves and flowering tops is having diuretic, analgesic emmenagogue properties and is given in heart palpitation  and hysteria.  It is also employed as it tones up uterine membrane and generative organs, allays nervous irritability, and affords relief from pain in stomach and gallbladder. For  dermatitis leaves are used.

Name: Halkusha
Uses: The plant is employed as emmenagogue, tonic and  vulnerary, and is used in puerperal and menstrual disorders. The leaves and roots of the plant is used as  febrifuge. Leaf extract are considered effective against uterus contraction.

Name: Bhuiterada (Mar.)
Uses: Used in fevers and skin infections.

Name: Agnikhair (Mundari)
Uses: Useful in skin problems.

Name: Vangvattur (Mizoram)
Uses: Leaves are chewed to relieve cough.

Name: Harancharo (Guj.)
Uses: It has tonic properties.

Name: Safed towdri
Uses: Seeds (Tondri) used in bronchitis and dropsy

Name: Gonyuch (Ladhak)
Uses: Depurative and antiscorbutic, used as a resolvent in skin infections; infusion given in hepatic and renal troubles.

Name: Halim, Harf
Uses: Leaves mildly stimulant and diuretic, used in scorbutic diseases and hepatic complaints. Seeds galactagogue, emmenagogue, diuretic, tonic, aphrodisiac, laxative, and rubefacient used in poultices for hurts and sprains. Roots used in secondary syphilis and tenesmus.

Name: Dodi
Uses:
It is stimulant and restorative. Leaves and roots used in treatment of skin infections. 
Plant is  useful in in the treatment of habitual abortion.

Name: Lasobaval (Guj.)
Uses:
Seeds used as concentrates for dairy animals. Consumed in
excess, all parts are toxic to monogastric animals.

Name: Safed Halkusa
Uses: The leaves juice is applied externally in chronic skin eruptions, psoriasis and painful swellings. Flowers are prescribed with honey for coughs and colds. The plant is used as an antipyretic.

Name: Dhurpi sag, Deldona
Uses: The plant is used as a stimulant, diaphoretic, laxative and anthelmintic. Syrup prepared from the flowers are used for cough and cold.

Name: Guma, Halkusa
Uses: The  leaves decoction is having sedative, stomachic, and vermifuge properties. The fresh leaves are poultice and applied on old sores and dermatos.

Name: Barumbi (Mar.)
Uses: The plant is useful as a carminative, stimulant and emmenagogue.

Name: Mudittumbei (Ceylon)
Uses: Herb are used as an antipyretic and for skin troubles. For ulcers in the nose the decoction is employed.

Name: Jungli selai
Uses: Bark used for tuberculosis.

Name: Jaunsar-Giotra
Uses: Leaves used in applications for  bruises and wounds.

Name: Turk's Cap Lily (Eng.)
Uses: Bulbs are useful in cardiac disorders and angina pectoris. Flowers in ovarian neuralgia and myoptic astigmia.

Name: Tiger Lily (Eng.)
Collector: F. Ludlow, G. Sherriff and G. Taylor
Uses: Bulbs are useful in cardiac disorders and angina pectoris. Flowers in ovarian neuralgia and myoptic astigmia.

Name: Findora
Uses: Dried bulb scales used in pectoral problems.

Name: Kuttra
Uses: It has antiseptic, galactagogue, febrifugic  and aperient properties.

Name: Kuttra
Uses: It has antiseptic, galactagogue, febrifugic  and aperient properties.

Name: Kala karpur (Beng.)
Uses: Leaf infusion has a diuretic, stomachic, and digestive properties.

Name: Kavat, Kadbel (Beng.)
Uses: The plant produces a medicine used in Asthma, bronchitis. Roots are used in body pain, bark is used in etching, fruit is used in dysentery and to make tonic.

Name: Dieng-soh-orthai-dieng-brau-salu(Khasi Hills)
Uses: Decoction is used to relieve from pain.

Name: Siltimur (Nepal)
Uses: It is carminative.

Name: Haldi basanto (Beng.)
Uses: Juice used in bronchitis and for treating skin eruptions.

Name: Gadagvel (Mar.)
Uses: Used for gonorrhoea

Name: Malaysian false pimpernel (Eng.)
Uses: The plant is utilized for bilious diseases  and dysentery. It is also applied as poultices for boils, sores, itch, and ringworm.

Name: Hendegel ba (Mundari)
Uses: The root of the plant is used as febrifuge.

Name: Vakapushpi (Mar.)
Uses: The plant is used in gonorrhoea.

Name: Sam-tham-lang (Garo)
Uses: The plant is applied externally for worm infested skin.

Name: Tisi, Alsi
Uses: Oil forms a base for poultices, embrocations, and liniments.

Name: Yellow popler (Eng.)
Uses: Bark is used as an antipyretic and diaphoretic also applied treatment of  malaria, rheumatism, and dyspepsia. Root-bark is used as stimulant.

Name: Lichi
Uses: Leaf used in bites of animals.

Name: Corn Gromwell
Uses: Infusion of leaves are used as sedative. Seeds are diuretic and used in bladder diseases and gout.

Name: Gromwell
Uses:
Decoction of roots are given in reuptive diseases such as smallpox,measles and itch. 
Seeds are diuretic and lithontripic and used as an electuary in bladder diseases and gout. Infusion of the leaves are used as sedative.

Name: Mejankeri (Assam)
Uses: Fruit is carminative. It is used for dizziness,hysteria,paralysis and loss of memory.

Name: Kali Pahenle (Nepal)
Uses: Bark is used in poultices for sprains and wounds.

Name: Meda, Katmarra
Uses:
Bark is astringent and used in treating diarrhea. Oil yielded from seeds are used to
 treat rheumatism.

Name: Pisi, Posha (Mar.)
Uses: Infusion of mucilaginous leaves are used in irritations of bladder and urethra.

Name: Puke weed (Eng.)
Uses: Used in treatment of asthma and chronic bronchitis.

Name: Kadu hogesoppu (Kan.)
Uses: Used in curing dermatitis.

Name: Nala, Narasala
Scientific Name: Lobelia nicotianifolia Roth ex Roem. & Schult.
Uses: It is a rich source of alkaloids of lobeline group, and used as an antiseptic.

Name: Berawchal (Lushai)
Uses: Leaves and flowers are used as antispasmodic.

Name: Mochni
Uses: Used in treating convulsions.

Name: Leihruisen (Lushai)
Uses: It has Antipyretic and stomachic properties and is used in dysentery.Dried flowers are diuretic

Name: Woodbine Honeysuckle (Eng.)
Uses: Flowers have antispasmodic, diuretic, and sudorific properties.

Name: Shea, Sheva
Uses: Leaf and flower extract used in treatment of venereal diseases.

Name: Dothalu (Tam.)
Uses: No data available

Name: Kesara-dam
Uses: It forms as a  constituent of poultices used for treatment of ulcers and skin complaints.

Name: Banlunga
Uses:
It is astringent, anthelmintic, carminative, and diuretic. Decoction is  used in treatment of diarrhoea
 and dysentery, flatulence,leucorrhoea, and spitting of blood. Leaves are used for poulticing in orchitis and glands in the neck.

Name: Sukuri pota, Gara sirgiti (Mundari)
Uses: Plant is boiled in oil and applied to the body externally to bring down fever.

Name: Huring Rangaini (Mundari)
Uses: Leaves are used for the treatment of tooth ache and aching muscles.

Name: Kali tori, Jhinga tori
Uses:
It is laxative, diuretic and purgative. It is used in treatment of asthma, skin troubles, and splenic 
enlargements. Seeds are emetic, expectorant, demulcent. Fruit is  dried and powdered for using  as
 snuff in cases of jaundice.

Name: Ghiya tori
Uses:
Tender fruits is  diuretic and lactagogue. Ripe fruit is used after burning and pulverized as  carminative
 and anthelmintic. Juice is  purgative. Mature seeds are bitter, emetic, and cathartic.

Name: Bindal
Uses:
Fruits are purgative and used in treatment of dropsy,nephritis,chronic bronchitis and lung complaints. 
Fuit infusion is employed for biliary and intestinal colic.

Name: Amb-keli (Marathi)
Uses: Used in emollient and applied as poultice to boils, abscesses, and tumours.

Name: Kripa (Beng.)
Uses: Stem fluid is applied to itches and herpes.

Name: Turmas
Uses: Seeds have deobstruent,carminative, and anthelmintic properties.

Name: Blue Lupine (Eng.)
Uses: Seeds yield a fatty oil used in the preparation of glyptals.

Name: Yellow Lupine (Eng.)
Uses: Seeds use in deobstruent, carminative, alterative, anthelmintic. Used as an external application to ulcers.

Name: Kakoli (Sans.)
Uses: Dried fruits used in preparing medicinal oils and dried fruit and roots used in case of scorpion bites.

Name: Rose Campion (Eng.)
Uses: Decoction of roots applied for lung and liver complaints and also used for the infraction of lymph glands of the mesentery.

Name: Gangro (Mar.)
Uses: Fresh flowering plant is used as a diuretic in homoeopathy.

Name: Kangrem (Lushai)
Uses: The decoction of the plant is made into a lotion and it is used in beri-beri, cough and also uneasiness in the chest. The ointment made from the ashes of the plant in vinegar is used for skin eruption.

Name: Bendarli (Mar.)
Uses: It is used as a base for medicated snuff and as acovering for pills to prevent adhesion. Lycopodium is used for dyspepsia, constipation with flatulence, hepatic congestion, and pustular skin eruptions.  For disorders of the chest and urinary passage, and against rheumatism, cramps, and varices it is beneficial.

Name: Jalnim, Gandamgundu (Kashmir & Punjab)
Uses: The plant extracts are useful in the treatment of hyperthyreosis; it inhibits the action of thyrotropic hormone and thyroxin output of thyroid. The plant is having  mild narcotic and astringent properties  and it is used as substitute for quinine. The herb is also employed a as a cooling drug.

Name: Bhut-raj (Beng.)
Uses: The plant is used as  an expectorant. The fresh roots of the plant is applied externally for eczema, rheumatism,  scabies, sprains,  and wounds. Also it is considered to be beneficial for carbuncles.

Name: Japanese climbing fern (Eng.)
Uses: The decoction of vegetative parts and spores ar used as cathartic  and diuretic. The plant is used as expectorant.

Name: Curalvallipanna (Mal.)
Uses: The decoction of the young leaves are given in dysentery; the leaves of the plant is applied as poultice to skin diseases and swellings.

Name: Angeri (Nepali)
Uses: Infusion of young leaves and buds are used for cutaneous troubles; leaves are also insecticidal contain a toxic substance andromedotoxin.

Name: Burna (Beng.)
Uses: A red gum-kino is obtained from the tree which contains 10-15% tannin.

Name: Uppila (Mal.)
Uses: A red gum-kino is obtained from the tree which contains 10-15% tannin.

Name: Chanda (Mar.)
Uses: For venereal sores the paste of kino is applied for relief.  The bark and leaves decoction employed in vulnerary.

Name: Phulvara
Uses: Flowers are good source of honey. Nectar from the flowers is used in the preparation of sweet syrup, highly prized in Kumaun. Seeds yield a fat called Phulwa or Phulwara Butter, used as a cooking medium; also employed in the manufacture of margarine and as an adulterant of ghee. Fat burns without smoke or smell and may be used for making candles and as an illuminant. It makes excellent soap and may be mixed with sweet-scented oils for use as hair poma

Name: South Indian Mahua (Eng.)
Uses: Leaves are used in curries. Fruits are edible and anthelmintic

Name: Andachampa, Him champa
Uses: Bark is used as tonic, stimulant and diaphoretic.  Applied also for malaria and rheumatism.

Name: Pualeng (Lushai)
Uses: The roots of the plant contains an alkaloids.

Name: Chatri (Nepal)
Uses: An alkaloids is present in the bark of the stem. The berries are consumed and are considered of having diuretic and demulcent properties.

Name: Murwa
Uses: Leaves and flowering tops yield an essential oil applied to sprain, stiff and paralytic limbs and tooth-ache. Infusion of plant used as a stimulant, sudorific, emmenagogue and galactagogue; also used in hysteria and paralysis.

Name: Banbhindi (Beng.)
Uses:
Plant is emollient and pectoral.Root is applied in embrocations for lumbago, rheumatism and as  febrifuge.
Leaves are anthelmintic.

Name: Kamala, Sindur
Uses: The plant is having anthelmintic properties, and it is employed in  cutaneous problems. It is also used as an anti-oxidant with ghee.

Name: Barbados Cherry (Eng.)
Uses: Fruits used in diarrhoea, dysentery and liver disorders.Fruitrs contain ascorbic acid.

Name: Vallari (Tel.)
Uses: Fruitrs contain ascorbic acid in high concentration.

Name: Seb, Sev
Uses: It has anthelmintic and hypnotic properties.

Name: Gulkhair, Kunzi
Uses: This plant is used in treatment of pulmonary and urinary infections and in external application in case of absecces. Flowers used in mouth wash and gargles.

Name: Panirak
Uses: Infusion of leaves used as a nerve tonic;decoction taken as a taenicide. Seeds are demulcent,applied for cough and ulcers in the bladder.

Name: Khubasi
Uses: Leaves are used as an emollient and demulcent. Seeds demulcent also used in bronchitis, cough, inflammations of bladder and hemorrhoids

Name: Gulkhair, Kunzi
Uses: Plant is a good source of carotene and calcium; mucilaginous, demulcent, and emollient, used in pulmonary and urinary infections and in external applications for inflammations and abscesses. Flowers, Flores Malvae, used for gargles and mouth washes.

Name: Lapha, Napha (Beng.)
Collector: Reporter on Economic Products to the Government of India
Uses: Root is used as an emetic in whooping cough. Ash of dried leaves used in scabies.

Name: Kharenti, Chandiri (Mar.)
Uses: Used as emollient and resolvent. Decoction given to  cure dysentery. Flowers applied as a pectoral and diaphoretic.

Name: Luckmuna (Hindi)
Uses: Roots are used to treat belladonna, sedative, hypnotic, mydriatic, anaesthetic.

Name: Am, Amb
Uses:
Leaves used in diabetes, externally in burns and scalds. Kernel used in diarrhoea, diabetes and menstrual
disorders. Stem bark used for haemorrhages, diarrhoea,
rheumatism.

Name: Karrapendalamu (Tel.)
Uses: It is used as a source of starch and sago.

Name: Khirni
Uses: Barks have febrifuge property.

Name: Khirni
Uses: Root and bark are useful in infantile diarrhoea, also givtn in beriberi. Seeds tonic and febrifuge. Wood can stand friction and used for mills, furniture, coffins, and uprights of houses.

Name: Paharigandana
Uses: It has expectorant, diuretic and laxative properties. Used in colds, coughs  and cardiac extrasystoles

Name: Murkula
Uses: The drug is used in treating gonorrhoea.

Name: Jiti, Chiti
Uses: Roots constitute the drug whit turpeth (Safed Nisoth) which is used as a purgative.

Name: Riyong (North Bengal)
Uses: Leaves are used for treatment of stomache and other disorders of alimentary canal.

Name: Susnishak (Beng.)
Uses: The leaves and the stem are edible.

Name: Babunphul
Uses:
It is an antispasmodic, expectorant, carminative, anthelmintic, sedative, diuretic, and attenuant. It is  used particularly in ailments of
children, such as dentition troubles stomach disorders, neuralgic pains and convulsions. It is  prescribed in constitutional debility, flatulent colic, hysteria and intermittent fevers. An infusion is used for eczema, bruises, sores, and inflammation, especially in piles.

Name: Todri lila (Punjab.)
Uses: Seeds used as tonic, diuretic, expectorant.

Name: Henkal (Mar.)
Uses: Plant antispasmodic. Root used in gastroenteritis and dysentery.

Name: Susi-poma (Assamese)
Uses: Roots and barks have insecticidal properties

Name: Kramighna Phal
Uses: Fruits have antihelminthic properties.

Name: Seketia (Assamese)
Uses: Leaf extract applied to itches and other skin infections.

Name: Wilayti-gawuth, Lasunghas
Uses:
Anticholesterolemic, rich
in essential enzymes, minerals and vitamins; a preventive of high blood pressure, diabetes, peptic ulcer.

Name: Kheu (Manipur)
Uses: Oleoresin which is obtained from the plant is used as anthelmintic and in leprosy.

Name: Palore (Mar.)
Uses: Leaves, flowers, and fruits eaten. Fruit yields a black or purple dye; a pink dye is obtained from leaves and roots.

Name: Drek, Bakain
Uses: The leaves, bark, and fruits of the plant are considered of having insect-repellent properties. Leaf-juice are employed as anthelmintic, diuretic and emmenagogue. From the the tree a gum is obtained which is used in spleen enlargement, and  the infusion of bark is given in  ascariasis. Fruits  are given as tonic, in cases of severe poisoning.

Name: Safed Senji
Uses:
Plant astringent, discutient,
emollient. Used as poultice or plaster for swellings.

Name: Banmethi
Uses:
Seeds used in bowel complaints
and infantile diarrhoea.

Name: Yellow Sweetclover (Eng.)
Uses: Useful bee pasture. Carminative, emollient, and styptic; used also in the preparation of cigarettes for relief from asthma.

Name: Bililotan
Uses: It has stomachic, antitubercular, and antipyretic properties.

Name: Bilpat
Uses: Decoction of leaf used on dysentery.

Name: Soh-brab (Khasi Hills)
Uses: Plant is used for treatment of malaria.

Name: Tarali
Uses:
Roots are purgative and used in treatment of dysuria and spermatorrhoea.
Juice of the leaves are applied to part inflamed by markingout juice ( Semecarpus anacardium Linn.)

Name: Agumaki, Bilari
Uses:
Tender shoots and leaves are used as aperients. It is also prescribed for vertigo and biliousness.
 Roots are used to relieve from toothache.Root decoction is used in flatulence.

Name: Varali (Bombay)
Uses: Roots are used in treatment of diarrhea and fever.

Name: Vellaikkaya (Tam.)
Uses: Bark has tonic properties.

Name: Anjani (Mar.)
Uses: The leaves are useful as a cooling astringent, also used in conjunctivitis as a lotion also applied in gonorrhea and leucorrhoea. The root decoction is beneficial in excessive menstrual discharge

Name: Water Mint (Eng.)
Uses: The plant is having emetic, stimulant, digestive, and astringent properties,  also employed in gall-bladder and disorders of stomach.

Name: Podina, Pudina
Uses: The plant is having stimulant and cauninative properties. The infusion of leaves is given as a digestive and in rheumatism.

Name: Podina, Jungli pudina
Collector: Reporter on Economic Products to the Government of India
Uses: The plant is employed as antiseptic, carminative and stimulant. The decoction of the herb is used in fever and heat apoplexy.

Name: Paparaminta, Gamathi
Uses: The plant is having carminative,  stimulant and stomachic properties, and used for relieving nausea and flatulence. In stomach-ache and colicky diarrhoea the hot infusion is given. In  cases of rheumatism neuralgia, congestive headache, and tooth-ache it is applied externally.

Name: Pudding Grass (Eng.)
Uses: The plant is having carminative,  stimulant and emmenagogue properties and is used in flatulence, nervous disorders, and gout, also used as an insect repellent.

Name: Peppermint (Eng.)
Uses: The plant contains an essential oil.

Name: Pahari pudina, Pudina
Uses: The herb is employed as antispasmodic, carminative and stimulant. The sweetened infusion of the herb is prescribed for hysteria, infantile troubles and  vomiting during pregnancy.

Name: Whorled Mint (Eng.)
Uses: Probably the source of Russian Spearmint Oil.

Name: Bog bean (Eng.)
Uses:
It is tonic, febrifuge, deobstruent and in large doses it is cathartic, emetic, and diaphoretic.
 It is used in treatment of  rheumatism, gout, dropsy, scurvy, and skin infections.

Name: Kafurkapat
Uses:
It has carminative, astringent, and anti-septic properties and leaf infusion is used as a gargle
in  mouth wash in case of sore throat.

Name: Kafurkapat
Uses: Leaf decoction used in treating ulcers and other skin infections.

Name: Noyau vine (Eng.)
Uses: Seeds possess odour of oil of bitter almonds and used in the preparation of a liqueur.

Name: Musakani
Uses: Used in rheumatism, neuralgia and also for cough.

Name: Prasarini (Sans.)
Uses: Used in rheumatism, hemiplegia, piles, and urinary disorders.

Name: Nishothra, Terpeth root (Eng.)
Uses: It has purgative action.

Name: Sapussundu (Beng.)
Uses: Plant employed in treatment of fistulae, pustules, and tumours. Leaves pounded and applied to burns,scalds, and sores. Seeds used in treatment of cutaneous diseases.

Name: Navalicha vel (Mar.)
Uses: Employed in treating stranguary and urethral discharge and has stomachic and diuretic properties.

Name: Nagkesar, Nagesar (Beng.)
Uses: Seeds used for skin troubles and as an embrocation in rheumatism. Flowers applied in cough, buds  used in dysentery. Bark combined with ginger applied as sudorific.

Name: Muyna, Muduna
Uses:
Dry fruits are used for treatment of  dysentery and boils. Powdered leaves are useful in treatment of
  diphtheria.

Name: Champa, Champaca
Uses: Used as a diuretic in renal diseases. Flower from  oil used in cephalagia. Bark is used as stimulant, diuretic and febrifuge

Name: Pan sopa (Assam)
Uses: Bark useful as bitter tonic given in fevers.

Name: Shembuga (Tam.)
Uses: Bark and leaves used in febrifuge.

Name: Shiral
Uses: Leaves used for wrapping cigars. Green loppings used as manure.

Name: Ote budu ba (Mundari)
Uses:
Yields 4 types of medicinal oils-camphorata, citrata, menthata,
and pulegata.

Name: Karvat (Bombay)
Uses: The plant is having aromatic and carminative properties and is  good substitute for Mentha piperita L.

Name: Paprastaka
Uses: It is used to cure fever by applying the leaves to the head of the children.

Name: Paku Wangi (Malay)
Uses: The young fronds are used in chronic diarrhoea.

Name: Tara lata (Beng.)
Uses: Leaves are applied to itches and, in the form of poultice to wounds.

Name: Dom-sal, Kari
Uses: Bark has febrifuge property.

Name: Gauj, Gonj
Uses:
Root vermifuge, pesticidal,
kills lice and ticks.

Name: Bishloti (Beng.)
Collector: Reporter on Economic products to the Government of India
Uses: Roots used as fish poisining.

Name: Dieng-sohlynthein (Khasi Hills)
Uses: Bark and flowers used as a fish-poison.

Name: Jungi
Uses: Leaves used as fodder. Roots employed as fish-poison; also used on sores of cattle to kill vermin.

Name: Neem-chameli, Akas nim
Uses: Bark is antipyretic.

Name: Lajwanti, Chui-mui
Uses: Leaves and Root is Juice is antiseptic, alterative and blood-purifier, piles and fistula; also is applied externally in fistulous sores, piles and scorpion sting.

Name: Shiah-kanta
Uses: Leaves of the tree in infusion are prescribed for piles. Root's powdered is given for vomiting and the bruised leaves are applied to burns.

Name: Musk Plant (Eng.)
Collector: J.H. Sandberg, D.T. MacDougal and A.A. Heller
Uses: Has stimulant properties.

Name: Erect Monkey Flower (Eng.)
Uses: Used for treating menstrual disorders.

Name: Maulsari, Bakul
Uses: Bark and fruits used in diarrhoea and dysentery. Dried flowers used as snuff and pounded seed used in suppositories for constipation.

Name: Kaim, Kalmi
Uses: Bark and roots are used in colic and as febrifuge.

Name: Timi (Assam)
Uses: Bark is used in lowering  blood pressure and paralyses sympathetic nerve endings.

Name: Ghimasak (Beng.)
Uses:
It is stomachic, aperient and antiseptic. Flowers and tender shoots are  diaphoretic and febrifuge. 
Roots are boiled in oil for treatment of gout and rheumatism.

Name: Parppadagam (Madras)
Uses: Pectoral is used in whooping cough. Leaves are applied to boils for suppuration.

Name: Khet-papara (Beng.)
Uses: It is  stomachic, aperient, antiseptic, and emmenagogue and is  used  in poultices for sore legs.

Name: Indian Pipe (Eng.)
Uses: Roots are antispasmodic and act as nervine tonic.

Name: Surangi, Bartundi
Uses: Leaf juice used in treatment of gout. Roots are cathartic and febrifugic in nature. Fruits extract is used in treatment of spongy gums, throat pain, dysentery, leucorrhoea and sapraemia.

Name: Pitadaru (Sans.)
Uses: Root and leaf decoction is used in treatment of diarrhoea.

Name: Jangli sargua
Uses: Pods used as fried  are used by diabetics and antiparalytic. Root juice used for nervous debility, asthma, enlarged liver and spleen, deep-seated inflammation and as diuretic in calculus infection.

Name: Sahjana, Sahijana
Uses: Seeds antipyretic. Seed oil applied in rheumatism. All parts of the tree used in the treatment of ascites, venomous bites, rheumatism, and as cardiac and circulatory stimulants.

Name: Mokha
Uses: The fruit is useful in curing wounds.

Name: Karela, Kareli
Uses: The root is used in ophthalmia and in prolapsus vaginae. The fruit is antipyretic, digestive, laxative, anthelmintic, appetiser, cures biliousness, kapha, blood diseases, anaemia, urinary discharges, asthma, ulcers, bronchitis. The juice is useful in treating cholera. The fruit is used to treat syphilis, troubles of spleen, rheumatism, ophthalmia.

Name: Gulkakra, Gangerua
Uses:
The seeds are used for cough and chest complaints. The roots are used in treating rheumatism,
boils, abscesses and bubos. The seeds are useful in treatment of tumours, malignant ulcers and obstructions of liver and spleen.

Name: Kaksa, Golkandra
Uses:
The roots are used to cure head troubles, urinary calculi, as an errhine in jaundice. The leaves
are anthelmintic, cure tridosha, fever, consumption, asthma, bronchitis, hiccups, piles. The fruit is 
stomachic, laxative, cures vata, biliousness, asthma, leprosy,bronchitis, fever, tumours, tridosha, urinary
discharges, excessive salivation, troubles of heart. The root is useful in all kinds of poisoning including
snake bits and elephantiasis.

Name: Tut, Chinni
Uses:
Fruits are used to treat sore throat,dyspepsia. Leaves are diaphoretic and roots 
are anthelmintic.Bark is purgative and vermifuge.

Name: Kiskuri (Assamese)
Uses:
The root is anthelmintic,astringent. Decoction of root is used in treating internal parasite.
Bark is anthelmintic and purgative. Paste of the bark is used in treatment of gingivitis. Decoction of leaves are used as gargle in treating inflammation of vocal chords. It is used in treating scabies. Fruit has laxative properties and is used in biliousness. It is useful in treating fever. Fruit is diuretic, tonic, anthelmintic.

Name: Shah-tut
Uses:
Fruit is laxative. Bark is purgative and vermifuge. Infusion of leaves are used to drop 
blood sugar and arterial pressure.

Name: Musk basil (Eng.)
Uses: Crushed leaves applied on sprains. The leaves decoction given as a sedative in epilepsy, palpitation of heart, neuralgia and convulsions

Name: Enugadulagondi (Tel.)
Uses:
Bark used in external applications for rheumatism. Powdered seeds given as a
purgative. Hairs on pods produce intense irritation and dermatitis.

Name: Khatavangi (Sans.)
Uses: Seeds used in asthma, coughs, and tongue infections; external applications, prepared from seeds, sedative. Trichomes on pods are irritant and cause dermatitis.

Name: Kasi (Beng.)
Uses: Watery sap from stem used for coughs and fevers. Trichomes on pods produce dermatitis.

Name: Kevanch, Kaunch
Uses: Leaf applied to ulcers. Pod anthelmintic. Seed astringent, nervine tonic, local stimulant, used in impotence, spermatorrhoea, urinary troubles, leucorrhoea, traditionally used for male virility. Also used in depressive neurosis. Hair on fruit vermifuge, mild vesicant; used for diseases of liver and gallbladder.

Name: Musli-Siyah
Uses: Roots are used in snake-bite.

Name: Kathneem, Mitha neem
Uses: Leaves used in diarrhoea, dysentery, vomiting. Root juice taken for relief from renal pain.

Name: Kamini, Marchula
Uses: Leaves used in diarrhoea and dysentery and cuts. Leaves along with root-bark used in curing coughs, rheumatism and hysteria.

Name: Kela
Uses: Fruits are used as vitamin, minerals etc.

Name: Charai-atha (Assam)
Uses:
Infusion of leaves is employed for treatment of cough. Decoction of the  roots is also taken for cough.
 Flowers  are diuretic and used in treatment of dropsy, asthma, and recurrent fevers.

Name: Bedina, Bebina
Uses:
Decoction of dried shoots are  given to children for relieve from coughs. Roots are demulcent and used 
for treatment of  white leprosy and eye troubles. Decoction of leaves are  used against intestinal worms.

Name: Kaiphal, Kaphala
Uses: Bark is astringent, carminative, and antiseptic.Decoction is  considered useful in asthma, diarrhoea, fevers, chronic bronchitis, lung infections, and dysentery and diuresis. Bark is  chewed to relieve tooth-ache.

Name: Shalakat (Punjab)
Uses: Bark used as a medicine to treat rheumatism.

Name: Jayaphal (Mar.)
Uses: containing  stearic acid as the predominant saturated acid, and not myristic acid.

Name: Jaiphal, Jayapatri
Uses: Nutmeg and Mace are prescribed for inflammation of bladder and urinary passage. Nutmeg butter or fat obtained from nutmegs employed  as a mild external stimulant in ointments, hair lotions and plasters, also in cases of rheumatism, sprains, and paralysis it is very useful.

Name: Patthiri (Tam.)
Uses: Seeds are applied externally in indolent ulcers. Crude-fat or Pundi oil is obtained from the seeds which is used in rheumatism.

Name: Chapra
Uses: Fruit extract is used in treatment of tapeworm, ringworm, and is used as a laxative.

Name: Vilayati mehndi, Murad
Uses: Leaves used in treatment of cerebral infections, especially epilepsy, pulmonary disorders and dyspepsia and other diseases of stomach and liver. The decoction is  used as a mouthwash in apthae. Berries are carminative, and are given in diarrhoea and dysentery, rheumatism, and haemorrhage and internal ulceration. Myrtle Oil, obtained from leaves and flowers yield an essential oil, which is applied in rheumatism and infection of respiratory tract and bl

Name: Chathuravalli (Mal.)
Uses:
Leaves are used in the treatment of asthma, cough, rheumatism, nervous complaints.
Leaves when boiled in oil is used for backache.

Name: Mazari Palm (Eng.)
Uses: Young leaves are given in diarrhoea and dysentery. Also used in veterinary medicine.

Name: Bal-chir, Jatamansi
Uses:
It is used to treat diseases of brain, digestive system, improves vision,paralysis, chorea, epilepsy
,convulsion of children,flatulence, colic, caries of teeth, emmenagogue.

Name: Beli, Surasi (Sanskrit)
Uses: Fruits have stomachic properties. Roots have purgative and sudorific properties.

Name: Kanwal, Kamal
Uses: Carpels are ground into flour which is considered more nutritive than cereals. Rhizomes yield a kind of nutritious arrowroot, which is  given to children in diarrhoea and dysentery. Carpels demulcent and nutritive.

Name: Kanvel (Mar.)
Uses: Roots and bark extract applied to eruptions.

Name: Atta-jam (Beng.)
Uses: Barks yields febrifuge.

Name: Common Olive (Eng.)
Uses: Oil has laxative, demulcent, and emollient properties.

Name: Kahu, Kankao (N.W. Himalayas)
Uses: Leaf and bark is used in debility and act as febrifuge.

Name: Gulili (N.W. Himalayas)
Uses: Bark and leaves are used as febrifuge.

Name: Gaozaban, Shankhahuli
Uses:
Dried leaves constitute Unani drug Gaozoban. Gaozoban  is used as tonic, demulcent,
 diuretic and used as spasmolytic.

Name: Ratanjot
Uses: It is used in treating cutaneous diseases.

Name: Adder's-tongue (Eng.)
Uses: The plant is considered of having  antiseptic, detergent, styptic and vulnerary properties. The decoction of the plant is also used for angina.  On boils the warm decoction of rhizomes is applied.

Name: Sarahati
Uses:
Roots are used as a tonic and are effective in cancer treatment. Decoction of roots, leaves and bark is 
employed as stomachic. Leaves are used for dressing ulcers.

Name: Cochineal Cactus (Eng.)
Uses:
Mucilaginous joints are  used in poultices for treatment of  articular rheumatism, inflammation,
 scalds, burns, skin diseases, ear-ache and tooth-ache.

Name: Nagadali (Tam.)
Uses:
Baked fruit is used in whooping cough. Mashed up stems are used as poultice
to allay inflammation and hot ones are applied to boils to hasten suppuration.
Pulp is used in ophthalmia.

Name: Lipe (Nepal)
Uses: Medicines prepared from the plant is used in skin disease and etching.

Name: Sathra
Uses: An oil known as Origanum Oil which is obtained from the plant is having carminative, stomachic, diuretic, diaphoretic, and emmenagogue properties which is  used as a stimulant and tonic in diarrhoea and colic, also applied in chronic rheumatism, tooth-ache, and ear-ache. Because of its spasmolytic properties it is prescribed for whooping cough and bronchitis.

Name: Kananashekhara (Sans.)
Uses: Roots tonic and stimulant, used for lumbago, they are rubbed in oil and applied in paralysis.

Name: Sarsan-banda, Bhatua ghas
Uses: It is used in treating diarrhoea

Name: Ullu, Saona
Uses: Root-bark is tonic and astringent. It is used in treating diarrhea and dysentery. It is diaphoretic and used in treating rheumatism. It is boiled in oil and used in otorrhoea. Seeds are purgative. Decoction of leaves are used in treating stomache, rheumatism. Leaves are applied externally on enlarged spleen.

Name: Java tea (Eng.)
Uses: The leaves are containing of high percentage (0.7-0.8%) of potassium salts and thus it is useful as diuretic. Drug highly cumulative diuretic, most useful in nephrosis and severe cases of oedema (dropsy). In case if  kidney and bladder diseases including nephrocirrhosis and phosphaturia the infusion is used; aslo given in gout and rheumatism. The plant contains orthosiphonin and potassium salts which  helps in keeping uric acid and urate salts in solu

Name: Arjaka (Sans.)
Uses: The plant is used in  urinary complain and fever.

Name: Handi samba (Bhutan)
Uses: Decoction of root is used as a stomachic. Decoction  of dry leaves used for tooth-ache.

Name: Baga phatkala (Assam)
Uses: Pounded flowers are applied to sores inthe mouth.

Name: Silang (U.P. Hills)
Uses: Flowers are used in medicinal preparations.

Name: Royal Fern (Eng.)
Uses: The roots of the plant is employed as mucilaginous, stimulant, styptic and tonic. For intestinal gripe and rheumatism an aqueous extract of the fern is used. It is considered of having antibacterial action. It is prescribed for dysentery, rickets, and muscular debility. The fronds of the plant form a constituent of diuretic drinks and is given for swellings. The tender shoots is also used in balms and healing plasters.

Name: Sandan, Panjan
Uses:
Bark febrifuge, antidiarrhoeal,
spasmolytic.

Name: Valermani (Mar.)
Uses: Roots and leaf decoction has tonic and stomachic properties.

Name: Tinpatiya, Amrul (Beng.)
Uses: Used in treating cold, cough and diarhhoea.

Name: Amlu (Punjab)
Uses: Herb is antiscorbutic and refrigerant.

Name: Dudhialata
Uses:
Herb is antiseptic, depurative, and galctagogue. Decoction is  used as gargle. Latex is  used as a vulnerary.
 Fresh roots are prescribed in treatment of  jaundice.

Name: Sankalu
Uses: The seeds powdered are used for insecticidal and piscicidal purposes. Leaves, roots, and pods also show insecticidal activity. The seeds are being employed as laxative vermifuge

Name: Gandha prasarini, Somaraji
Uses: It has anti inflamatory properties and is used in treatment of tenesmus.

Name: Chandayra
Uses: Fleshy roots useful in uterine related diseases, biliousness, dropsy and nervous infections. Seeds emetic and cathartic infusion of flowers given for diarrhoea. Roots contain an essential oil.

Name: Doundi (Mar.)
Uses: Root-bark is tonic and astringent. It is used in treating diarrhea and dysentery. It is diaphoretic and used in treating rheumatism. It is boiled in oil and used in otorrhoea. Seeds are purgative. Decoction of leaves are used in treating stomache, rheumatism. Leaves are applied externally on enlarged spleen.

Name: Asiatic or Chinese Ginseng (Eng.)
Uses: It is used as an expectorant and antipyretic.

Name: Gunara
Uses: Used in infections of the throat and also used as an antidote in hydrophobia.

Name: Cheen
Uses: Roots considered in aphrodisiac, used and chewed with betel nuts.

Name: Gini pullu; Gini hullu (Tam.)
Uses: It's rich with carotene and also contains vitamin C, B, and tocopherol.

Name: Bharbhand, Seyalkata (Beng.)
Uses: Infusion of the petals have sudorific property.

Name: Long-Head Poppy (Eng.)
Uses: Petals have sudorific property

Name: Rough Poppy (Eng.)
Uses: The petals have diaphoratic property.

Name: Iceland Poppy (Eng.)
Uses: Fiowers and capsules are mildly diaphoretic.

Name: Oriental Poppy (Eng.)
Uses:
Petals have sudorific property, It contains thebaine during active growth, but at maturity isothebaine is mostly present, /jo-thebaine stimulates and later depresses central
nervous system.

Name: Lalpost, Post
Uses: Petals used for coughs and hoarseness, also have sedative, anodyne, and sudorific properties. Fresh petals used in the preparation of galenicals; syrup or tincture used for colouring medicines and food materials,

Name: Aphim, Posto (Beng.)
Uses: Seeds useful in diarrhoea and dysentery and in compositions for skin care.infusion applied as a soothing application. Extract used as a sedative against irritating cough.

Name: Simbi, Toranvel (Local nmaes)
Uses: The leaves of the plant is used as antidote in snake bite and also as vermicidal. The root of the plant is employed in stomachache and  venereal diseases.

Name: Mikirtengalata (Assam)
Uses: Bark decoction is used to treat wounds and also dysentery. Leaves and flowers infususion has emmenagogue properties.

Name: Ban nimbu (Beng.)
Uses: It has diuretic properties.

Name: Kurwa-wagutti (Mar.)
Uses: Used in treating colic.

Name: Penalivalli (Mal.)
Uses: Juice is used for treatment of insanity.

Name: Kodo, Kodra
Uses: It's used for diabetics as a substitute for rice and stem juice is used to clear corneal opacity.

Name: Passion Fruit (Eng.)
Uses: The plant is used in itching, wounds, inflammation; the fruit is used in Asthma.

Name: Jhumkalata, Tellajumiki (Tel.)
Uses: Fruits are emetic. Fruit decoction is used in asthma and biliousness. Decoction of leaves and roots is an emmenagogue and also used in hysteria.

Name: Kankra, Papari
Uses: Roots have tonic, purgative and diuretic properties and is used for treating visceral obstructions, urinary diseases, jaundice, and dropsy. Leaf Decoction is used for treating ulcerated nose and for haemorrhoids.

Name: Sugandha-bala
Uses: Roots are antipyretic, stomachic and refrigerent also used in dysentery and intestinal haemorrhage.

Name: Pera mutti (Tel.)
Uses: Useful as febrifuge and anthelmintic.

Name: Bara-gokhru, Kadvagokkru
Uses: Mucilaginous infusion formed is demulcent, diuretic and tonic properties and used in dysuria,gonorrhea and other diseases of urino-genital system. Decoction of roots are antibilious. Fruits are used an aphrodisiac and given as decoction for incontinence of urine, nocturnal emissions, spermatorthoea and impotence.

Name: Mishran (Punjab)
Uses: The leaves is having hemostatic properties and is utilized to stop spitting of blood. The plant is diuretic.

Name: Tube Lousewort (Eng.)
Uses: The plant is having diuretic properties.

Name: Nagdaman, Rangchita (Beng.)
Uses: The root of the plant is considered of having emetic properties. The latex of the plant is having emetic, irritant, and caustic properties and is utilized in venereal diseases. And for warts and leucoderma patches it is applied.

Name: Harmal, Isband-lahouri
Uses: The drug Harmal is obtained from dried seeds and used in treating asthma, hiccough, hysteria, rheumatism, dysmenorrhoea, and neuralgia

Name: Rose-Scented Geranium (Eng.)
Uses: Yields an oil used in pharmaceutical preparations.

Name: Cliff brake (Eng.)
Uses: The fronds of the plant is smoked in asthma and cold in the head and chest. For anthelmintic the rhizome  are used.

Name: Dopahariya
Uses: Mucilaginous capsule useful for bowel upset, decoction of it is applied as emollient. Roots antibilious useful for flatulence.

Name: Kauathodi
Uses: Roots are used in treatment of gonorrhoea.

Name: Uttaranajutuka, Sagovani
Uses:
Plant is emetic, expectorant,anthelmintic. Decoction of leaves are used in asthma. Its juice is used in 
infantile diarrhoea.Combined with lime leaf juice is applied to rheumatic swellings.Pulped leaves are applied 
to carbuncles. Plant extract is applied for uterine and menstrual troubles and to facilitate parturition.

Name: Barakkanta
Uses: Infusion of leaves is used in asthma and fever.

Name: Phandadi (Guj)
Uses: Leaves applied as a febrifuge.

Name: Bhanjira
Uses: The herb is having antispasmodic, diaphoretic and  sedative properties and is prescribed in cephalic and uterine troubles.

Name: Bata (Punjab)
Uses: Juice is used to tumours and swellings. Decoction of bark is purgative.

Name: Atrilal
Uses: Essential oil obtained from it shows activity against tuberculosis.

Name: Magenta plant (Eng.)
Uses: Pounded leaves used in skin infections.

Name: Shanshohai (Pushtu)
Uses: It is employed for acidity of stomach and tenesmus.

Name: Achu mooda (Kan.)
Uses: Dried leaves and roots are used as condiments. Fresh leaves are good source of iron, calcium, carotene and ascorbic acid. Herb are diuretic, ecbolic and emmenagogue and used in uterine troubles.

Name: Bhoj raj (Bihar)
Uses: Carrot-like roots are used as a tonic and febrifuge.

Name: Duku
Uses: Fruits are used as a condiment. They are carminative/ diuretic, imulant and tonic and also used in the form of infusion in gastric and intestinal troubles

Name: Tej raj (Beng.)
Uses: Fistular stems are employed for flutes. Roots are used as a stomachic.

Name: Banbarbati (Beng.)
Uses: A decoction is used in bowel complaints and stricture. The roots are used to stop excessive salivation.

Name: Sem
Uses: Seeds used as a diet in fever.

Name: Bakla, Lobia
Uses:
Green pod shells used as a
diuretic especially in kidney and heart troubles.

Name: Banheka (Assam)
Uses: Fruits and leaves has febrifuge properties.

Name: Kejuri (Assamese)
Uses: Riped fruits used in respiratory diseases and fever.

Name: Chiruata-ita, chitti-ita (Tel.)
Uses:
Fruits are used in respiratory diseases and fever. Fresh sap cooling and laxative.
It's gum used in diarrhoea and urinary disorders.

Name: Khajur, Khajuri
Uses: Roots used for toothache. Nira is a more nutritious and good source of vitamin B and vitamin C.

Name: Jalpapli, Panisigaa
Uses: Herb has diuretic and febrifugic properties and employed in ischuria and stoppage of bowels.

Name: Chalmeri, Harfarauri
Uses: The roots and seeds are having cathartic properties.

Name: Jaramla, Jangli amli
Uses: The plant possess astringent, deobstruent, diuretic, febrifuge and stomachic properties, and is utilized for stomach proplems for eg. diarrhoea, dysentery, dyspepsia and colicIt is also employed in dropsy and diseases of urino-genital system. In jaundice and                                    galactagogue fresh roots are used. On sores latex is applied.

Name: Kanocha, Bazarmani
Uses: The seeds of the plant is laxative, diuretic and carminative and contain a fatty oil. The leaves infusion is advice for headache.

Name: Lal-bhuin anvalah, Hazarmani
Uses: The leaves juice is adviced with coconut milk as an appetizer to children.

Name: Bhuiavali (Mar.)
Uses: The plant is having antiseptic properties. The leaves are employed for eye problems, itch, and gonorrhoea.  In mammary abscesses a preparation of roots are applied on it.

Name: Sheora (Beng.)
Uses: Smoke from the burning bark is inhaled for relief from cough.

Name: Popti (Mar.)
Uses: Fruit is used to treat ear ache. Fruit and seed is used to treat gastric trouble.

Name: Tulati pati
Uses: Fruits and leaves are tonic, diuretic, and purgative.

Name: Tipari
Uses: Leaves are used in treating abdominal disorders.

Name: Sholar (Punjab)
Uses:
Leaves are  applied to boils.
 Seeds used to expel roundworms and  given as an emetic in bilious attack.

Name: Matazor, Sarangum
Uses: Root is antiasthamatic, antibacterial, antidote, antifungal, antitussive, diuretic, expectorant, laxative and vermifuge. Root is used in treating urinary disorders, nephritis, oedema, abdominal distension. Externally, it is used to treat boils, carbuncles and sores.

Name: Kuru, Kutki
Uses: The drug Picrorhiza is obtained from the dried rhizomes and roots which is used as a substitute or adulterant of Indian Gentian-Gentiana kurroo Royle and is having bitter tonic almost as efficacious as gentian; also considered of having cholagogue and stomachic; in large doses it is cathartic  and in small doses it acts as laxative. It is beneficial in dropsy. The plant contains kutkin, picrorhizin,  and other compounds.

Name: Bonposhla (Assam)
Uses: It has febrifugic properties and is applied to sores.

Name: Bharangi, Charangi
Uses: Barks and leaves have febrifugic properties.

Name: Hawk Weed (Eng.)
Uses: Bitter leaves are used as febrifuge.

Name: Artillery Plant (Eng.)
Uses: Plants are used in gastric and intestinal troubles.infusion given as a diuretic. Crushed leaves applied to sores and bruises.

Name: Saunf, Badian
Uses: Aniseed consists of dried fruits, expectorant, stimulant, carminative, diuretic, and diaphoretic, used in flatulent colic, in the preparation of asthma powders, and in veterinary medicine. Yields an essential oil, known as oil of Anise, which now replaces the fruits for medicinal and flavouring purposes.

Name: Selvanthachedi (Tamil)
Uses: Root is febrifuge.

Name: Mala-adakka (Malayalam, Kaana Kamugu) (Tam.)
Uses: Fruits, dried husk used in flatulence, obstructive diseases of stomach, and dropsy.

Name: Chilgoza, Neoza (seeds)
Uses: Seeds are carminative and expectorant.

Name: Chir, Cheed
Uses:
It is expectorant and useful in chronic bronchitis, recommended for gangrene of lungs.   It is given as carminative in flatulent colic and to arrest minor haemorrhages in tooth-sockets 
and nose. It is used externally as rubefacient in rheumatic infections and deep seated inflammation especially for abdomen.

Name: Kabab chini
Uses: The fruits of the plant is used for dysentery and also employed as aromatic stimulant, carminative, diuretic,  local irritant and sedative. In rheumatism, gonorrhoea, and broncheal troubles it is also used.

Name: Pipal, Pipli
Uses:
Roots and fruits are used for diseases of respiratory tract. It is analgesic for muscular
 pains and inflammation. It act as snuff in coma and drowsiness and used internally as carminative, as sedative in insomnia and epilepsy. It act as cholagogue in obstructions of bile duct and gall bladder and act as an emmenagogue and abortifacient.

Name: Chab, Chavi
Uses:
Fruits are carminative and used to treat digestive troubles, haemorrhoids and after 
parturition. Roots are chewed or brewed into decoction for use in colic and used for treating dyspepsia and gastralgia.

Name: Tippili (Tam.), Pipul (Beng.)
Uses: The roots of the plant which is known as Piplamul and fruits  are used for diseases of respiratory tract. It is also employed to counter-irritant and analgesic for muscular pains and inflammation. In cases of coma and drowsiness, and internally as a carminative it is used as snuff. In insomnia and epilepsy it is used as sedative. It is employed as cholagogue in obstructions of bile duct and gall-bladder and as an emmenagogue and  bortifacient.

Name: Pahari pipul (Beng.)
Uses: Fruits are carminative.

Name: Kattumulaku (Malayalam)
Uses: It is rubefacient and is used as poultice.

Name: Shambhaluka
Uses: It Is used as uterine stimulant.

Name: Lechai (Tam.)
Uses: Fresh leaves are used as diuretic.

Name: Kakra, Kakri (N.W. Himalayas)
Uses: It is used in eczema and for whoop cough.

Name: Mastic Tree
