Uses: Resin carminative, diuretic, stimulant, astringent.

Name: Pistachio (Eng.)
Uses:
The kernel is used as a cardiac and brain tonic. Flowers are included in prescriptions for
leucorrhoea. Husk is used against dysentery and as astringent in stomatitis and tonsillitis.

Name: Jalkhumbi, Takapana
Uses: Leaves and root are used in dysuria, dysentery,  cough and asthma. Ash of the plant as an application for ringworm.

Name: Matar
Uses: Pea oil when given parenterally showed possibility of preventing pregnancy.

Name: Bhasahu (Assam)
Uses: Leaves used in poultices to swellings, and chickenpox and smallpox pustules. Ashes of the leaves mixed with coconut oil used in skin infections.

Name: Bhasahu (Assam)
Uses:
The plant is used in poultices and is applied to swellings, and chickenpox and smallpox pustules.
The leaves ashes are mixed with coconut oil and is used in skin infections.

Name: Vilayati babul, Vilayati Imli
Uses: Hemolytic agglutinating reaction is shown with human blood while using saline extract of seeds.

Name: Kachlora
Uses:
Leaf used externally as a mostrum for leprosy; also
applied for promoting growth of hair.

Name: Tumari (Hindi), Vikhari (Mar.)
Uses: Bark used in chronic bronchitis and leprous infections. Paste prepared from root used to dropsical and rheumatic swellings.

Name: Isafghol (Punjab)
Uses: The plant is the source of brown Isubgol seeds. Seeds are astringent, used in intermittent fevers and pulmonary infections and in the form of an application in ophthalmia. Juice of the seeds is used as a refrigerant.

Name: Ashwakarn
Uses: Leaves are bruised and applied to wounds.

Name: Baltanga
Collector: Reporter on Economic Products to the Government of India
Uses:
Leaves and roots astringent and vulnerary, used in cough, asthma and other pulmonary diseases. Leaves applied to
wounds and sores; extracts of young leaves showed antibacterial action. Seeds diuretic, purgative, and hemostatic.

Name: Gul, Isafghol (Kashmir)
Uses: The  plant is hemostatic and  having wound-healing property in burns and inflammation of tissues. In homoeopathy it is used in disorders of epidermis and in headache, earache and toothache. Leaves are cooling, febrifuge, diuretic, astringent and vulnerary; their infusion is used in diarrhoea and piles; decoction used as an eye-wash and their ointment in skin troubles. Roots are astringent and febrifuge. Seeds are demulcent, stimulant, diuretic and als

Name: Isubgol
Uses: Dried seeds and husk are used as an emollient, demulcent and laxative also used in chronic constipation, dysentery and diarrhoea, and inflammatory conditions of gastro-intestinal and genitourinary tract. Seeds are prescribed in febrile conditions and infections of kidneys, bladder, and urethra. Poultice of crushed seeds are applied to rheumatic and glandular swellings. Muscilage is present mainly in the husk.

Name: Kala isabgol
Uses: Dried seeds of the plant are used as a laxative in chronic constipation.It is also useful as a demulcent and expectorant.

Name: Chinar (Kashmir)
Uses:
Bark is anti-scorbutic and antirheumatic. It is boiled in vinegar and used in treating 
diarrhea and dysentery.

Name: Lal-agada (Bombay)
Uses: The leaves are crushed and are applied to stop bleeding and used as a febrifuge; also considered as a mosquito repellent. An essential oil is obtained from the leaves and flowering tops which acts as a cardiac depressant, respiratory stimulant, and vasoconstrictor; it also show relaxant activity on smooth and skeletal muscles.

Name: Lance fern (Eng.)
Uses: The decoction of the plant is used for colds, sore throat and also for itching.

Name: Gajeer mul (Beng.)
Uses: Seeds used in tootheche.

Name: Kukronda, Munjhu rukha
Uses:
Roots and leaves are antipyretic and diaphoretic. 
Leaf-juice is used in dysentery, leaf infusion in lumbago and leucorrhoea. 
Leaves are used in poultices against atonic and gangrenous ulcers.

Name: Rasana, Rashana
Uses: Plant used in treatment of  rheumatoid arthiritis.

Name: Chitra, Lal chita
Uses:
Roots are used in  treatment of leucoderma, syphilis, leprosy, and as  vesicant, sialogogue, and abortifacient. Used as substitute  of cantharides. Root tincture used in treatment of in dyspeptic and other digestive troubles and piles. Plumbagin, which is an orange-yellow pigment, in small doses has stimulant
action on central nervous system and muscles, and in the secretion of sweat, urine, and bile.

Name: Chita, Chitarak
Uses:
Root is used as  vesicant, abortifacient, and diuretic, and used in treatment of dyspepsia, piles, anasarca,
diarrhoea and skin diseases. Root paste is applied for opening abscesses. Root infusion is used in influenza and black-water fever treatment. Root bark contains plumbagin pigment.

Name: Veyvi varahaalu (Tel.)
Uses:
Latex is applied to ulcers, herpes, and used in treatment of  scabies. Seeds are hemostatic.
Bark is stimulant and its decoction is used as a purgative, febrifuge, and emmenagogue. Bark is used in
 dropsical and venereal infections and is said to be a powerful antiherpatic. Latex is  rubefacient and 
purgative; and is used for treatment of   itch, rheumatism, and gum troubles. Roots are cathartic.

Name: Lal Champa (Mar.)
Uses:
Bark is stimulant and its decoction is used as a purgative, febrifuge, and emmenagogue. Bark is used in
 dropsical and venerealaffections and is said to be a powerful antiherpatic. Latex is  rubefacient and 
purgative; and is used for treatment of   itch, rheumatism, and gum troubles. Roots are cathartic.

Name: Lal Champa (Mar.)
Uses:
Bark is stimulant and its decoction is used as a purgative, febrifuge, and emmenagogue. Bark is used in
 dropsical and venereal infections and is said to be a powerful antiherpatic. Latex is  rubefacient and purgative; and is used for treatment of   itch, rheumatism,and gum troubles. Roots are cathartic.

Name: Halis
Uses: Leaf is used to treat rheumatism.

Name: Jui-lata (Beng.)
Uses: The roots of the plant is employed as antihaemorrbagic  and stimulant. The leaves of the plant is employed as a stimulant and styptic. In colic the juice of the leaves is given and it is used as a febrifuge.

Name: Pacholi, Peholi
Uses: The plant is used as diuretic and carminative. The leaves decoction  is prescribed  in cough and asthma, and that of the roots for dropsy.  For sternutatory powdered leaves are employed.

Name: Phangla, Pangli (Mar.)
Uses: The roots of the plant is employed as antihaemorrbagic  and stimulant. The leaves of the plant is employed as a stimulant and styptic. In colic the juice of the leaves is given and it is used as a febrifuge.

Name: Sangbrei (Manipuri)
Uses: The roots of the plant is employed as antihaemorrbagic  and stimulant. The leaves of the plant is employed as a stimulant and styptic. In colic the juice of the leaves is given and it is used as a febrifuge.

Name: Asoka, Debdari
Uses: Bark has febrifuge property.

Name: Jinapanano (Guj.)
Uses: The her is useed in inflamatory swellings, urinary calculi, boils, strangury. Its Ash is mixed with pepper and applied in boils and ulcers.Pounded leaves are useful in Poultice and inflamatory swellins.

Name: Sureta
Uses: The roasted leaves infusion prescribed  for cough following fevers, particularly after measles.

Name: Lil kathi (Santal)
Uses: Applied for cough and pulmonary catarrh.

Name: Periyananka (Mal.)
Uses: Decoction of leaves applied in biliousness and constipation.

Name: Meradu
Uses: The  shoots decoction is prescribed for inflammatory conditions. Infusion is used in asthma and chronic bronchitis.

Name: Common Milkwort (Eng.)
Uses: Leaves applied in spermatorrhoea. Decoction of roots used as an expectorant in colds and coughs and also in chronic chest problems. Also applied for diarrhoea and inflammation of the urinary bladder.

Name: Meradu, Miragu
Uses: Infusion of leaves used in  cure of chronic bronchitis, asthma and catarrhal infections.Roots applied for fevers and dizziness problem.

Name: Solmon's Seal (Eng.)
Uses: Rhizomes used as tonic and demulcent; bruises, piles, inflammations, tumours, and discolouration of the skin resulting from blows.

Name: Machoti, Ban-natia
Uses: Herb astringent, tonic antipyretic, diuretic, hemostatic, and vermifuge, used in diabetes and rheumatism and for ulcers. Decoction given in diarrhoea and dysentery and to check excessive menses. Aromatic seeds emetic and cathartic.

Name: Bekh-unjubaz (Beng.)
Uses: Decoction made of shoots is used to cure ulcers; juice has cicatrizing property. Used as purgative, emetic and tonic.

Name: Paral (Mar.)
Uses: The plantis used as  antiscorbutic, tonic and vulnerary.

Name: Panimircha, Bihagni (Beng.)
Uses: Infusion of leaves given in colic and as a febrifuge. Root-stocks used for piles, jaundice, debility and consumption.

Name: Pani-mari
Uses: The plant is having stimulant, diuretic, styptic, emmenagogue, and lithontriptic properties. From the herb  a liquid extract is made which is used as n oral contraceptive; the infusion of the plant is employed in uterine disorders and as a hemostatic. The roots of the plant is used as  stimulant, diuretic, carminative, tonic, and anthelmintic. For skin infections the juice is used. Crushed leaves and seeds used as a vesicant like mustard poultice.

Name: Kochomah (Assam)
Uses: The whole plant body is used as astringent, used in diarrhoea.

Name: Kangany-machan-pillu (Tam.)
Uses: Leaves are applied to get relief from swellings.

Name: Machoti, Bara pani mirich (Beng.)
Uses: Plant prescribed as a tonic and use in the healing of wounds.. Nuts used in treatment of tubercular swellings and flatulence.

Name: Lady's Thumb (Eng.)
Uses: The plant is used as anthelmintic, carminative and diuretic.

Name: Chemti sag, Dubia sag (Beng.)
Uses: The plant is prescribed in bowel complaints and pneumonia.

Name: Amldandi (Punjab)
Uses: A pickle is produced from the plant. No medicinal use has been found in the available literature.

Name: Pygmy Smartweed (Eng.)
Uses: The leaves decoction is used for indigestion and after parturition.

Name: Jumpseed (Eng.)
Uses: Plants extract have astringent, diuretic, demulcent, vulnerary, and antispasmodic, antibacterial properties

Name: Maslun, Mameche (Punjab)
Uses:
Root stacks are used to make  tonic which is useful as astringent and used to cure dysentery, diarrhoea
and hemoptysis. Decoction prepered from the herb is used as a gargle and as for treatment of ulcers.

Name: Basfaij (Ind. Baz.)
Uses: The plant is having aperient properties.

Name: Ming Aralia (Chinese)
Uses:
Leaves and roots diuretic; their decoction given in dysuria and treatment of stone and gravel. Powdered leaves are mixed with salt and used as a
vulnerary.

Name: Fras (Kashmir)
Uses:
Bark is tonic, diuretic,antipyretic and used as substitute for quinine. 
It is used in stranguary and skin troubles. It is used in treating intermittent fevers, rheumatism, coryza, neuralgia.

Name: Hotung, Hodung (Ladakh)
Uses: Bark is vermifuge.

Name: Khursa, Baralaniya
Uses:
Herb refrigerant, vulnerary, antiscorbutic, aperient, and diuretic. applied in scurvy; used in diseases of liver, spleen, kidney and bladder. It is also used in
cardio-vascular diseases, dysuria, haematuria, in dysentery, sore nipples, and ulceration of the mouth. In homoeopathy the herb is used to stimulate gastric secretion. Roasted seeds considered diuretic and antidysenteric; also applied in applications for burns and scalds.

Name: Koli mulaiyan (Tamil)
Uses: Used as Febrifuge, aperient, and diuretic.

Name: Chounlayi, Chotalunia
Uses: Applied in asthma, coughs, urinary discharges, inflammations and ulcers.

Name: Silver weed (Eng.)
Uses: Used in treatment of kidney stones, arthritis, diarrhoea, leucorrhoea, and menstrual cramps.

Name: Merino (Punjab)
Uses: It has astringent and antispasmodic properties.

Name: Bhuitara (Beng.)
Uses: Roots are used in treatment of diarhhoea.

Name: Rattanjot (Punjab)
Uses: Root stock applied in case of burns and boils.

Name: Five-finger grass (Eng.)
Uses: It has astringent, hemostatic, and febrifugic properties and also used in treatment of diarrhoea.

Name: Tilipalang (Nepali)
Uses: It has astringent properties and fresh leaves are applied to abscesses.

Name: Karnali, Kanikar (Guj.)
Uses: Roots have astringent, tonic and febrifugic properties.

Name: Hathi Denkiya
Uses: Leaves mixed with ghee used for body pains.

Name: Parisa, Paruvakodi (Mal.)
Uses: Stems are mixed with camphor and smoked for relief in asthma. Powered leaves applied to smallpox pustules.

Name: Misagi-jollaphang (Assam)
Uses: Plants used to prepare a medicine used in fever in Assam. Whole plants are used in eatching, mediciens prepared from stems applied in wounds.

Name: Piparisari, Eddu (Tel.)
Uses: Leaves are used as vulnerary and as  cicatrizant for gangrenous ulcers. Juice of the leaves and their decoction used as a galactagogue. Poultice of herb applied to sores and boils.

Name: Komal
Uses: Roots are burnt as incense by the local people. They are used as diuretic and applied also in the treatment of itches. Infusion is  given for indigestion and irregularity of menses. Roots produces an essential oil and are a good source of coumarin compounds. Fruits used as a carminative, laxative, diuretic, stimulant, liver tonic and aphrodisiac. It is said to promote expulsion of foetus.

Name: Chaokathi (Lushai)
Uses:
It is used for treatment of  dysentery and asthma; decoction is used  as  diaphoretic. Leaves are used 
for the treatment of sprue. Juice is used to coagulates blood and stops bleeding.

Name: Agetha, Arni
Uses: Roots have laxative, stomachic, cordial, and tonic properties.Leaf decoction used in flatulence and colic.

Name: Headache tree (Eng.)
Uses: Leaves used for treating colds.

Name: Pedda-nelli koora (Tel.)
Uses: Leaves have diuretic properties and is used in treating dropsy.

Name: Chambara (Mar.)
Uses:
Leaves have diuretic and vulnerary properties and is used in dropsy  and given after
parturition. Bark and root extract used in stomach pain and dysentry.

Name: Bishkopra (Kumaun)
Uses: Plants are used externally as an anodyne, and may produce dermatitis in some individuals.

Name: Bekkra, Bhekal
Uses: Oil extracted from the plant is used in treatment of rheumatism and fatigue.

Name: Vilayati kikkar, Kabuli kikkar
Uses: Spongy walls of ripe pods are highly nutritive; a fair source of digestible protein and of importance as a stock feed.

Name: Jand, Chaunkra
Uses: Flower use to prevent miscarriage. Pod astringent, pectoral, demulcent. Bark antiinflammatory, antirheumatic.

Name: Dharu
Uses: It has Expectorant and antispasmodic properties.

Name: Zardalu, Khubani
Uses: Oil extracted from seeds is utilised in pharmaceutical industry.

Name: Gilas (Kumaun)
Uses: Stems yield a non toxic extract used in cardiac problems.

Name: Paddam, Payan
Uses: Kernel yields a medicinal oil.

Name: Alubalu
Uses: Bark extraxt used in relieving heart palpitation, diarrhoea and as a febrifuge.  Leaf infusion is used to cure convulsions in children.

Name: Galmorre (Beng.)
Uses: Bark used in treating stomach ache.

Name: Alu, Alucha, Shanalu, Alubukhara, Alucha
Uses: It has demulcent, laxative, and refrigerant properties, and used as a constituent of cathartic decoctions.

Name: Badam
Uses: Kernels are used in treatment of peptic ulcers. Unripe fruits usually applied as an astringent in gums and mouth.

Name: Mahaleb Cherry (Eng.)
Uses: A medicinal oil is obtained from seeds.

Name: Aru, Shaftalu
Uses: Leaf and bark infusion is used for treatment of whooping cough and  flowers are anthelmintic.

Name: Japanese plum (Eng.)
Uses: Fruit extract used in treatment of arthiritis.

Name: Aria, Gadharu
Uses: Leaf is used in medicines employed to kill maggots.

Name: Gargira (Punjab)
Uses: Plants are used as a stomachic

Name: Sanaparni (Sans.), Chapakno velo (Guj.)
Uses:
Root astringent, febrifuge,
antirheumatic. A decoction or
powder is used for biliousness
and diarrhoea.

Name: Amrud, Safed safari
Uses: Leaves used as an astringent for bowel troubles and decoction of bark used in treatment of diarrhoea. Fruits tonic, cooling, and laxative properties useful in colic and bleeding gums.

Name: Babachi, Babehibavanchi
Uses:
Seed used in leucoderma,
vitiligo, leprosy, psoriasis and
inflammatory diseases of the skin, both orally and externally.

Name: Parnai (Tam.)
Uses: The decoction of fresh fronds are recommended for dysentery.  The juice of rhizomes is applied to the glandular swellings of the neck.

Name: Vengai (Tam.)
Uses: Pounded leaves used as a sternutatory.Decoction given in dropsy and stone in the bladder. Bark yields a kino, applied to sores; also used for thrush and diarrhoea. Seeds emetic.

Name: Bijasal, Bija
Uses:
Yields a kino used in diarrhoea and dysentery. Aqueous extract of wood given to diabetics. Aqueous infusion of wood used in diabetes and water stored
in vessels made of this wood is reputed for its antidiabetic qualities.

Name: Raktachandan, Lalchandan
Uses: Wood use as tonic and diaphoretic, paste applied to inflammations and to forehead in headache. Decoction of fruits used in chronic dysentery.

Name: Tshaw (Burma)
Uses: The gm resembles tragacanth.

Name: Kanakchampa
Uses: Flowers useful for leprosy, inflammations, ulcers and tumours.

Name: Moochukund, Tada (Tel.)
Uses: Flowers are useful in curing bronchites, throat complaints, skin disease, leprosy, headache, inflamations, sores, biliousness. A paste is made from the flower with rice water forms an application for hemicrania.

Name: Lolgu (Tel.)
Collector: N. Rama Rao and D. Narsimhan
Uses: Leaves  used in leucorrhoea.

Name: Jermei-kyn-saw (Assam)
Uses:
The plant is used against ulcers
and boils.

Name: Sural, Bilaikand
Uses:
Tuber use as diuretic, cardiac
tonic, galactagogue. Also used forfertility control. Root used as a demulcent, and refrigerant in fevers, as cataplasm for swelling of joints, as galactagogue.

Name: Burhna
Uses: Dried herb is  used as a vulnerary for bruises and sores. Decoction is used as  febrifuge.

Name: Common fleabane (Eng.)
Uses: It is astringent and diuretic. It is used in treatment of  diarrhoea and dysentery.

Name: Anar, Dalim (Beng.)
Uses: Fruit is used in cholera, dysentery, diarrhoea.

Name: Majuphal, Mazu
Uses: Bark has astringent properties, which is used in treatment ofintertrigo, impetigo, and eczema.

Name: Falant (Nepali)
Uses: Bark extract used as an astringent.

Name: Sila supari, Iri (Kashmir)
Uses: Acorns are used in treatment of gonorrhoea and diarhhoea.

Name: Badaa Katus (Nepali)
Uses: Bark and acorns have astringent properties.

Name: Rangoon ki bel
Uses: Fruits and seeds have anthelmintic and soporific properties. Seeds also used in diarrhoea and rickets and parasitic skin troubles and has purgative action

Name: Kharsing
Uses: Resin extracted from wood is used to treat skin troubles.

Name: Dieng-iong-blei (Khasi Hills)
Uses: Decoction of roots are used for treating bowel complaints.

Name: Pulikaint (Assam)
Uses: Berries are used for medicinal purpose.

Name: Mainphal
Uses:
They are emetic and used as a substitute for Ipecacuanha (Cephaelis ipecacuanha A. Rich.).
 In small doses, it is  expectorant and diaphoretic.  Bark is astringent .Bark is given in treatment of 
diarrhea and dysentery.Infusion is used as an emetic. Bark is a sedative and is used to relieve pains due 
to bruises, and bone-ache during fever. It is also given internally and used externally as an anodyne in 
treatment of  rheumatism.

Name: Water-Crowfoot (Eng.)
Uses: Used in treating asthma, intermittent fevers and rheumatism.

Name: Chambul (Punjab)
Uses: Useful in gout, intermittent fevers,  asthma,have antibiotic activity; active principles protoanemonin and ranunculin have been isolatedfrom it.

Name: Chinese Buttercup (Eng.)
Uses: Applied as a vesicant. Posesantibacterial activity.

Name: Great Spearwort (Eng.)
Uses: Leaves applied as a vesicant in rheumatism of the joints. Herb causes irritation of the mucous membrane and inflammation of intestinal tract in livestock; the toxicity, however, is lost on drying. Protoanemonine is the toxic principle.

Name: Rough-fruited Buttercup (Eng.)
Uses: Useful in gout, intermittent fever and asthma.

Name: Jaldhania
Uses: Plant used as stimulant and diuretic. Juice useful in sciatica, rheumatism, dysuria, asthma, pneumonia and gripe. Drug used as  vermifuge and in cutaneous disorders. Seeds prescribed as a tonic and stomachic also used in kidney troubles.

Name: Muli, Muri
Collector: Reporter on Economic Products to the Government of India
Uses: Roots applied as a diuretic in urinary troubles, piles, and gastrodynia. Juice of fresh leaves diuretic and laxative. Seeds expectorant, diuretic, and carminative.

Name: Chandrabhaga, Chota chand
Uses: Roots constitute the drug Rauvolfia which is used for the treatment of  nervous disorders including anxiety states, excitement, maniacal behaviour associated with psychosis, schizophrenia, insanity, insomnia, and epilepsy. Extracts of the roots is used  for intestinal troubles. Roots are used to stimulate uterine contraction and in cases of difficult delivery. Juice of the leaves are used  for clearing the torneal  opacity. Rauvolfia and its preparati

Name: Barachandrika
Uses: Extract of the herb is  mixed with castor oil  and is applied to treat skin ailments.

Name: Basanthi
Uses: Used in treating paralysis. It is also used for the treatment of founder disease of cattle. Crushed leaves and stems are given to maggot infested wounds.

Name: Atari-lata (Beng.)
Uses: Root bark used for the treatment of respiratory troubles. Stem febrifuge. Leaves scorched and given to women during confinement. Powdered leaves and roots are applied to sores and wounds.

Name: Rukhalu
Uses: The ointment made from roots and turmeric used in itching. Juice alexipharmac.

Name: Mignonette (Eng.)
Uses: Roots useful as a laxative, diuretic, diaphoretic. Seeds applied externally as a resolvent

Name: Biringa (Assam)
Uses: The fruit  is used for treatment of herpes.

Name: Purple Buckthorn (Eng.)
Uses: Fruit is used as a purgative.

Name: Gudlei, Fagora (Punjab)
Uses: The bark is used as a tonic, astringent and deobstruent.

Name: Chato, Chadua
Uses: Fruit emetic and purgative, used in spleen infections.

Name: Wight's Buckthorn (Eng.)
Uses: Bark use as tonic, astringent, and deobstruent.

Name: Hindirevandchini
Uses: Dried rhizomes and roots are useful as a purgative and astringent tonic; its stimulating effect combined with aperient properties renders it especially useful in a tonic dyspepsia. Its use is prohibited for patients suffering from gout, rheumatism, epilepsy, and uric acid troubles. Powdered roots used for cleaning teeth, also sprinkled over ulcers. Leaf stalks have a purgative action.

Name: Archu (Garhwal)
Uses: Roots are purgative.

Name: Archu (Garhwal)
Uses: Rhizomes are bitter, astringent and purgative.

Name: Palak juhi
Uses: Fresh leaves used against eczema, ringworm and cancer.

Name: Kamo, Bhora (Beng.)
Uses:
Bark is  astringent and is  used in  treatment of hemorrhages, hematuria and angina. It is also used for
 treatment of diabetes.

Name: Brown Mallet-Wood (Eng.)
Uses: Root and leaf decoction is used after parturition. Shoots are applied to scalds. Fruit decoction is used in case of gum troubles

Name: Nichni (Punjab)
Uses: Yields an incense. Leaves are stimulant.

Name: Burans
Uses: A sub-acidic jelly or preserve is made from the petals also used in diarrhoea and dysentery.

Name: Cherailu
Uses: Leaves are used in chronic rheumatism, syphilis and sciatica. They are mixed  with tobacco and used as snuff to cure bemicrania and colds.

Name: Talisfur (Punjab)
Uses: Leaves are used as stimulant.

Name: Tsalluo (Bhutan)
Uses: Leaves are used as stimulant.

Name: Kattupera (Malayalam)
Uses: Fruits given in diarrhoea and dysentery. Root decoction prescribed for diarrhoea and stomach-ache.

Name: Sicilian Sumac (Eng.)
Uses: Leaves and seeds astringent, styptic.

Name: Momphulai (Beng.)
Uses: Galls on the branch are astringent, tonic, expectorant, and stimulant, used in diarrhoea and dysentery. Extract of leaves shows anti-cancer and anti-viral action. Juice powerful vesicant; also used in colic.

Name: Nutgall tree (Eng.)
Uses:
Galls used in ointments and suppositories employed in
the treatment of haemorrhoids,
swellings and wounds. Fruits
used for colic, diarrhoea and dysentery.

Name: Tung, Raitung
Uses:
The root bark is used for irritable bladder, bed-wetting
and urinary incontinence.

Name: Dor (Punjab)
Uses: Leaves contain tannin. Juice from the tree is a vesicant.

Name: Kakra-singi
Uses: Thorn-like excrescences on the branches used in diarrhoea, dysentery and vomiting. Fruits used as an adjuvant in tuberculosis.

Name: Daktaranghevda (Mar.)
Uses:
Leaves used as an abortifacient. Toxic to fish. Seeds poisonous, extract shows specific agglutinating activity with
certain types of red blood cells.

Name: Draupadi mala
Uses: Used as an skin emollient.

Name: Amlanch (Punjab)
Uses: Branches are Used as symbol in religious rites. No medicinal use has been found in the available literature.

Name: Askuta (Ladakh)
Uses: Fruits are purgative in nature.

Name: Erandi
Uses: The poultice of leaves are applied for boils and sores. The decoction of roots is prescribed for lumbago.

Name: Phanji (Sans.)
Uses: Juice used in piles and phthiriasis treatment

Name: Chamsuru
Uses: Herb diuretic stimulant and antiscorbutic. Useful in diarrhoea, dysentery and fevers. Seeds applied as laxative, used in asthma.

Name: Yellow marshcress (Eng.)
Uses: Herb antiscorbutic, tonic,stimulant, diuretic, deobstruent, hepatic and stomachic.

Name: Chhuch, Jal-indushoor
Uses: Herb diuretic stimulant and antiscorbutic. Useful in diarrhoea, dysentery and fevers. Seeds applied as laxative, used in asthma.

Name: Bank's Rose
Uses: Root is used as a tonic and has anthelmintic properties.

Name: Kuji, Kunja
Uses: Root used in treatment of eye infections.

Name: Gulab
Uses: Flower decoction used in treatment of ulcers, haemorrhages and diarrhoea

Name: Fasli Gulab
Uses: Tonic obtained from flowers are used in cardiac troubles and enlarged tonsils.

Name: Multiflora Rose (Eng.)
Uses: Fruits are cathartic and used for treatment of ulcers.

Name: Rasagaree (Nepali)
Uses: Dried leaves and flower-buds are used in medicine.

Name: Rusmari
Uses: It has carminative properties and acts as a cardiac stimulant.

Name: Sherni (Mar.)
Uses:
Decoction of roots are used as diuretic and laxative and used for treatment of piles,
stones in bladder and venereal diseases.

Name: Patkarru
Collector: O. Polunin, W.R. Sykes and L.H.J. Williams
Uses: The plant produces a medicine used for purification of blood, fever, pimples.

Name: Manjit, Manjitha
Uses: Root extract are antidysenteric and antiseptic in nature. Leaf and stem decoction is used as vermifuge and is also a constituent of the drug septilin, which is used for rhinosinal infections.

Name: Bacho (Punjab)
Uses:
Roots are astringent, tonic, diuretic, and lithontriptic. It is  used  in treatment of  diseases of liver, 
gall bladder ,spleen ,arthritis and bed sores.

Name: Katsoi (Kumaun)
Uses: Fruit juice used in treatment of fistula.

Name: Khatta palak
Uses: Herb has antiscorbutic property (vitamin C 124 mg/100 g). It is also useful in bronchial diseases and in homoeopathy for skin related troubles and convulsions. Leaves are used as refrigerant and diuretic. Leaves are used for cutaneous tumours. Infusions of roots are used as a diuretic and for skin troubles. Root powder used in diarrhoea.

Name: Chuk
Uses: Leaves are useful in cancer and other tumours. Fresh plant juice is refrigerant, diaphoretic, diuretic, and antiscorbutic. Total ascorbic acid content of leaves varies from 750-1200 mg/100 g on dry weight basis. Young leaves contain maximum amount of ascorbic acid and the free ascorbic acid content (50-150 mg/lOOg) remains constant throughout the year.

Name: Yellow Dock (Eng.)
Uses: Root is purgative. Seeds are applied in diarrhoea.

Name: Ambavah, Amrule
Uses: Leaves are rich source of calcium (612 mg/100 g),p- carotene, vitamin A (11,700 I. U./I00 g), and vitamin C (115 mg/ 100 g). Roots used in cutaneous disorders

Name: Jub-palum, Jungli palak
Uses: Plants are used as refrigerant,  also used as antipruritic. Leaves are cathartic, also applied to urns.

Name: Pahari palang
Uses: Infusion of leaves are given in colic and given to syphilitic ulcers; strong decoction useful for bilharziasis. Leaves give relief from irritation caused by stinging nettle.

Name: Ambavati
Uses: Leaf juice is an antiscorbutic. Herb is refrigerant and astringent, given in dysentery.

Name: Moto khadsalyo (Guj.)
Uses: Pounded leaves is applied in contusions and Roots have febrifugic properties.

Name: Kharmor
Uses: Dried herb used in treating cough and cold and fresh pounded leaves applied to scalp infections.

Name: Garden Rue (Eng.)
Uses: It has anthelmintic, antispasmodic, antiepileptic, rubefacient, and emmenagoguic properties.

Name: Kans
Uses: Roots used in dysentery, strangury, boils, eye diseases etc.

Name: Kans, Kas
Uses: Root is used as a galactagogue and diuretic.

Name: Sageree, Harkinjal (Mar.)
Uses: Leaves used for treating rheumatism.

Name: Chhoto-kut, Muya Muya (Beng.)
Uses: Tubers used for cutaneous troubles. Leaves powder used for relief from itch, sore throat and inflammation of the breast.

Name: Saptrangi, Dimal (Beng.)
Uses:
Roots used in diabetes. Also used for amenorrhoea,
dysmenorrhoea and genito-urinary and venereal diseases.

Name: Chundan (Tam.)
Uses:
Root bark used for the treatment rheumatism; also for
gonorrhoea, swellings and skin
diseases. Plant mildly antiseptic.

Name: Saptarangi, Etanayakam (Sans.)
Uses: Plant mild antiseptic. Root bark used against gonorrhoea, skin diseases and inflammations. The root bark exhibits hypoglycaemic activity.

Name: Muchul (Guj.)
Uses: The whole plant produces a medicine used for abortion.

Name: Bada, Bed
Uses: Decoction of bark is used as febrifuge.

Name: Attuppalai (Tel.)
Uses: Catkins and young twigs are used as an antipyretic. Infusion of leaves are used in treating rheumatism.

Name: Bedmushk
Uses:
Decoction of leaves are used as febrifuge. Bark and twigs are used in astringent
 applications for piles. Ashes of wood in hemoptysis and mixed with vinegar and applied to piles.

Name: Bod, Bent
Uses: Dried leaves are mixed with sugar and are given for rheumatism, epilepsy, venereal diseases, stones in bladder, piles, swellings. Bark is used as febrifuge.

Name: Ellakura (Tel.)
Uses: Ashes of the plant are applied in itching.

Name: Sajjibuti (Punjab)
Uses: Plant is anthelmintic, diuretic, emmenagogue  and cathartic.

Name: Bahapilu, Chootapilu
Uses:
Leaves are used for relief in cough. 
Fruits are used for enlarged spleen ,low fever, and rheumatism. 
Root-bark is used as a vesicant. 
It is also used for rheumatic pains and in suppositories, and forms an ointment base.

Name: Jhak, Kharjal
Uses: The decoction of roots is used as a tonic and emmenagogue. Stem and bark is used for gastric troubles and as an ascarifuge.The decoction of leaves used in cough and asthma, their poultice used for treatment of piles and tumours. Fruits are lithontriptic, diuretic, deobstruent,carminative, and stomachic and are used in biliousness and rheumatism.  A fatty oil applied on rheumatic swellings is obtained from the seeds.

Name: Tukham malanga (Punjab)
Uses: Seeds are used for treating diarrhoea and hemorrhoids.

Name: Thuth, Kali jarri (Punjab)
Uses: Leaves applied to boils, wounds, and chronic skin infections. Seeds are employed in colic, dysentery, and hemorrhoids.

Name: Salvia sefakuss
Uses: Used in treating gynocological problem.

Name: Kaka-buradi (Beng.)
Uses: Used in treating menorrhagia,diarrhoea, and hemorrhoids

Name: Nibam, Mepa, Karinjottei (Tam.)
Uses: Bark juice used in treating skin infections.

Name: European or Black Elder (Eng.)
Uses: Leaf decoction has laxative, diuretic, and diaphoretic properties. Roots are emetic and diuretic. Fruit extract is used in treatment of  colds, inflamed throat, gout, rheumatism, and neuralgia.

Name: Richhkas (Punjab)
Scientific Name: Sambucus wightiana Wall. ex Wight & Arn.
Uses:
The roots, berries and leaves of the plant is used as a purgative and in dropsy.
Root or inner bark decoction is an effective diuretic. Leaves are diaphoretic, expectorant,  and diuretic.

Name: Sayai (Tam.)
Uses: Roots used in treating diarrhoea and dysentery.

Name: Kalavidhara, Vidhara
Uses: Roots and twigs used as a bitter tonic and for rheumatism, scurvy, pulmonary complaints, and diabetes; also used as a mild aperient and in external applications for ulcers and skin troubles.

Name: Safed chandan, Sandal
Uses: Both the wood and oil are diuretic, diaphoretic, and expectorant.

Name: Ritha, Reetha
Uses: Fruits emetic and expectorant; used in excessive salivation, chlorosis and epilepsy.

Name: Reetha, Ritha
Uses: Fruit Pulp aqueous solution used as nasal drops in migraine, epilepsy and hysteria. Root used for gout, rheumatism and paralysis.

Name: Hurna
Uses: The  root-bark decotion is considered of having emetic and purgative properties  and it is also utilized in hydrophobia and insanity.

Name: Khinna, Khirun
Uses: The milky juice of the plant is having acrid and vesicant qualities.

Name: Pippalyang, Vilayati-shisham
Uses: The oil is considered of having vulnerary, emetic and purgative properties and is utilized for cutaneous problems. The root bark decotion is prescibed  in dyspepsia also used as a tonic. The  resin obtained from the bark is having purgative properties.

Name: Bhedeli (Assam)
Uses: Leaves are useful for relieving stomach pain and flatulance.

Name: Asok, Ashoka
Uses: Flowers use as pounded and mixed with water, used in haemorrhagic dysentery, bleeding piles and retention of urine.

Name: Sukat sing (Kumaun)
Uses: Leaves of the plant is utilized for rheumatism and as febrifuge.

Name: Somlata
Uses: Dried stems  are emetic. Infusion of roots is given to persons bitten by rabid dogs.

Name: Muroakiriya (Sinhalese)
Uses: Dried stems  are emetic. Infusion of roots is given to persons bitten by rabid dogs.

Name: Phok (Mar.)
Uses: Dried stems  are emetic. Infusion of roots is given to persons bitten by rabid dogs.

Name: Ingudi (Sans.)
Uses: Fruits used in rheumatism and bark in leprosy and hysteria.

Name: Summer Savory (Eng.)
Uses: The plant is having carminative, digestive, diuretic, laxative, stomachic, sudorific, and vermifuge properties. It is employed in menstrual suppression and flatulent colic. A tea prepared from the leaves is given as an expectorant and carminative. An essential oil- Oil of Savory is obtained from the herb which is used for the same purposes as the herb which possesses antibacterial and antifungal activity

Name: Nurki (Mar.)
Uses: Tubers used as  stimulating poultice.

Name: Thavasai murungai (Tam.)
Uses: Plant is known for its high vitamin content and called Multivitamin Green. Decoction of roots given in stricture of the bladder and in fevers

Name: Tellavusirika (Tel.)
Uses: For the cure of tonsillitis the  smoke of dried leaves are utilized.

Name: Gangamula (Assam)
Uses: Juice of the roots are a common ingredient of medicines used for female troubles.

Name: Kut
Uses: Leaves are purgative and antisyphilitic.

Name: Batula (Punjab)
Uses: Seeds are used as a carminative. Crushed leaves are applied to wounds

Name: Kut, Kur
Uses:
Roots are tonic, stomachic, carminative, and stimulant. It is used as a spasmodic in asthma and cough, and in treating  rheumatism
and chronic skin diseases.  Alcoholic extract of roots, containing both the essential oil and alkaloid, has been found effective in bronchial
asthma particularly of vagotonic type.

Name: Kanwal (Punjab)
Uses: Roots are used in preparations applied to wounds and cuts.

Name: Bhadrak (Mar.)
Uses:
Leaves are used in treating indigestion, tumours and swollen legs. Fruits used
for eye troubles, inducing menstruation. Root decoction used in dysentery.

Name: Chilauni, Kanak
Uses: Plant is used as anthelmintic and rubefacient

Name: Kusum
Uses: Seed oil used for massage in rheumatism and applied in alopecia, itch and acne; stimulates hair growth.

Name: Moka, Banpalas
Uses:
Leaves are used in treatment of spleen enlargement and urinary discharges. Roots are 
used in treatment of leprosy and bark in treatment of boils.

Name: Nepal nimb, Sanipat
Uses: Used in controlling fevers and has diuretic properties.

Name: Safedi-khus
Uses: Used as an expectorant, diuretic and cardiac stimulant.

Name: Gajapipal, Pippal-jhanca
Uses: Fruits stimulant, diaphoretic, carminative and anthelmintic, diarrhoea, asthma. Fruits as well as shoots show hypoglycaemic activity and the former also show antiprotozoal activity.

Name: Chichora
Uses: Tubers given to stop diarrhoea and vomiting.

Name: Kasuru, Kesur
Uses: Tubers are nutritious, diuretic, and astringent, used in diarrhoea and to stop vomiting.

Name: Great Bulrush (Eng.)
Uses: Rhizomes used as astringent and diuretic and suspected of poisoning cattle.

Name: Saltmarsh buirush (Eng.)
Uses: Tubers used as laxative.

Name: Nutrushes (Eng.)
Uses: Fruits useful in coughs. Rhizome used for stomach disorders.

Name: Nakkupullu (Malayalam)
Uses: Plant antinephritic. Young tops given to children with enlarged stomach. Decoction of roots given after parturition.

Name: Jastimadhu (Santal)
Uses: The leaves infusion is employed in bronchitis, cough and feve and also prepared gargle for toothache.The plant  decoction is utilized for gravel and other renal troubles. From the leaves stems of green plants amellin-an antidiabetic compound is obtained which is beneficial in anaemia, albuminaria, ketonuria, retinitis, and other problems related with diabetes mellitus.

Name: Daampaate (Nepali)
Uses: Employed in rheumatism.

Name: Common Skullcap (Eng.)
Uses: It has laxative, febrifuge, antispasmodic, nervine, anodyne, and stomachic properties and is employed in epilepsy, intermittent fever, and ague.

Name: Bhuierendi (Konkan)
Uses: The decoction of the plant is prescribed  with ghee as a tonic. It is also applied to head in vertigo. The juice  of the plant is employed in diarrhoea.

Name: Shadaburi (Beng.)
Uses: Roots are acrid, emetic.

Name: Hartho, Ainta
Uses: The leaves juice or its paste is utilized along with tobacco to kill worms in the sores.

Name: Dalme, Patala
Uses: The roots of the plant is having analgesic and aphrodisiac properties. The juice of the leaf is used for killing the worms in the sores. The decoction of leaves is given as a laxative and antipyretic.

Name: Multi-Stem Sedum (Eng.)
Uses: It is emollient and vulnerary.

Name: Bhela, Bhilawa
Uses:
Toxic drug, used only after
curing. Fruit used in rheumatoid arthritis and for the treatment of tumours and malignant growths.

Name: Lemon Bean Bush (Eng.)
Uses: Seeds are used for colic.

Name: Cheerful Senecio (Eng.)
Uses:
Flowers are crushed and applied on wounds as an antiseptic. Root powder is used against rheumatic
 pain. Infusion of roots is used in treating indigestion. Plant is used as poultice, ointment/lotion is applied 
to relieve pain and inflammation.The lotion is a good pain reliever of rheumatism,rheumatoid arthritis and neuralgic pain such as sciatica.

Name: Poshkar (Kashmir)
Uses: Root is used as a nervine tonic and for cutaneous troubles.

Name: Katimera (Tel.)
Uses: Leaves are emollient and vulnerary.

Name: Groundsel (Eng.)
Uses:
It is used in treatment of dysmenorrhoea and amenorrhoea and also act as a
 diaphoretic, diuretic, and tonic. Infusion is used as a lotion in chronic mastitis,
 hemorrhoids, and gout. Its extract is  given in colic and as a vermifuge. 
Decoction is purgative and emetic.

Name: Til
Uses:
Fresh leaves are used in treating infections of kidneys and Bladder. It is applied externally 
applied to cure ophthalmic and cutaneous complaints.It is emollient, lactagogue, and diuretic.

Name: Ikkada
Uses: Plant used for treating wounds. Seeds used externally in ringworm and skin diseases.

Name: Bak, Agasti
Uses:
Plant astringent, antihistaminic,
febrifuge. Used for intermittent fevers, catarrh, cough, consumption, glandular enlargement.

Name: Jainti, Jait
Uses:
Leaves antiinflammatory. Bark juice applied to cutaneous eruptions. Unsaponifiable
matter of fixed oil from seeds
cardiac depressant, antibacterial. Seed and bark  used in menorrhagia, spleen enlargement and diarrhoea.

Name: Vanayamani (Sans.)
Scientific Name: Seseli diffusum (Roxb. ex Sm.) Santapau & Wagh
Uses: Plants are used for mental disorders. Roots used as well as aerial parts yield volatile oils. Volatile oil obtained from aerial parts causes a fall in blood pressure, vasoconstriction aud stimulation of respiration.

Name: Bhootakeshi (J &K)
Uses: Plants are used for mental disorders. Roots are used as well as aerial parts yield volatile oils. Volatile oil obtained from aerial parts causes a fall in blood pressure, vasoconstriction aud stimulation of respiration.

Name: Kangni
Uses: Leaves used in menstruation.

Name: Sal, Sakhu
Uses: Useful as an astringent in diarrhoea and dysentery.

Name: Bariara, Kareta
Uses: Leaves are demulcent and diuretic.Leaves boiled in oil and applied to testicular swellings and in elephantiasis. In Africa, used as an abortifacient. Decoction o f leaves and roots emollient, used for hemorrhoids and impotence. Roots used as tonic, stomachic, diaphoretic, and antipyretic,used in nervous and urinary disorders and bowel complaints;

Name: Bhiunli, Junka (Beng.)
Uses: Plant produces a medicine used in asthma, bone fracture, cuts and wounds.

Name: Kungyi
Uses: Plants produces tonic and  emollient, astrigent, aphrodisiac mediciens. Removes "vata" and "Pitta". Good in cough as pectoral and bechic. Bark use ful in discharging urinary troubles and discharges. The bark of the root with sesamum oil and milk is very effective in curing facial paralysis  and sciatia caused by inflamation of nerve.

Name: Ball (Rajasthan)
Uses: Powdered seeds are mixed with jaggery and given in lumbago.

Name: Lal barela
Uses: Used in rheumatism and tuberculosis. Stem abounds in mucilage and used as a demulcent and emollient; used also for skin troubles and as a diuretic and febrifuge.

Name: Pilibadkadi (Guj.)
Uses:
It  possess healing properties in treating gangrenous ulcers and sores. 
Tincture of plant is used externally with glycerine to cure ringworm and other parasitic infections. Herb is considered diaphoretic, cardiotonic, antiscorbutic, and sialagogue and  used in treating  rheumatism and renal colic.

Name: Cone campion (Eng.)
Uses: It is used as emollient. Juice applied in ophthalmia.

Name: Windmill Pink (Eng.)
Uses: It is used as emollient. Juice applied in ophthalmia.

Name: Milk Thistle (Eng.)
Uses:
It is used in jaundice and treatment of other biliary infections; intermittent fevers, dropsy, 
and uterine trouble.It is also a reliable galactagogue. Decoction is used as an application for cancer. Leaves are aperient and sudorific. Seeds are used in treatment of  jaundice, calculi of liver and gallbladder, and hemorrhages. Young leaves  are consumed for treatment of  diabetics.

Name: Tumble-Mustard (Eng.)
Uses: Leaves and flowers astringent and antiscorbutic.

Name: Khubkalan
Uses: Seeds expectorant, febrifuge,and rubefacient, used in asthma, and employed in the preparation o f stimulatingpoultices.

Name: Small tumble weed mustard (Eng.)
Uses: Seeds useful in scurvy and scrofula.

Name: Kedarpatta, Masturipath (Local names)
Scientific Name: Skimmia laureola (DC.) Sieb. & Zucc. ex Walp.
Uses: Yield a medicinal oil.

Name: Barichob-chini
Uses: Tuberous root is used for sores and syphilis.

Name: Hindichobchini
Uses: Tuberous rhizome is used in rheumatism and sores.

Name: Jangli- aushbah, Chob-chini
Uses: Used as an alterative in syphilis, scrofula etc.

Name: Naichibha (Mar.)
Uses:
Herb laxative and tonic, used in biliousness and rheumatism; also given to women to cure
sterility.

Name: Odabrini
Uses: Herb boiled and given for gravel and difficulty in micturition.

Name: Narkanta (Rajasthan)
Uses: Decoction of leaves are used for ulcers.

Name: Kakmachi (Sans.)
Uses:
It is used for tumours and warts, chronic rheumatism and skin infections. Infusion of dried branches are credited with sedative
and analgesic properties

Name: Vidari (Sans.)
Uses:
Decoction of roots are used for body pains, vertigo and urinary troubles. 
Leaves are applied during  vaginal discharges.

Name: Garbhada (Sans.)
Uses:
It is employed for sore-throat, cough, asthma, pain in the chest, dropsy and rheumatism. Decoction is given as an antipyretic.
Decoction of roots are given as a digestive and to relieve labour pain. Seeds and roots given to improve appetite.

Name: Howa (Punjab)
Uses: Fruits are used in otitis.

Name: Barhanta, Birhatta (Hindi)
Uses:
Roots  are carminative and expectorant. It is  useful in treating coughs and catarrhal infections, dysuria, and colic. It is pounded and
applied to nasal ulcers. Also an ingredient of Dasamula, an important Ayurvedic medicine

Name: Bengan, Ubhi ringani (Guj)
Uses: Roots juice employed for otitis and nose ulcers. Leaves are used in bronchitis, asthma, and dysuria and liver complaints.

Name: Makoi
Uses:
It is antiseptic and antidysenteric, used in cardalgia and gripe. Infusion of  herb is  applied to anthrax pustules. The herb is  also
used as a diuretic and laxative; decoction  is  narcotic and antispasmodic. Freshly prepared extract of herb is effective in cirrhosis  of liver. Juice of  fresh leaves produces dilatation of  the pupils. Berries are  tonic, diuretic and cathartic and used in anasarca and heart diseases. They are
employed as a domestic

Name: Mungaskajur
Uses: Roots are diuretic.

Name: Kateli, Katai
Uses: Roots are expectorant and form a constituent of the well-known Ayurvedic preparation Dasamula. They are employed  in treaing cough,asthma, and pain in the chest. Stem, flowers, and fruits are carminative and used in treating  the burning sensation in the feet accompanied by vesicular watery eruptions. Juice of  berries are used for sore-throat. It is used  in treatment of asthma and cough. Juice of the leaves are  mixed with black pepper and  prescrib

Name: Titbaigun (Beng.)
Uses:
It is useful in curing  liver as well as spleen enlargement.Decoction is given for treating  cough. Herb is used as a sedative, diuretic and digestive.
Leaves are hemostatic. Roots are used in poultices used for cracks in the feet.

Name: Alarka (Sans.)
Uses: Roots are used for consumption in the form of electuary, decoction or powder. Berries and flowers are used for cough.

Name: Alu
Uses: Potatoes are used as antiscorbutic, aperient, diuretic, and galactagogue. Extract of leaves is used as antispasmodic in cough. Tuber is ground and made into a paste for application to burns with much benefit.

Name: Woundwort (Eng.)
Uses:
It is diuretic, lithontriptic, vulnerary, sudorific, and carminative.
It is used in treatment of uremic asthma, whooping cough, internal lesions, dropsy, and chronic eczema.It is also used in acute and chronic nephritis and oedema of renal nature with history of dystrophy. In powder form the herb is used for cicatrization of old ulcers. Dried and powdered roots are used in treatment of diarrhoea and dysentery. Quercetin in the plant accounts for the v

Name: Didhi
Uses: Herb is used as an emollient. It is pounded and applied to wounds and boils.

Name: Sadhi
Uses: Roots are used in cough, bronchitis, asthma, and pertussis. Leaves are applied to swellings. Latex is used for eye troubles.

Name: Dudhi, Dodak
Uses:
It is valued as a galactagogue and for liver troubles. Leaves and roots  are used in
 indigestion and act as a febrifuge. Roots are vermifuge. Stems  are given as a tonic and sedative. The latex is a cathartic and is used for ascites and hydrothorax.

Name: Orcha, Archa (Beng.)
Uses: Pericarp is used as vermifuge.

Name: Kun, Malan (Punjab)
Uses: Seeds used for destroying vermin. Roots promote hair growth.

Name: Silver Bush (Eng.)
Uses:
Leaves used as emetocathartic. Seeds dangerously emetocatharitc, toxic, febrifugal,
stomachic. Roots and seeds have been considered as specifics in bilious sickness.

Name: Dudhali (Mar. & Guj.)
Uses: The juice of the plant is applied to sores on feet which is affected due to moisture.

Name: Baakhre jhaar (Nepali)
Uses: Yields tannin.

Name: Baltal (Punjab)
Uses: Fruits have depurative, diuretic, emmenagogue, aperient, and antiscorbutic properties and is used in treatment of hemorrhoids and gall blader irritation.

Name: Baru
Uses: Grains diuretic and demulcent.

Name: Rohun, Rohunna
Uses:
Bark used in the treating diarrhoea,dysentery, and fevers, and its decoction in gargles,
vaginal infections, rheumatic swellings and enemata

Name: Kondamuritidi (Tel.)
Uses: Root extract is used in treatment of diarrhoea and muscle soreness.

Name: Sveta hapusa (Sans.)
Uses: Juice of the leaves are used in gargles.

Name: Mundi, Gorakh mundi
Uses:
Juice is styptic and  also used in treatment of  hepatic and gastric disorders.
 Pulverized roots and seeds are used as anthelmintic. 
Decoction is used in treatment of cough and chest troubles. Flower is tonic and depurative.

Name: Tukha-karaing (Kach.)
Uses: Root decoction is used in rheumatism.

Name: Akkalkara (Mar.)
Uses:
Pungent flowers are chewed for relief in throat infections and paralysis of tongue; also used for  treating stammering among children.
Tincture of the capitula acts as a sialagogue and stimulant and used in caries and reducing inflammation of jaw-bones. Herb is 
used in dysentery. Decoction is given as a lithontriptic and diuretic.It is  also used in scabies and psoriasis. Roots are purgative.

Name: Para cress (Eng.)
Uses: Leaves  are diuretic. Lipids in the leaves possess antibacterial action. Fruits demulcent and diuretic, employed in fevers and inflammation of bowels.

Name: Ambada, Jangali Aam
Uses: Leaves, bark astringent, antidysenteric, antispeptic, antiscorbutic. Bark paste applied externally to articular and muscular rheumatism. Root used for regulating menstruation.

Name: Marsh Woundwort (Eng.)
Uses: The plant is employed as tonic and diuretic. The plant is having antispasmodic, expectorant, emetic, emmenagogue, and sedative properties. It is used in gout, pain in the joints, cramps, falling sickness, and vertigo.  The crushed leaves are applied on wounds as a hemostatic; and the juice of the leaves is prescribed to stop hemorrhages and in dysentery.

Name: Baggibuti, Kirimar (Punjab)
Uses: On abscesses caused by the guinea-worm the bruised leaves are applied.

Name: Hedge Woundwort (Eng.)
Uses: The plant is employed as tonic and diuretic. The plant is having antispasmodic, expectorant, emetic, emmenagogue, and sedative properties. It is used in gout, pain in the joints, cramps, falling sickness, and vertigo.  The crushed leaves are applied on wounds as a hemostatic; and the juice of the leaves is prescribed to stop hemorrhages and in dysentery.

Name: Kariyartharani
Uses: Bark infusion is used in diarrhoea and dysentery. Leaves used in  cardiac troubles and nose ulcers.

Name: Bog stitchwort (Eng.)
Uses: Decoction of leaves used as a galactagogue.

Name: Morolia (Assam)
Uses: Aerial parts contain vitamin-E. It is used in bone fracture.

Name: Nukachuni (Beng.)
Uses: Dried plants used as a demulcent.

Name: Gindaru (Garhwal)
Uses:
Tubers are used in pulmonary tuberculosis, asthma, and intestinal complaints and also show hypoglycaemic action. Tubers contain several alkaloids: palmitine exhibits antibiotic
activity; stepharine anti-cholinesterase activity; cycleanine anti-infiammatory action; and hyndarine sedative action. Tetrahydro palmatine produces sedative and anticonvulsive effects on animals at a dose of 100-150 mg/kg body weight; the neurosedative effect is similar but we

Name: Musakani, Vanatiktika (Sans.)
Uses: Roots useful for fevers, diarrhoea, dyspepsia, and urinary diseases. Of the alkaloids present in the plant, mostly concentrated in the rhizome, the alkaloid aknadine shows significant antispasmodic

Name: Kavalam (Tam.)
Uses: In Pholipppins the fruit is considerd as cooling and laxative.

Name: Jangli badam
Uses: The oil from the seed is used as carminative and mild laxative. Decoction of fruit is mucilaginous and astrigent.In Java the fruit is used in gonorrhoea.

Name: Rusty Sterculai (Eng.)
Uses: The fruit is used as mild laxative.

Name: Gular, Gulu
Uses: To facilitate delivery the pregnant woman is given pulverized bark. A mucilage is obtained from the leaves and tender shoots when steeped in water which is used for pleuropneumonia in cattle. Leaves are rich in vitamin A and is given as fodder.

Name: Parral, Pader
Uses: Decoction of roots are used to treat asthma, cough, excessive thirst and leaves are used  in chronic dyspepsia.

Name: Parral, Pader
Uses: Decoction of roots are used to treat asthma, cough, excessive thirst and leaves are used in chronic dyspepsia.

Name: Gadh-mehal (Kumaun)
Uses: Leaves yield hydrocyanic acid.

Name: Siora, Karchanua
Uses:
Leaves are used as galactagogue.Leaves poultice is applied to swellings and bufoes. Poultice of roots are used to treat ulcers, sinuses,swellings and boils. Pulverized roots are used to treat dysentery. Decoction of roots are used in treatment of fever, diarrhea and dysentery.Latex is astringent, antiseptic and applied to sore heels.chapped hands and glandular swellings. Seeds are used in epistaxis, piles, diarrhea and applied externally
 as paste in

Name: Agia
Uses: It is utilized to revitilize appetite

Name: Missi
Uses: It is considered to be useful in diabetes, but it lacks hypoglycaemic activity.

Name: Maruadana
Uses: Leaves have astringent, diuretic, and lithontriptic properties.

Name: Rum (Assam)
Collector: Reporter on Economic Products to the Government of India
Uses: Leaves have astringent, diuretic, and lithontriptic properties.

Name: Karun Kurinji (Tam.)
Uses: Essential oil obtained from flower.

Name: Neivalli (Tam.)
Uses: Tinctures are prepared from the seeds.

Name: Mothira-kanjiram (Mal.)
Uses: Roots are used in diarrhea. It also form an ingredient of a liniment for pains in joints.

Name: Valli-kanjiram (Madras)
Uses: Decoction of roots are used in  treatment of rheumatism, ulcers, elephantiasis, fevers, and epilepsy.

Name: Kuchila lata
Uses:
It is used for the same medicinal purpose as in S. nux-vomica.  
Wood is  used as a tonic in dyspepsia, malarial infections and  in cutaneous troubles
Leaves and roots are boiled in oil and applied to treat rheumatic swellings. 
Roots are  purgative, febrifuge and anthelmintic. Roots are  used in cutaneous troubles.

Name: Pipita
Uses: Seeds have alexipharmac and nervine tonic properties which is used in treatment of dropsy, rheumatism,  cholera, asthma,and piles.

Name: Bailewa, Kajra
Uses:
Nux-vomica consists of dry ripe seeds which is used as a tonic, stimulant, febrifuge and in preparations 
for nervous disorders. 
Seeds are prescribed in colic and acts as an emetic. 
Seeds also form a constituent of medicated preparations for the scalp.
Leaves are used as  poultice on sloughing wounds and maggot infested ulcers. 
Roots and bark is  febrifuge.
Decoction of bark is  used in epilepsy.  
Juice of fresh wood is used in treatment of  dysen

Name: Nirmali, Nelmal
Uses:
Seeds are stomachic, demulcent and emetic
Seeds are  used in diarrhoea, diabetes, gonorrhea and for eye troubles.

Name: Luban, Loban
Uses:
Benzoin is carminative and diuretic and is  an ingredient of preparations inhaled in catarrh.
 It is also employed as a fixative. In veterinary medicine, it is applied to indolent sores and foul ulcers.

Name: Lunak, Chhoti-lani
Uses: Plants have wooly excrescences on the tips of branches which are applied in an oily medium to cure sores on camel backs. Aqueous infusion applied as an emetic.

Name: Bui (Kashmir)
Uses: Used as a tonic and febrifuge.

Name: Pahari kiretta, Mitha kirayat
Uses: Whole plant is used to treat malarial fever.

Name: Kadavi (Mar.)
Uses:
Decoction of plant is used as tonic. Plant is used as subsitute for Chirayita in treatment of malaria 
and other fever.

Name: Ludh
Uses: Bark is  used in ophthalmia and to check threatened abortion.

Name: Lodha
Uses:
Bark is  astringent and is used in diarrhoea, dysentery, liver complaints, and dropsy. 
Bark is  also used for ophthalmia and conjunctivitis. Decoction is used to stop bleeding of gums.
In combination with sugar, bark  is used for menorrhagia and other uterine disorders.

Name: Mudiyendra pacha (Mal.)
Uses: Leaves are  laxative. Leaves enter into embrocations and used in treating of rheumatism.

Name: Hiasmin (Kashmir)
Uses: Leaves and bark contain syringin and the enzymes emulsion and invertase.

Name: Laung, Lavanga
Uses: Clove Oil is used as a local analgesic for hypersensitive dentines and cavities and also used for external application as a rubefacient and internally as a carminative and antispasmodic medication.

Name: Jaman, Jam
Uses: Decoctions of bark and powdered seeds are used in diabetes treatment. Bark used in gargles and mouthwashes.

Name: Gulabjaman (Hindi & Mal.)
Uses: Essential oil is obtained from leaves.

Name: Bhedas (Mar.)
Uses: Leaf and root decoction used as a vermifuge.

Name: Chandni, Tagar
Scientific Name: Tabernaemontana divaricata (L.) R.Br. ex Roem. & Schult.
Uses: Root is employed as a local anodyne and chewed for relief from tooth-ache.

Name: Vrahikanda
Uses: Roots are used in dysentery.

Name: Genda, Gultera
Uses: Infusion of herb is  used against rheumatism, cold, and bronchitis. Root extract is laxative. Leaves are used in renal  troubles and muscular pains and applied to boils and carbuncles. Leaves and floreis are used as an emmenagogue.Its infusion is prescribed as a carminative, diuretic, and vermifuge. Florets are used in eye troubles.

Name: Imli, Amli
Uses: Fruit-Pulp is a refrigerant, carminative and laxative, given as infusion in biliousness and febrile conditions.

Name: Dulal, Barau
Uses: Rhizomes and roots constitute the drug taraxacum which is used as a mild laxative, and increases the flow of bile. It is also used as a diuretic, stomachic, hepatic stimulant, and tonic.

Name: Kankra (Beng.)
Uses: Fruit is mashed and applied to boils to promote suppuration

Name: East-Indian Moneywort (Eng.)
Uses: Leaves used as a poultice for sloughing wounds.

Name: Thuno, Birmi
Uses:
Leaves are antispasmodic and emmenagogue. It is used to treat nervousness, hysteria
 and epilepsy and act as lithontripic.A tincture prepared from young shoot is used to treat headache, giddiness, feeble and falling pulse,coldness of extremities,diarrhea and severe biliousness. Freshy arils are carminative,stomachic, expectorant.

Name: Sonapatti (Tam.)
Uses: Roots are vermifuge and tonic.

Name: Rugtrora, Roheda
Uses: Bark is used for syphilis.

Name: Sagun, Sagwan
Uses: Flowers and seeds are diuretic. Bark is astringent and used in bronchitis.

Name: Lashtia, Masethi
Uses: Bark and leaves used as a fish-poison. Plants also show insecticidal properties. Piscicidal and insecticidal properties are due to the presence of rotenoids.

Name: Jand, Chaunkra
Uses: Tonic, laxative, diuretic, and deobstruent; used in bronchitis and bilious febrile attacks, and also for boils, pimples, and bleeding piles.

Name: Kanthalu (Sans.)
Uses: Leaves are boiled and used in syphilis.

Name: Runchhalisarpankho (Guj.)
Uses: Juice of leaves given in dropsy and fresh roots considered hypoglycaemic.

Name: Mashoni, Mashparui
Uses: Used in rheumatism, tuberculosis, nervous infections, hemoptysis and catarrh. Fruits astringent, stomachic, and febrifuge.

Name: Asan, Sain
Uses: Bark decoction is used in treatment of diarhhoea and ulcers.

Name: Arjuna
Uses: Bark yields steptic, diuretic antidysenteric and febrifuge tonic and also gives relief in symptomatic hypertension. A tonic and a deobstruent is obtained from the fruit.  Leaf Juice used in treatment of ear-ache.

Name: Bahera
Uses: Fruits are used in the treatment of cough, hoarseness and scorpion sting  and form a constituent of triphala, which is an important Ayurvedic medicine

Name: Safed chuglam (Andamans)
Uses: Bark extract is a cardiac stimulant.

Name: Deshi Badam
Uses: Bark is diuretic, anti-dysenteric and cardiotonic. Leaves used in the treatment of rheumatic joints, scabies and cutaneous infections.

Name: Harre
Uses: Fruits have laxative, stomachic, and tonic properties that form a constituent of triphala, which is an important Ayurvedic medicine

Name: Hritaki (Beng.)
Uses: Bark yields a cardiac stimulant and diuretic.

Name: Tani (Tel.)
Uses: Bark yields a  cardiotonic and diuretic.

Name: Pnisaj (Beng.)
Uses: A cardiac stimulant is obtained from the bark.

Name: Tellakaraka (Tel.)
Uses: Bark yields diuretic medicine.

Name: Kinjal (Mar.)
Uses: Bark is diuretic and cardiotonic.

Name: Kamoni (Kan.)
Uses: Bark has astringent properties which is used in dysentery.

Name: Anaittichal (Tam.)
Uses: Decoction of leaves is along  with rice gruel and used in aphthae.

Name: Kanukpa (Nepal & Bengal)
Uses: Fruits are used in treating dysentery

Name: Bora-asing (Assam)
Uses: Dried fruit has stimulant, carminative and stomachic properties.

Name: Wall-Germander
Uses: It is having diuretic and sudorific properties. It is used in rheumatism and spleen disorders.

Name: Felty germander (Eng.)
Uses: It contains essential oil.

Name: Water-Germander (Eng.)
Uses: The plant is having antiseptic, stimulant and sudorific properties. It is given in cough and phthisis. The infusion of plant is having  laxative properties and given in piles. The plant extract is employed  in lupus and actinomycosis.  The leaves and flowering tops are  employed as diaphoretic and vermifuge.

Name: Pilazari, Mamiri
Uses: Roots decoction, extract or powder are  much useful for ophthalmia. Also used as purgative, diuretic, atonic dyspepsia and bitter tonic during convalescence.

Name: Dwarf meadow Rue (Eng.)
Uses: Infusion of leaves or a decoction made from  roots applied as a febrifuge. Roots useful for eye troubles

Name: Chocolate Tree (Eng.)
Uses: Raw seeds contain vitamins of B group; shells of fermented sun-dried beans contain appreciable quantity of vitamin D.

Name: Parsipu, Porush
Uses: In case of cutaneous infections the bark, leaves, flowers and fruits are used. A fatty oil is derived from the seeds which are utilized in skin troubles. The bark, roots and fruits are having astringent property and thus employed in dysentery and hemorrhoids.

Name: Pile kaner, Zard kunel
Uses:
Tincture of bark is cathartic and emetic and is used as febrifuge. Leaves are purgative and emetic. 
Roots are made into a plaster and applied to tumours. Seeds are used as an abortifacient and purgative
 in treatment of  rheumatism , dropsy and also used as an alexeteric.

Name: Common Penycress (Eng.)
Uses: Herb is used as a diuretic and blood purifier. Seeds stimulant, may be eaten with caution as a condiment.

Name: Morepankhi, Mayurpankh
Uses: Leaves are tonic, diuretic and antipyretic.

Name: Black-Eyed Susan (Eng.)
Uses: Pounded leaves applied in case of headache.

Name: Mulluta
Uses: Decoction of leaves is given in stomach complaints. Leaves are rich in potassium compounds.

Name: Purple allamanda (Eng.)
Uses: Leaf juice is given in menorrhagia and to cure deafness

Name: Banajwain
Uses: Leaves and floral shoots employed for suppression of urine and menstruation and for convulsive and whooping-coughs; also used as a sedative in radiculagia and epilepsy. Seeds vermifuge

Name: Common Thyme (Eng.)
Uses: Thyme contains an oil which is having antiseptic, antispasmodic, and carminative properties and is used in gargles, mouthwashes and formulations for the treatment of whooping-cough and bronchitis. Thymol is a significant germicide and also  having antifungal and anthelmintic properties. It is used against hookworms and is an ingredient of deodorants, mouthwashes, dentifrices and gargles.

Name: Bega, Bhaga
Uses: Roots rubed with stones and mixed with water; mixture use for cure of venomus snake by some community.According to Mhaskar and Caius root is not an antidote of venom.

Name: Amrita, Giloe
Uses: Stem has many Ayurvedic preparations useful in general debility, urinary diseases, dyspepsia, fever. Dry twigs with intact bark constitutes the drug. Bitter drug show antispasmodic. antipyretic, anti-inflammatory properties. The drug have one-fifth of the analgesic effect of sodium salicylate. A kind of starch called Giloe-ka-sat, prepared from aqueous extract of dry stems, is used as a tonic. Experiments conducted on rabbits indicate that aqueous and

Name: Giloe, Gulancha
Uses: Used almost in the same way as T. cordifolia

Name: Jangli-kalimirch, Kanj
Uses: Root-bark has diaphoretic, stomachic, and antipyretic properties

Name: Tun, Mahanim
Uses: Bark is used for treating chronic dysentery in infants and used in adults for treating ulcers.

Name: Kakapu (Mal.)
Uses: Leaf extract used in treating gonorrhoea.

Name: Akhahilata (Assam)
Uses:
Bark is febrifuge, anthelmintic and galactagogue, used in the form of liquid extract or tincture for 
treatment of  chronic diarrhoea, asthma, cardiac troubles and  also used as an haemostatic. Leaves
 used in treatment of  beri-beri, dropsy, and congested liver. Latex is applied to sores, ulcers, tumours,
 and rheumatic swellings. Flowers yield an essential oil and the alkaloid picrinine acts as a depressant on
 the central nervous system. Ash of the

Name: Zangiber copal (Eng.)
Uses:
Resin is astringent,
anthelmintic, diuretic, and emmenagogue.

Name: Ajowan, Ajwain
Uses: Fruits (Ajowan, omum) are stimulant, antispasmodic, tonic and arminative, administered in flatulence, atonic dyspepsia,and diarrhoea, and also often recommended in cholera. Ajowan is used for relaxed sore throat and bronchitis and is a common ingredient of cough mixtures. A paste of crushed fruits is applied to the abdomen externally for relief from colic. It shows antibiotic activity and is used in lotions and ointments applied for checking chronic d

Name: Ajmud, Ajmod
Uses: Decoction made from the fruits (commonly called as seeds) has been used by the Egyptions for urethral spasm and to cause passage of kidney stones. It is also used for renal colic. fruits contains khellin, which is useful as a vasodilator and antispasmodic.

Name: Barhanta
Uses: The roots paste is applied for extraction of guinea worm. The paste is mixed with Ocimum sanctumjuice  and is applied to itchy eruptions on the skin. A medicinal preparation made from the fruit is a constituent of Kshara Guda which is employed for enlarged spleen. 

Name: Bucks-beard (Eng.)
Uses: Ligulate florets  are  used in the form of tincture for circulatory and respiratory diseases.

Name: Oyester-Plant (Eng.)
Uses: Roots are  antibilious, deobstruent, diuretic, pectoral, and expectorant.

Name: Singhara
Uses: The plant is used to treat cough, dropsy and bronchitis.

Name: Gio
Uses: Plants are used as astringent and abortifacient properties and used in abdominal troubles.

Name: Bhillaura, Gamhar
Uses: The root decotiion is employed as stomachic and alterative in flatulence, gout, rheumatism, etc.

Name: Gokhru
Uses: Leaves are rich in calcium but poor in iron. Fruits are used as tonic and diuretic also used in painful micturition and calculous infections also prescribed in Bright?s disease. Leaves are stomachic, used as lithontriptic. Roots are aperient.

Name: Kapia kushi (Beng.)
Uses: Bark and leaves decoction yields a bitter tonic, given in cholera treatment.

Name: African Barbbell (Eng.)
Uses: It is diuretic and emollient. A hot poultice of leaves are applied to inflammations. ?

Name: Chhota-kulpha, Ratmandi
Uses:
Herb is emollient and diuretic and prescribed for expulsion of dead foetus. Infusion of leaves are depurative.
 Roots are used in treatment of dysentery,pounded and applied to swellings of joints.

Name: Hetenuria
Uses:
Leaves are emollient,demulcent, diuretic. Pulverized roots are applied to wounds as
 analgesic.

Name: Brahmadandi
Uses:
The plant is helpful in curing kapha,vata,inflammation. It is useful in curing leucoderma and skin 
diseases. It is nervine tonic and is used in seminal debility.

Name: Lal indrayan, Mahakal
Uses: Roots are mixed with coconut oil and applied on sores. Roots are used as a paste in carbuncles.

Name: Bhumikumra, Patol (Beng.)
Uses:
Roots are tonic. Pulverized roots are used for treating enlargement of spleen, liver and disorders of 
other viscera. Fresh roots are used with oil for treating leprous ulcers.

Name: Jangli-chachinda
Uses:
Fruits and roots are carthatic.Roots are used in treatment of bronchitis
.Leaves is used for treating biliousness and its juice is applied to bald patches of alopecia.
 Seeds are antihelmintic and antifebrile.

Name: Parwal
Uses:
Fruits are used for convalescents and they are laxative and easily digestible.
Fruits help in controlling cancer like conditions as well.

Name: Palval
Uses: Roots are purgative. Fruits are used to treat dental problems.

Name: Muzuumtong (Local name)
Uses: Leaves are applied at abdomen after miscarriage in Malaya.

Name: Egyptian clover (Eng.)
Uses:
Used chiefly as a green fodder, silage, hay, and pasture; valued because of good palatability, big protein and calcium, and
phosphorus content.

Name: Trepatra, Chit-batto (Punjab)
Uses: Herb used for sore eyes and as a salve for burns. Flowers depurative and sedative; their extract used for corns and cancerous ulcers.

Name: White clover (Eng.)
Uses: A ricb source of crude protein, calcium, and phosphorus. May sometimes prove toxic because of the presence of a cyanogenetic glycoside.

Name: Kasuri Methi, Marwari Methi
Uses:
Fruits bitter, astringent and
styptic. Applied to swellings and bruises.

Name: Methi, Muthi
Uses:
Seeds aromatic, carminative, tonic, and galactagogue; also used in poultices for boils and ulcers and given internally as an
emollient in intestinal inflammation.

Name: Chainhari (Delhi)
Uses: Seeds antidiarrhoeic.

Name: Ban Methi
Uses: Beans used as antiinflammatory, anodyne, diuretic, emmenagogue.

Name: Cheeninaranghi
Uses: Ripe fruits used in cold and cough.

Name: Burweed (Eng.)
Uses: Fruits and leaves are mucilaginous and astrigent. In Brazil decoction of herb is used to cure gonorrhoea.

Name: Pandre (Mar.)
Uses: Roots used in treating fistula and leprosy.

Name: Watpan
Uses: Leaves are demulcent, diuretic, expectorant, and sudorific and used in coughs, colds and asthma.It is  also used in dyspepsia, diarrhoea, rheumatism, and nervous disorders.  Smoke produced by burning the herb has anticholinergic and antihistaminic effect .Flowers are used as a demulcent in gargles and  their decoction in eye troubles.

Name: Bhindodi, Bhui-dari (Bombay)
Collector: Cecil J Saldanha, S.R. Ramesh and N.S. Ravindra
Uses:
Roots and leaves are emetic and purgative, used as a substitute of Ipecacuanha
 (Ctphaelis ipecacuanha A. Rich,). Poultice of leaves are applied to unhealthy ulcers and wounds to 
induce granulation. Decoction of roots is used as a febrifuge.

Name: Jangli-pikvam, Antamul
Uses:
Roots are stimulant, emetic, cathartic, expectorant, stomachic,diaphoretic,  and used in treatment of 
 asthma, bronchitis, whooping cough, dysentery, and diarrhea. Roots are  also applied in rheumatic 
and gouty pains.

Name: Nanjaruppan (Tam. & Mal.)
Uses:
It is used in treatment of urtecaria, excessive perspiration, bilious swellings, and smallpox. 
Decoction of roots are an antidote in arsenic poisoning. Leaves are used for treatment of scabies.

Name: Kath-kutha
Uses: Medicinally used as a powerful astringent.

Name: Dieng-kha-riu (Khasi Hills)
Uses: Used in dysentery, diarrhoea; enlarged spleen and liver; also for the treatment of pustules, tumours and fistula.

Name: Pithran
Uses: Whole plant used in anticatarrhal and alterative. Leaves used in diarrhoea. Root used in prescriptions for intermittent fevers, pulmonary inflammation and as a recuperating tonic.

Name: Dabra, Pithavan
Uses: Leaves use as antiseptic, for urinary discharges and genitourinary infections. Root used for cough, chills andfevers.

Name: Salaparni (Sans.)
Uses: Decoction of leaves antipyretic.

Name: Bachita, Unga
Uses: Decoction of stem and roots are used for flatulent colic. Flowers are  expectorant;their infusion applied in aphthae and sore throat.

Name: Jatjotiya (Oriya)
Uses: Roots and barks are used in hydrophobia.

Name: Kunjuya, Lotloti
Uses: Roots used as emollient and refrigerant also used in external applications for lumbago. Leaves applied in inflammation of intestines and bladder. Infusion of flowers useful in bronchitis.

Name: Jangli piyaz, Ban piyazi
Uses:
Bulbs are used as a cardiotonic, stimulant, expectorant, and diuretic; alcoholic extract are anticancer on human epidermoid carcinoma of the nasopharynx, dropsy,
rheumatism and skin troubles.

Name: Bichhu booti
Uses: In USSR, leaves are used in medicine known as Alochol which is used for chronic hepatitis, cholengitis cholecystisis and habitual constipation. It is powerfully diuretic. Roots and seeds are prescribed in diarrhoea and intestinal worms. Infusion of leaves and roots used as a hair-stimulant and for cleaning dandruff.

Name: Paharah-bichuti
Uses: Roots are used for treatment of fractures and dislocations. Leaves and inflorescences prescribed as a tonic and a cleaning agent after parturition. Decoction of herb given as a febrifuge.

Name: Chotajhangi (Beng.)
Uses: It is used to treat urinary troubles.

Name: Pulichan (Tam.)
Uses:
Decoction of root-bark given to women at the lime of delivery to control fitus; also used in rheumatism, bowel complaint and eczema. Leaves prescribed in
rheumatism, jaundice, biliousness, and fevers.

Name: Musna, Sabuni
Uses: Plants are used in liver disease.

Name: Common Valerian (Eng.)
Uses:
Rhizomes and roots constitute the drug alerian which is an antispasmodic with depressant effect on
 central nervous system. Rhizomes are used in hysteric, hypochondriasis, nervous unrest, and 
emotional states. It also act as  stimulant and carminative. It is used for fevers and asthenic 
inflammations. Drug contains an essential oil which is  used as a tonic & stimulant in medicinal
 preparations.

Name: Tagger, Shumeo
Uses: Rhizomes and roots are,a good substitute of the drug valerian.

Name: Mushkbala
Uses:
It is  used for treatment of  hysteria, hypochondriasis, nervous unrest, and emotional troubles, and act as 
a carminative. Pulverized drug is mixed with sugar and used in treatment of  urinary troubles. Decoction
 is  used as a sedative after parturition. Rhizomes and roots are  used as a tonic and stimulant. Drug has 
yielded a new group of iridoid or monoterpenic derivatives known as a valepotriates which
  used as tranquillizers and sedatives in f

Name: Ramsar, Chamari-ki-vel
Uses:
Latex is applied to wounds and sores. Bark is  astringent, and forms a constituent of Vishagarabha taila, 
an Ayurvedic medicine.

Name: Ponnamponmarva (Mal.)
Uses: Flowers dried, powdered  for consumption, asthma, and maniac troubles. Plants juice for totemper the bile and abate frenzy.

Name: Banda, Nai
Uses:
Leaves juice used in the ear in otitis and other inflammatory conditions. Roots used in fiver, dyspepsia, bronchitis, and rheumatism; It's antibacterial and antitubcrcular
properties; modicated oils of roots used externally on rheumatic
swelling and nervous troubles.

Name: Safed domar, Kahruba
Uses:
Resin is considered tonic carminative and expectorant and used for chronic bronchitis and throat troubles, piles, diarrhoea, rheumatism, tubercular
glands, and boils. It forms a constituent of an ointment for carbuncles and is a good emollient for plasters and ointment bases.

Name: Pitti, Raidhani
Uses:
Stem bark powdered and
mixed with sesame oil, externally applied to skin diseases and sprains. Root bark used for atonic dyspepsia, mild fever and debility. Sap used for the treatment of deafness.

Name: Pitti
Uses:
Root bark used in atonic dyspepsia, debility and skin
diseases.

Name: Gadartambaku
Uses:
Leaf juice has sedative aod astringent ptoperties and is used in diarrhoea and dysentery and skin
eruptions.

Name: Gidar tamaku, Ban tamaku
Uses: Leaf and fruit extract is used in diarrhoea and pulmonary diseases.

Name: Shutthi (Tam.)
Uses: Infusion of bark is  used as a febrifuge.

Name: Sahadevi
Uses: Infusion of the herb  with quinine acts against malaria. Juice is  given in incontinence of urine. Roots are bitter and is used as an anthelmintic, their decoction is given in diarrhoea and stomach-ache. Its  juice is used  for cough and colic. Flower is used in fevers, rheumatism and conjunctivitis. Seeds are anthelmintic and alexipharmic and is effective aganist threadworms and roundworms. It is also given for cough, flatulence, intestinal colic, d

Name: Grey Vernonia (Eng.)
Uses: Herb is  used for ulcers and wounds. It is  also given for dropsy and dysmenorrhoea.

Name: Titlokia (U.P.)
Uses: The roots of the plant is utilized in the preparation of gargles. The herb is having antiscorbutic properties.

Name: Corn speedwell (Eng.)
Uses: The plant is having diaphoretic, diuretic, and stimulant properties. The herb acclerates appetite . Herb is having antiscorbutic and  diuretic properties. It is employed in scurvy and scrofulous infections, especially of the skin. It is also used for bladder troubles as it is supposed to pulverize stones in the bladder.

Name: Brooklime (Eng.)
Uses: The herb revitalizes appetite.  Herb is having antiscorbutic and  diuretic properties. It is employed in scurvy and scrofulous infections, especially of the skin. It is also used for bladder troubles as it is supposed to pulverize stones in the bladder.

Name: Khasa, Bena
Uses: Oil is diaphoretic, stimulant used in colic, flatulence, and obstinate vomiting. Affords relief when applied in rheumatism, lumbago, and sprains.

Name: Dieng-soh-leng (Khasi Hills)
Collector: Reporter on Economic Products to the Government of India
Uses: Leaf juice used in menorrhagia and leaf is substituted for Viburnum bark  for use in uterine sedatives and yields a foetid smelling volatile oil.

Name: Bakla, Kala matar
Uses:
Beans used as in hemolytic
anaemia, hemoglobinuria, jaundice, etc. Decoction of leafy shoots used as a diuretic.

Name: Jhunjhuni ankari, Mun-muna
Uses:
Seed extract gave non-specific agglutinating reactions with
human blood.

Name: Narrow-Leaved Vetch (Eng.)
Uses: Seeds used for deleterious effect on the nervous system.  Decoction of seeds used in smallpox and measles.

Name: Moth, Bhringga
Uses:
Pulse is given as diet to cases
of flatulence and fever.

Name: Urd
Uses: Pulse is used in rheumatism and nervous and hepatic diseases; also in dropsy and cephalagia as a diuretic. Root narcotic, used for aching bones.

Name: Mung, Pessara
Uses: Decoction of seeds given in beri-beri as a diuretic. Seeds also used for vertigo. Mungo extract is said to have curative properties in polyneuritis gallinarum.

Name: Mugam, Trianguli
Uses: Leaves sedative, used in cataplasm for weak eyes; also used in irregular fever in the form of decoction.

Name: Sutri, Ghurush
Uses: Plant is a good source of vitamin C.

Name: Lobia, Riantshi
Uses:
Seeds is considered
antibilious and prescribed in hepatic troubles and jaundice.

Name: Swallow-Wort (Eng.)
Uses: Roots are emetic.

Name: Banfsa, Dundi Birali
Uses: Flowers have diaphoretic, emollient and pectoral   property. Leaves used as emollient and laxative.

Name: Jinkobanafsha (Guj.)
Uses: Roots emetic

Name: Spreding white violet (Eng.)
Uses: Flowers useful in treatment of infections of the chest as pectoral.

Name: China violet (Eng.)
