Uses: Herb is bruised and applied to foul soresand ulcers; it is also used in treatment of scrofula, syphilis and biliousness. In Chinese medicine prescribed against cancerous growth. Dried flowersis used as purgative, also prescribed for coughs and colds, and used in preparation of Unani medicines, like Rogan-banafshah and Joshanda.

Name: Banafshah
Uses:
Herb is the main ingredient of Joshanda, a Unani medicine used in the form of decoction for coughs and colds.Constitutes a part of commercial Banafshah and is considered to possess medicinal properties more or less similar to those of V. odorata. A medicinal oil,
Rogan-i-banafshah, is prepared from it. A decoction of flowers given for improvement in general complexion.

Name: Wood violet (Eng.)
Uses: Used as a pectoral.

Name: Garden Pansey (Eng.)
Uses: It is used as diaphoretic, stimulant  and diuretic, used to cure disorders of blood, rheumatism and cutaneous troubles. Decoction made from leaves and flowers is prescribed as an expectorant and is used for asthma, epilepsy,and diseases specially for infants, shows antimicrobial and antimycotic activity. Root purgative and emetic,  Infusion treats dysentery in children.

Name: Budu, Pand
Uses: It acts as febrifuge and paste is applied to cuts.

Name: Kuchle-ka-malang
Uses: Resin is applied on bone fracture.

Name: Baandaa
Uses:
Poultice of the leaves are used for neuralgia. Ashes of the plant are rubbed on body 
for treatment of itch.

Name: Monk's Pepper-Tree (Eng.)
Uses: Seeds used in colic.

Name: Bhadu (Bihar)
Uses: Bark and roots astringent.

Name: Sherus (Mar.)
Uses: Roots have febrifugic and astringent properties.

Name: Nirgundi, Sambhalu (Punjabi)
Uses: Leaves have tonic and vermifuge properties. Roots used in rheumatism, dyspepsia and as an anthelmintic, in dysenteryand piles. Flowers used in diarrhoea, fever, and liver complaints.

Name: Minjurgorwa, Nagpheni
Uses: Leaf and bark infusion is used in malaria and black water fevers.

Name: Nowlieragu (Tel.)
Uses: Bark Decoction is used for stomach-ache and pounded leaves applied to wounds.

Name: Pani-ki-sanbhalu, Sufed-sanbhalu
Uses: Leaves pounded and applied in rheumatic swellings, inflammations, and sprains. Flowers used in controlling vomit.

Name: Angur dakh
Uses: Dried fruits, seedless nourishing and invigorating. Used for cough, respiratory tract catarrh, subacute cases of enlarged liver and spleen.

Name: Wakeri (Mar.)
Uses: Fruits used as tonic for body pain.

Name: Khar dudhi (Beng.)
Uses: Used as febrifuge, emollient  and p u r g a t i v e . Roots chewed and decoction made from root is used to restrict internal hemorrhages; their decoction is applied for internal hemorrhages  and to induce fecundity in women.  Flowers and root-bark are useful against thrush.

Name: Nak-chhikni
Uses:
Plant juice is  used as a sternutatory. Roots and tender stalks are emetic and purgative.  
Leaves are used in applications for boils and abscesses.

Name: Sonki (Beng.)
Uses: Leaf is used to treat headache,cut, stomachache.

Name: Bhanra, Bhangra
Uses: Decoction of the plant is used in treating uterine haemorrhage and menorrhagia. Leaves are used in treating cough, cephalagia, skin diseases and alopecia. Infusion of plant is used to treat swelling of the abdomen.

Name: Parbatijeera (Oriya)
Uses: The plant is helpful in curing wounds.

Name: Small-Leaf Salago (Eng.)
Uses: Bark is purgative.

Name: Akri, Punir
Uses: Fruits are  emetic, sedative, and diuretic and  used inchronic hepatic complaints. In dried form it is  employed for dyspepsia, flatulent colic,and other intestinal complaints. Fruits are also used for asthma, biliousness, and strangury.

Name: Punir, Asgandh
Uses:
Roots are used  for treating hiccup, cough, dropsy, rheumatism, and female disorders, and as a sedative in cases of senile debility. 
It is useful for inflammatory Conditions like ulcers, and scabies in the form of external applications.  Leaves are used as a febrifuge and applied to lesions, painful swellings, and sore eyes.

Name: Dhai, Dhava
Uses: Dried flowers are used as an astringent and stimulant. A Commercially available drug made of dried fruits, flowers, buds and broken pieces of inflorescences is much used in bowel complaints, hemorrhages, menorrhagia, and seminal weakness.

Name: Indrajau, Mitha-indrajau
Uses: Bark and seeds  are used in flatulence and bilious troubles. Seeds are aphrodisiac and anthelmintic.

Name: Dudhi, Dharauli
Uses: Seeds yield a thick red coloured medicinal oil.

Name: Banokra, Gokhru
Uses: Herb is  diaphoretic, diuretic, emollient, and sedative. Decoction is used in treating chronic malaria, leueorrhoea, and urinary diseases.  Buds are tonic, diuretic, and sedative. Seeds are used for resolving inflammatory swellings and their oil for bladder infections, herpes, and erysipelas. Fruits contain anti-inflammatory activity. It is added to pharmaceutical preparations or food products for regulation of hormonal activity and treatment of urino

Name: Mainphal
Uses:
They are emetic and used as a substitute for Ipecacuanha (Cephaelis ipecacuanha A. Rich.).
 In small doses, it is  expectorant and diaphoretic.  Bark is astringent .Bark is given in treatment of 
diarrhea and dysentery.Infusion is used as an emetic. Bark is a sedative and is used to relieve pains due 
to bruises, and bone-ache during fever. It is also given internally and used externally as an anodyne in 
treatment of  rheumatism.

Name: Pindalu, Panar
Uses:
They are emetic and used as a substitute for Ipecacuanha (Cephaelis ipecacuanha A. Rich.).
 In small doses, it is  expectorant and diaphoretic.  Bark is astringent .Bark is given in treatment of 
diarrhea and dysentery.Infusion is used as an emetic. Bark is a sedative and is used to relieve pains due 
to bruises, and bone-ache during fever. It is also given internally and used externally as an anodyne in 
treatment of  rheumatism.

Name: Kondanakkera (Tel.)
Uses:
Pounded roots is applied in case of gum troubles. Roots and leaf decoction is employed in
jaundice and diarrhoea and also has febrifugic properties. Bark is astringent, and applied to sores.

Name: Jambu, Suria
Uses: Bark and seed oil antileprotic, used for ulcers and piles. A decoction of the bark powder is given with honey as a vermifuge.

Name: Adam's Needle (Eng.)
Uses: Flowers contain aloifoline and active against lung-tumour.

Name: Yucca (Marathi)
Uses: Fruit purgative and plants used in rheumatism, oedema, sores, ulcers; also for dysentery, phthisis, bronchitis, asthma, hemorrhagic and septicaemia.

Name: Chirpoti, Patakona
Uses: Leaves are applied to reduce inflammations and used in the form of antispasmodic and liniment. Decoction of leaves are used as a bath to stop irritation due to boils. Fruits are cathartic and antiseptic and used for cough and asthma. Fresh fruit juice is antidote to the bite of gecko.

Name: Darmar, Nepali Dhaniya
Uses: Seed husk yields essential oil.

Name: Timbur, Timur
Uses: Bark, fruits and seeds have carminative, stomachic and anthelmintic properties.

Name: Tezamul (Assam)
Uses: Roots employed in stomach-ache and toothache, and externally employed in case of boils.

Name: Armadalu (Kan.)
Uses: Seeds have sudorific and febrifugic properties, and is used in preparing tooth-'powders and medicinal formulations

Name: Mezenga (Assam)
Uses: Bark has stimulant, stomachic, and digestive properties and is used for colic treatment.

Name: Badrang
Uses: Rind oil shows antibacterial properties. Bark has aromatic and tonic, used in curing rheumatism and atonic dyspepsia.

Name: Saatar (Urdu)
Uses: The constituent of the drug- Saatar is obtained from the leaves and stems are imported for medicinal use. The drug infusion is having diaphoretic, diuretic, stimulant, and stomachic properties and it is also given to subside premature labour pains.

Name: Swethuli (Beng.)
Uses: Fleshy roots used as salep.

Name: Ban-ada
Uses: It is stomachic, carminative and stimulant. Useful in diarrhoea and colic.

Name: Adrak
Uses: Dried roots used for many uses as dyspesia, flatulence, colic, vomiting, spasms, and other painfull infection of stomuch and the bowels unattended by fever, cough, cold, asthma, syspesia and indigestion etc.

Name: Gada (Local Name)
Uses: Rhizome hot remedy for coughs, asthma, worm , leprosy and otfrer skin diseases.

Name: Vatadalla (Sans.)
Uses: Leaf use in to purify blood and as an alterative in chronic venereal infections.

Name: Pitni-ber, kandika
Uses:
Bark used for ulcers and wounds. Fruit a nourishing, tonic, emollient, antitussive, antiallergic; protects liver and
prevents stress ulcer formation.
Seed used for dry cough and
skin eruptions. Kernel used in
insomnia.

Name: Baer, Ber
Uses: Fruits used as astringent, anodyne, cooling, stomachic, styptic. Ripe and dry mild laxative, expectorant. Seeds antidiarrhoeal. Kernels anti-spasmodic, sedative, antiemetic. Leaves astringent and diaphoretic. Stem bark used in diarrhoea. Root bark juice purgative, externally applied to rheumatic inflammations and gout.

Name: Jharberi
Uses: Fruit cooling and astringent. used for bilious infections. Leaves used in scabies and other skin diseases.

Name: Makai
Uses: Fruits stomachic. Root given for hyperacidity and ascaris infection.

Name: Churna
Uses: Stem and fruit used in hypotensive.

Name: Samrapani (Guj.)
Uses: Herb used for the treatment of dysentery. Root given to induce sleep.

Name: Alethi (Punjab)
Uses: Infusion of leaves and seeds used in ophthalmia and leucoma. Seeds are anthelmintic.
